All Reviews

  1. would get 5 stars except cleaning stand tells me to replace cartridge after only 1 cleaning. You need to remove and re-insert to use it again (every time).
  2. I have had such a terrible experience with the warranty service on this shaver that I don't know where to begin.<br /><br />It was a great razor, until the base stopped cleaning and charging the razor. Well within the warranty period I contacted customer support, and it appeared as if I would have no problem sending this back for repairs or a new unit. However, now that they've had my razor for 2 months, it's a different story every time I talk to them. I've called 5 times over the past two weeks, and right now I've been on hold for 45 minutes waiting for a supervisor. I don't know if Panasonic is the problem, or this other company called Accent Online (who perhaps handles the warranty?) They clearly have no intention of doing anything for me without extorting a sum of money within 10% of the original purchase price of the shaver.<br /><br />I suppose that it's a fine razor, so long as you plan to toss it after 18 months and buy a new one. I think I'll just go back to a real razor, any time I saved shaving with the electric has been negated trying to get it fixed.
  3. I have only been using this product for a month and I really like it. With this product I almost don't need a mirror to shave myself, I consider it a waste of time. And after the shaving it is (almost) every time perfect. The reason why I decided to buy this shaver is because I got acne from my last shaving machine and I had heard good stories of this one. And yep, no more acne from shaving (give it some weeks, it needs that to get justified to your skin or vice versa). It has really long battery time and you can see it on the display as well, no dust are getting in the shaver since you put it up-sidedown in the cleaning station.<br /><br />Cheers
  4. You get what you pay for. Good shaver = high price.
  5. I was very skeptical about switching from a razor to an electric because I have very sensitive skin, especially around my neck. At first, it was not as close as a shave but after a month now, it is close and smooth without any irritation at all around my neck. Couldn't be happier and is worth it's weight in gold! Spend the extra money for a pain free and fast shave. I don't even need to use it with shaving cream but it is a nice feature to have if I would want to. Amazing product!!!!!
  6. He liked it but in the end found that it was not much different than what he already had. It is pretty noisy and takes a long time for the cleaning process to take place.
  7. Bought this from that largest brick and mortar retailer because I can return it there without paying return shipping charges. I also had Braun Series 7 (790cc) to compare. In terms of design Braun wins hands-down. This Panasonic just looks and feels cheaply made, the shaving head is huge, and trimmer is flimsy, although it gets the job done as well as the well-designed Braun. The cleaning station is far inferior to Braun's as well, with no advanced options or quick clean mode. Also, while the shaving head can move side-to-side and back-and-fro, it's not as smooth of motion as the the Series 7.<br /><br />Where Panasonic wins hands down is shave quality. Braun doesn't come anywhere close. In fact, the Arc4 is so close, it's a bit rough on the skin, and I don't exactly have a baby face. All it takes is some three passes, and it's done. The shaver has a timer, and I timed under a minute for shave! The foil/blade design is so good that it catches onto the hair if you just run it over the face when it's turned off, so I guess their nano-blades aren't just a gimmick.<br /><br />Overall, really wish there was a way to get Panasonic's shave quality and Braun's built and design quality in one unit. I was inclined to give it 3 stars because of the cheap plastic construction, oversized shave head, and mediocre cleaning station, but that wouldn't be fair in light of superior shave quality.
  8. Yes in more way than one. I no longer have in grown hairs and I get a clean close shave

  13. Panasonic Vortex Shaver, the best shave you can get. After being a loyal Braun customer for over twenty-five years I made the switch to Panasonic. Why. Some history. I had owned three Braun Pulsonic shavers in the last 1 1/2 years. I had the same corroding issues with all three shavers, pitting under the foil head, cracking and pealing, flaking of the finish and fading of the engraving. I cleaned my shaver daily using only the Braun cleaner following the Braun instructions. From all the postings and threads on the internet this is not an isolated case. Before Braun was acquired from Proctor & Gamble I was very happy with products from Braun. Its either that they are avoiding correction the design problems that are reported on the internet or they look at the cost benefit analysis and do not see the need to correct what appears to be a common problems with their braun shaver design. Customer service says the same thing over and over....we have not heard that before please send the razor in for evaluation. These issues should have been addressed in the poduct development and testing phase or corrected when brought to light. THE BRAUN PULSONIC SHAVER IS MY LAST BRAUN PRODUCT AND I HAD BEEN A LOYAL BRAUN CUSTOMER FOR OVER TWENTY- FIVE YEARS. With that being said, I researched and liked what I found on the internet regarding the new generation Panasonic Voetex Shavers. Its form meets function. Its the closest shave to a blade shave you will ever get. Cleanup is a breeze and eliminates the corroding related issues of alcohol based cleaning systems. The Panasonic system uses a water based cleaner refill (you can find these priced very low if you do a quick search on Amazon.com) that filters the cleaning solution. The Panasonic Vortex Shaver fits well in the hand and feels very natural to use. The onboard trimmer is easy to use, trim sideburns well and is hidden when not needed. As a plus the Panasonic Vortex can be used in the shower or with shave cream for a barber shop shave. The fit and finish of the Panasonic Vortex Shaver is outstanding. And as a added benefit the shaver is made in Japan, no outsourcing to outside vendors that can effect the quality of the product. I have been very impressed with the Panasonic Vortex Shaver and would highly recommend this shaver. And this comes from someone who judged Braun shavers as the industry benchmark for many years!
  14. PROS: -Very smooth close shave -No razor burn -No rough patches -Works well on a beard that grows in different directions or is a mix of coarse and fine or curly and straight. -Somehow manages to navigate my acne scarring and still give a smooth shave. -Face feels great afterwards -Can use in the shower and with shaving cream. -Shaves better than a traditional razor- at least for me! -Easy to clean. CONS: - Cleaning Unit may not be necessary if you want to save a few dollars. - First day with the shaver. Will check back to let you know how it holds up after continued use. REVIEW I just got the best shave of my life-- from an electric razor. I can't believe how wonderful this Panasonic is! I used it today in the shower with some JASON shaving cream and was absolutely blown away by the results. My face feels smoother than it's ever been after shaving-- with any razor regular or electric. But best of all, I have no pain, no razor burn, and no rough patches. My face feels great! And that's a big thing to say, because up until now absolutely nothing has worked for me. My beard grows in all different directions-- I have extremely coarse hair in some places, and extremely fine hair in others. I've got a little bit of scarring from cystic acne I had as a teenager. And I'm prone to ingrown hairs. I'm like the perfect storm for a painful shave. I've tried just about every regular razor-- from Gillette Fusion to Bump Fighter-- and every kind of expensive shaving cream and have had no luck. Shaving for me has always meant cuts, nicks, bumps, razor burn, and all kinds of other unpleasantness. Electric razors have been even worse. Most of them leave a bumpy stubble from my coarser hairs, while leaving the finer ones nearly untouched. And until now none of them have been able to navigate the acne scarring without leaving big rough patches. Unlike other electric razors I've tried, the Panasonic shaved my whole face in just over twominutes, without a lot of back and forth over the same spots and with no irritation at all. There's not a rough spot anywhere-- even around the the areas of acne scarring that I've always struggled with. Because it's water proof, you can clean it right under your faucet with a little bit of soap and water. It even has a high speed vibration mode to make cleaning easier. It takes about 40 seconds to get the razor completely clean in this way. Because of this self contained cleaning feature, if you want to save a few dollars, it may not be necessary to invest in the top of the line model with the cleaning unit. However this razor is so good, it's certainly worth the cost.
  15. First off this is a beautiful piece of machinery that seems to be well built.For the size of the shaver you would think it weighs 5lbs but it is very light for its size and sleek piano finish a nice touch. Very easy to use and very easy to clean The first day I got it in the mail I was very excited to use it. It took me 10 min to skim the manual and to set it up. The next morning I turned it on with the surprise as to how loud it was, kinda sounds like the clippers they use at the barber shop. About half way through the shave it nicked me pretty good and started to bleed. That was the first and only time this razor has nicked me or cause any other irritations and i think it was lack of experience or a imperfection in my face. For the most part this razor over the last 2 months has cut as good or better than my mach3 I have been using for years but with out the irritation and cuts. With the mack3 I could only shave every other day or so but with the Panasonic i walk out the door with that baby face look every morning. The only time I have trouble shaving with the Panasonic is when it is humid outside and the razor sticks to my face but when that happens I just take it in the shower with me. In the shower it feels like I am getting a closer shave but when I look in the mirror after I am done the dry shave does a much better job.I am absolutely astounded by the fact that it gets close to my face with almost no razor burn. Their are some spots on my face that are a little hard to cut and require me to stretch my skin to get that close cut but it is worth it. The cleaner and charger has it pros and cons I looked at many reviews before buy this razor and found one thing consistent with all reviews is how loud the cleaner is. I though to my self, how loud could this thing actually be. This cleaner sounds exactly like a tire filling station that you find at a gas station that coast 75 cents to fill your tire. Maybe not quit as loud but definitely sounds the same. The function of the cleaner and charger work flawlessly. I like the fact that you can wash and dry or just dry if you clean it yourself. I only wash and dry maybe once a week to conserve the detergent cartridge which in my mind is not really needed.I put a little body soap on it while it is running and add a little water and wala. As for the price, there is no way I would have paid 499.99 for this razor but with the price drop it put it in the good price range for what you get. In my opinion if you like to pamper yourself and look good than this razor is for you if you can get past the price and small imperfection. When I clicked the button to complete my order I stared to second guess myself, thinking I was a smuck for paying that much for a razor that probably worked just as good as the cheap ones. If I could do it all over again knowing what I know now after using it for 2 months their would have been no second guessing.

  18. My brother recommended me and I was originally skeptical about the hype of technology. I had tried the Braun and Philips brands in the past and was okay with them. However after trying the Panasonic for almost a month now and I have to say it was one of the best I have tried so far. The only negative about this shaver is that there is no indicator about the power that have unless it is in turn-on (at the first 30 sec) or in the charging mode. Also the bright blue blinking LED backlight display remains on if you leave the shaver in the charging/ cleaning station. The cleaning and drying of the shaver does take a while (over 2 hrs) and it makes some noise that drives the cats crazy. Apart from this little short comings I would definitely recommend it to my friends. It does take sometime for your skin to adapt to the new shaver especially for someone with sensitive skin.

  20. My husband has used Norelco for the fifty-nine years I have known him, and has never been satisfied with Norelco. He says that the first time he used the Panasonic ES-LA93-K shaver was also the first time he ever got a really close and totally comfortable shave. He says, \\"I shave dry, I shave wet, in the shower or out, with only water or with a shave cream, it doesn't seem to make any difference, it's always a wonderful, close shave.\\" No negatives, though he does not clean the shaver with the little cleaner, preferring to do the whole thing by hand. It's not that much noisier than the Norelco, but the speed of the Panasonic more than makes up for the increase in sound. And I enjoy the ultra-smooth feel of his skin after the shave, with no five-o-clock shadow at all! Thank you, Amazon, for offering this razor to us.
  21. I had given up on close shaving years ago due to skin irritation with Norelco's rotary shaver and of course blades. So for years I have used trimmers as my shaver. Well I recently was encouraged to try foil shavers and after the first try I was hooked. I first started using Wahl's 5 star foil shaver which is very good by itself. But later I decided to upgrade to a more advance and elaborate tool and choose the Panasonic based on a litany of positive reviews. It is indeed all that others have suggested. For me, it shave as close as I remember getting with blades some years ago. I recently tried the wet method (i.e. shaving cream) and am extremely impress with the closeness and comfort of that shave relative to the dry method, but note that I was also pleased with the dry method using Remington's face shaver powder. As for wet vs dry, wet is more comfortable and slightly closer in some areas, while dry is quicker and more convenient. The most notable observation is that I have had absolutely no skin irritation and needed no break-in period--comfort from day one. Final conclusion is that this is indeed an outstanding tool for shaving and definitely is ranked as the best shaver I have ever used.
  22. The price of this shaver on Amazon was substantially less than at my local mall. Quality is excellent, shave is excellent. Even the charging cleaning base is excellent, once you close the bathroom door and let it whirr away during cleaning and drying mode. When the cleaning process is over, the shaver AND the charging base are like new; all hair gone. What is dumb, and was very close to being a deal breaker for me, is a ridiculous flashing blue LED light on the shaver's handle that never turns off (except when you are shaving). The flashing blue light is bright enough to illuminate the hallway outside the bathroom door, and it flashes endlessly. The whole idea of the charging base is you plug the base in, and drop your shaver in between shaves. I now keep my base unplugged, and only plug it in to charge. I know it is fully charged when the annoying blue flashing light flashes endlessly once again. In my view, save $$$ and get the next model down, and skip the charger base. Since the shaver is waterproof it cleans very easily under running water. Skip the base, but buy the shaver.
  23. I have been shaving with high-end Braun shavers for over 20 years--this is my first Panasonic shaver. After reading the lackluster reviews on the latest Braun self cleaning shaver, I decided to try this highly rated model. Ultimately, I have decided to return this shaver and try a new, but older model Braun.<br /><br />High Points:<br />- Very close shave, slightly better than the top of the line Braun from 3 years ago<br />- Excellent \\"soap and water clean function\\"--cleaning it with a bit of soap, water, and it's special vibrate mode is very quick and effective. Almost as clean as the hour long mode in the base station, though I'm sure this does not provide sterilization of the shaving surface.<br /><br />Low Points:<br />- Poor ergonmics; the shaver has a very unwieldy shape that makes it hard for you to know if you're actually hitting stubble, so you have to constantly feel your face to see if its working. Because the shaver head is so large and chunky, it's very hard to get a close shave under your nose. I cut myself twice under the nose while shaving because of this.<br />- The cleaning cycle is VERY loud and long (about an hour). I have been using \\"self-cleaning\\" shavers for over 8 years, and this one has double the volume of any I have used previously, actually waking up my wife in the next room.
  24. I have been shaving with a blade since day 1. I have one of those beards that grows in many different directions. My cheeks are easy to shave with no problem with the blade. However my neck is a different story. I would only shave 1-2 times per week otherwise my neck would bleed and be irritated for days. I had tried Norelco electric shavers in the past and was very disappointed because they neither shaved well and the irritation was twice as bad as the blade. So recently I decided to look for another electric shaver. I came across the Braun Series 7 and the Panasonic LA-93. I decided on the Panasonic for 2 reasons. 1. The reviews and 2. The fact that you can shave with shaving cream. I am happy with my decision. But you have to know what to expect. My upper face is very easy to shave with the Panasonic. It is exactly the same as shaving with a blade. But the neck leaves something to be desired. Although it doesn't shave that great on the Neck area it does not GIVE ANY IRRITAION it also gets about 95-98 percent of all the neck. For the balance 2 percent I just touch up with a blade that takes like 30 seconds. I haven't tried to shave dry because it does such a great job with the cream. The quality of the shaver is excellent! The only thing I don't like about the cleaner is the smell of the cleaning liquid. Otherwise I just shave and when I am done I put in the charger and it cleans and ready for the next use. Overall I would definitely recommend the system. It's about 97 percent effective and that works for my situation.

  26. I have had this razor 6 months and, overall looking back, I would never buy it again. I think it can shave closer than my old rotary type, but you have to work much harder to get a complete shave (many more passes). The biggest drawback is the foil screens are so thin, the foil in my shaver developed a sizable hole after only a few months. Your first indication is the shave begins to hurt and your face is scratched and red. Looking into the warranty after such a short period, I was told the foil and blades are not covered. Replacing screens and blades every 6 months or so is an expensive proposition. I have to say this never happened in the 15+ years I owned a rotary shaver. The ability to wet shave feature is nice. Another drawback is the on/off button is where you tend to put your thumb while shaving and easy to accidentally press, so I often turn off the shaver in the middle of shaving.
  27. I purchased the Panasonic ES-LA93-K shaver about a month ago and have used it several times since. The shaver produces a good clean shave which is all I wanted anyway but it is not as close a shave as I get with my old Gillete mach 3. The pro's, it gives a good clean shave which will last most of the day if done in the morning. It is quicker than using a standard shaving razor at getting the job done which is good if you are in a hurry to go somewhere. The con's, it's expensive and it with the gadgets that come with it take up a good bit of counter space at the bathroom sink. Good machine but not super shaver.
  28. This product is astounding. For years I have been purchasing the \\"latest\\" electric razor in hopes that I can throw the cost, inconvenience, and pain of razor blades out. Electric razors (Norelco, Remington, Braun, and older Panasonic models) fell far short of Gillette's finest blade technology. No longer. I receive a closer shave from the Panasonic ES-LA93 than Gillette's latest blade technology (Fusion Pro Glide). Observations: The ES-LA93 is expensive. But when I compare what I'm paying annually for blades against what I paid for the shaver, it pays itself off in about a year. And in year 2, I expect to pay about $18 total (the cost of a set of replacement shaver blades). If the shaver holds out for 3 years, I expect that I'll be ahead about $600. Slippery when wet. Panasonic has done a great job designing and manufacturing a sleek unit, but for my comfort it is a little too slippery. I am overly careful because I don't want to drop it in the shower. We're talking about something that costs as much as a 64gb iPod Touch. It may sound ridiculous, but an optional lanyard around fastening the razor to my wrist would be a plus. A few things I recommend: 1) Let the blades float across your face rather than applying a lot of pressure. 2) Tighten skin. 3) Wet shave in the shower with shaving cream. Bottom Line: If you like the closeness of razors and have tried moving to electric shavers without success, your time has come. Welcome to the future of shaving.

I got a super deal on this shaver system and would never pay full retail for it.

  38. I'm what you would call a man who is very serious about shaving. Believe it or not, I own a braun series 7, a Norelco 1280xcc, and a panasonic ES-LA93-K. Of these 3 shavers, the panasonic in my opinion gives the closest, most comfortable shave. I like a wet shave, so this shaver is perfect for me. I have problems shaving my neck with the Braun and the Norelco, but not with the Panasonic. The norelco can be used with shaving cream or gel, as is the panasonic, but it irritates my neck a little. All in all, the Panasonic is my favorite of the three. It's been about a week since I made my first review. Since then, I have been switching back and forth between the Norelco 1280xcc and the Panasonic LA93K. The norelco definitely shaves just as close as the panasonic. I use shaving soap with both shavers. The cleaning station on the norelco is a better design than on the panasonic, so for that reason, I would have to rate the norelco above the panasonic. The cleaning station on the panasonic is a joke. There is no indicator on the panasonic to inform you when the refill cartridge needs replacing, so you have to guess or keep track of how times you use it. Bottom line is that I would take either of these shavers over the Braun series 7, with the norelco being one notch above the panasonic.

  49. The Panasonic ES-LA93-K is not a bad shaver. It takes a few days and some razor burn to get used to it but after that it provides a very close shave around the lips. You can use it dry or wet but I did not notice any difference either way. Where this shaver, like all other electric ones, fails is on the neck and the jawline. I have spent 7 minutes with & without shaving gel trying to get a clean shave of the neck and the Panasonic still leaves lots of stubbles.<br /><br />For comparison purposes I also tried a Braun 190 shaver which currently retails at 1/4th the price of the ES-LA93-K and got almost identical results (excellent shave near mouth, bad near jaw & neck). The Panasonic shaver is now being returned since there is no justification for the premium price even considering the cleaning station.

  51. Upgraded from my Panasonic ES8249 (previously reviewed: [[ASIN:B001DKMYAK Panasonic ES8249K Arc IV Nano Vortex Wet/Dry Rechargeable Shaving System, Black]]), and it was worth the upgrade. I paid about half the retail at one of Amazon's partners, so I encourage shopping around; I'm not sure it's $200+ better than the 8249 if you pay full freight, but it's a definite improvement and certainly worth it if you can get it for substantially less than retail. Basically the same function as the 8249 - water-based cleaner, cleaning unit buttons function the same, same cleaning cartridges (a nice touch), wet-dry shave. The head is very large, but is easy to manipulate when you get used to it. Shaver seems to be slightly less noisy than the 8249 when in use; the cleaning unit is definitely noisier in the first few minutes of its cycle, but essentially the same when the blower comes on. It takes longer for the clean/dry cycle than the 8249 - haven't timed it but I would guess maybe 20% longer (well over an hour). The lock button on the back is a little more difficult to operate than other Panasonic shavers I have owned and is somewhat stiff, but looks fairly sturdy. One complaint about the Panasonics is that you can't use them as a corded shaver (maybe the result of fear of lawsuits for shaving in the shower with a cord attached!), but operationally to me this doesn't matter, and it charges within an hour. The batteries in this model last longer than the 8249 - guessing maybe 20% longer on a full charge. The bottom line - this shaver gives me the closest shave I have had from an electric shaver - very close to a blade, and the wet shave is definitely the most comfortable.<br /><br />Postscript: Just returned from a recent detour into the Norelco world (rotary); I used Norelcos years ago, and like their quiet operation and battery life. Norelco also now has wet/dry shavers, and automatic cleaning stations. Worth a try again, HOWEVER, have gone back to Panasonic (wet shave) for two reasons: 1) Closer shave, and 2) Comfort. Which, I suppose, is the reason for shaving in the first place, if you choose not to grow facial hair. After a long history with many, many shavers, electric and otherwise, this Panasonic is the best of the lot for wet-shave electric shavers.r two reasons: 1) Closer shave, and 2) Comfort. Which, I suppose, is the reason for shaving in the first place, if you choose not to grow facial hair. After a long history with many, many shavers, electric and otherwise, this Panasonic is the best of the lot for wet-shave electric shavers.
  52. As another reviewer mentioned, it seems to be the same thing as the Panasonic la63, except with the cleaning base and it's black in color. When I last checked, the LA63 was going for $190 and this one was going for $399, so it's up to you if you want to spend that much more money. As for the razor itself, it works great. I've tried numerous electric razors over the past few years and all of them have been disappointing. I'd try to use them for a few weeks, and I just couldn't get them to shave anything smoothly. These were all sub-$100 razors. I'm not sure why I decided to go from $80 razors to a $400 razor, but I'm happy I did. I shave both my face and my head, and my Mach 3 razor would really irritate my scalp and neck. This razor, right of the box with no charge shaved my head, face, and neck very well with no irritation. It's not perfect around the ears due to the large head, so I still need to pull out the razor to get that smooth. It shaves the neck surprisingly well, although I need to drag it across my neck parallel to the jaw to really get it smooth, but even with the Mach 3, I couldn't get that very smooth. If anything, this shaver does it even better. And without the always present razor burn that the razor would cause. The cleaning base seems to do the job well. It's fairly loud, but it cleans it, dries it, and charges it. The cartridges seem cheap enough to avoid the hassle of cleaning it by hand. I just shave and drop it in the base and it takes care of everything. Is it worth nearly $400? That's up to you. But it works better than any other shaver I've tried and I'm happy with my purchase. I wouldn't blame you if you went with the la63 instead, though.
  53. very good product. Thanks
  54. Bought as gift for son. He says it's really nice. He likes that it can be used wet and is easy to clean
  55. I bought this razor 3 months ago and still have the Braun 7 Series in the closet. There is simply no comparison as the Panasonic does the best job - I am one of those people that can't use a blade because I would cut myself constantly so I've been using electric razors for more that 10 years now(always the top of of the line Braun except now for this Panasonic). I never imagined that my face could be as smooth as someone that uses a razor - thank you Panasonic! I achieve this great result using dry shaving, about 5 minutes and going twice over the neck area - while this Panny does a great job on the chin, like all electrics, it needs 2 or more passes on the neck areas but that is a small price to pay for a truly smooth face. I clean my shaver with regular soap and water after every use and only use the little cartridge and autocleaning feature about once per week - in the 3 months I had it, I still have the initial cartridge. One trick is to clean the water tank after every auto cleaning you do to prevent hair buildup and premature drying of the detergent cartridge. If you can afford the high price, do yourself a favor and get it - your face will thank you for it.
  56. really nice shaver, gives the closest smooth shave of any electric shaver that I have had before.
  57. I will say this straight up, that this model is very close the es-la63-s, but this has the cleaning kit and the other model does not.<br /><br />The first thing I should say is that you can get as close as you want. Closer than a blade, because with a blade if you add pressure, you get nicks and cutes.<br /><br />Do you want to get so close that your skin will feel extremely raw? Do you want to get even further beyond where you start bleeding? Even further beyond, I've gotten so close that I've taken out my epidermis, my skin is raw to the bone and I have no hair, smoother than a babies behind; their legs.<br /><br />How quick is the shave? Well if you just want a quick shave, this thing will give it to you. I got a good shave in less than a minute. At 14,000 micro-vibrations you can basically get a good shave in a minute. Very fast, very quick, very impressive. The head is huge, so that means you can cover a lot of ground in a short amount of time.<br /><br />Do you want a comfortable shave? Dang, this thing is very very comfortable. It felt like I was rubbing my face with a cloud. Yes, the blades spin that fast that it feels like you've got some kind of cloudy heat pad on your face. Rubbing it up and down, no irritations, very comfortable. Now if you shave for a while, it will get hot. And, if you shave for a while, your skin will get raw and a little irritated. All depending on how close you want to get. Basically, you want get any irritations if you shave quick; for those with sensitive skin, do not shave for a long period of time. This shaver is very good for sensitive skin.<br /><br />Does it clean? Yes, put liquid soap on the top, run for a few seconds, and run it under the water. The shaver comes with instructions on how to properly clean. I will also take the top off and rinse off the blades; accidentally hit the blades to the sink while they were on; ouch. It still works though. Then soak the top in alcohol if you want, or set to dry.<br /><br />It has an LCD screen that tells you how long you have been shaving. And, don't worry about dropping it because it has an incredible grip.<br /><br />Last comments, don't shave in the shower, you can if you want, but my experience was that the water slowed down the blades and couldn't get a good shave. You can use shaving cream to shave though, the blades won't slow down unless you run it through water which includes the shower. Also, my hair type is fast growing hair, not very rough or tough, but still a bit of a challenge. This blade didn't slow down when cutting my hair.<br /><br />YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR!!!een shaving. And, don't worry about dropping it because it has an incredible grip. Last comments, don't shave in the shower, you can if you want, but my experience was that the water slowed down the blades and couldn't get a good shave. You can use shaving cream to shave though, the blades won't slow down unless you run it through water which includes the shower. Also, my hair type is fast growing hair, not very rough or tough, but still a bit of a challenge. This blade didn't slow down when cutting my hair. YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR!!!
  58. Smooth shave, very good.
  59. I took a long time trying to decide what electric razor to buy after mulling over reviews for several of the Braun and Panasonic models. I decided to give this one a try. It has not disappointed me in the least. I thought this was an expensive razor, but I can say that it's worth it now after trying it for a few days. I have a sensitive face and neck, prone to ingrown hairs in the neck region. My hair also grows very quickly. This is the first razor that I've used in which I can shave every day if I wanted to without irritation. It works better for me in the shower because my beard is thick. It takes several passes for me to get all the hair off, but when I leave the shower, it feels similar to a manual razor shave. I am surprised electric shaving technology has gotten this good. I have tried several foils and rotaries and never really had results near what I get with this razor. This product also has a 30 day satisfaction guarantee. If you are riding the fence like I was, take the risk and buy it.<br /><br />(January 2014)<br />I am still using this razor and I have changed the blades twice and the foil once. It is still working great. The only thing suffering is battery life and for some reason the black plastic is starting to bleed black on my face when I shave. Other than that, all is great!

  61. I bought this about 6 weeks ago to replace my old Braun w/ self-cleaning system. Now I'm back looking for another alternative. Things i don't like about this Panasonic: * Takes longer to shave (more passes) * Leaves more 'stray' hairs * Takes forever to self-clean (annoying noise on & off for 1 hour or so) * Flashing blue light after finished cleaning - can't leave in cleaning/charging stand because the flashing light is so bright at night * Self-cleaning system requires rinsing out & refilling water reservoir (vs. Braun system with pre-mixed liquid cleaning solution) Overall, very disappointed for the price (only to replace it right away too...). I think I will go back to the Braun self-cleaning foil shaver, or the Philips Norelco 3-head/pivot style shaver.
  62. After shaving with one Gillette system after the other, culminating with the latest version of the Fusion (with batteries) available at the time, I gave in bought a Braun the 790cc in March 2010. From the beginning (I have a rather heavy beard that grows in different directions), getting anything resembling a close shave in less than 15 minutes was impossible. Still, I decided to stick with the mediocre shaves, the earth-shattering noise both of the shave and the cleaning process, because I was fed up with blood all over my shirt collars resulting from the inevitable daily cuts that accompanied my super-duper Gillette blades. By September, the foils (supposed to last 18 months) had so badly degraded that after 10 minutes, I still had a full beard. So I purchased a new foil and cutter cassette. Slightly better results for about a week. Then, the five o'clock shadow became worse...and worse, and finally, the morning shave entailed an excruciating ripping of the hair from my beard. By late November, I was finally determined that this was not going to work, and I went back to the drawing board. For whatever reason, the Panasonic was not on my radar screen in March. This time, I expanded the search and the ES-LA93-K wet/dry came up. I read a half-dozen reviews, several from former Braun 7-series owners, and went ahead and bought the Panasonic. It arrived December 3rd. I have had two shaves, one dry with Williams Lectric Shave, and one in the shower with pre-shave oil and shave gel. Both shaves exceeded in closeness, comfort and neatness anything I have ever experienced, ever, anytime--in a record setting 4 minutes dry and 5 minutes wet. It is more comfortable to hold, quieter, utterly pain free, and is everything I expected and much, much more. The cleaning system is easy to use, and much quieter. I had used Braun shavers in the past, with similar results. The 7-series received rave reviews, and I decided to give it a shot. I am done with German engineering for good, after getting rid of a disaster of a BMW for an Infiniti and now the Braun 7-series in favor of the Panasonic. While the Braun may work for you if your beard is lighter and has a predictable and consistent growth pattern, I would recommend the Panasonic simply because it works better under the most difficult conditions, and would likely give you lucky light bearded folks a two-minute shave, dry or wet. I had grown to dread shaving--the past two days have been terrific. It is six hours now since I shaved, and no hint of shadow. With the Braun, it would be there in less than three hours. By night, if I was going out, I needed to shave again. Those of you who are still trying for a perfect or even acceptable shave with the Braun: do yourselves a favor and try the Panasonic. Unless there is some dramatic regression with this one, or they for some inexplicable reason change the design, I have finally found the perfect shave.
  63. I haven't had a electric shaver for years but this one is really good. It is lite to handle and you get what you pay for. it is that good.
  64. Although I've only had the shaver a month, it is by far the best electric shave I've ever had. I have only used the automatic cleaning system once and it left the shaver spotless. If this shaver maintains this level of performance over time, it will clearly be an outstanding product. I also have not used the \\"wet\\" shave option but it was never my intention of using it that way.
  65. Starting with the headline-spectacular. The unit comes as a black model with cleaning base (ESLA93K) and a silver standalone model (ESLA63S). Both function the same. This shaver incorporates some firsts for Panasonic: 14,000 rpm motor; a 2'nd motor in the head that copies the Braun foil-pulsing concept and a head that pivots up and down like Braun's have for years (plus the usual Panasonic side to side). And the whole head arrangment is a little more elegant. Brought forward from the past models are the 4-system head, the ARC foil and nano-sharpened blades. The black version is a thing of beauty. First class manufacturing with solid, gleaming surfaces and perfect fit and finish. Thick sections of body and foil cap plastics. A premium product through and through. The shaver is not as HUGE as it looks in pictures. But, it is a larger form factor than usual for a Panasonic. While it \\"looks\\" unwieldy, once in hand it melts in like a custom glove and is a natural to handle. It is heavier than other Pansonics out of neccessity as there is literally a second motor in the head. But it is not burdonsome. The motor note to me is not as jarring or intrusive as other Pansonics. I think the thicker materials and more casing account for this. But it does not approach a rotary for being a quiet shaving experience. Closeness: The best I have ever experienced, hands down. I've had great, close shaves with other shavers that feel \\"dry.\\" Not bad-but a close, dry. On a good day with the ESLA93K my skin gets a \\"baby bottom soft\\" feel. I have never, ever experienced it until this unit. Comfort: It was impossible for me to experience discomfort with this unit. I was unable to shave in any direction against any grain with any amount of pressure that was not completely comfortable. In fact, after a couple days my shaves were not as close-I figured out I was not pressing hard enough. You just don't feel pressure. Speed: I am a 7-9 minute shaver. Always have been.An over-shaver, never feel done. It's hard for me to go past 5 minutes with this unit. I start feeling \\"done\\" about 3 minutes. It's fast. Trimmer: Due to the nature of the head the trimmer looks small-I compared it is exactly the same size as the trimmer on the Arc Retro. Works fine, it is in a somewhat unusual location but I got used to it right away. Cleaning module: The module works well and is the standard vortex dry cake of soap plus water system with a different design to accomodate the shape of the shaver. The manual mentioned active-drying, which I do not think was the case with my ES8228S cleaning base. Still not as good as the Braun module in my opinion. It carries over my one pet peeve from past Panasonic modules which is no sleep mode. When you come back for lunch, the shaver blinks once every 2 seconds. Blink. Blink. Blink. Gives you the urge to take out the shaver-so what's the point of leaving it in until tomorrow? But this is a perhaps a personal quirk and the unit does the job well. The module is a nice convenience that costs under 15 cents per day and the unit is easily cleaned by rinsing and/or cleaning with liquid soap per the instructions so either way it's fast and easy. Other: Unit has a bright, pleasant blue LED display that shows shave time, battery remaining, I think it indicates when cleaning is needed and it flashes a replace foil symbol after one year. Oddly, the LED goes OFF while you are shaving-but as stated above blinks constantly when done charging. I don't know who thinks of this stuff for Panasonic but it's odd. Summary/perspectives: The Panasonic ESLA93K is the best foil shaver I have ever used, without question. *Should I try it if I am primarily a rotary user? IMO-if you have always preferred the rotary experience you will probably still prefer a rotary to this unit. It is a fantastic shaver but it is a foil experience 100%. *Should I upgrade if I just bought a recent Panasonic? IMO-if maximum speed, comfort and the sensation of soft closeness is something you are willing to pay for, yes. If ultra Panasonic close is all you need, all the other recent models are great. *Should I try it if I love my Pulsonic? IMO-yes. To me the ESLA93K is everything the Pulsonic has been to others that it never gave me. It's a step above, it is the ultimate foil shaver on the market today.
  66. Wow! Once Again I read many reviews before buying this shaver and So Far they Were Right! It Appears to be a great Shaver...but it's ONLY Been 2 or 3 days.
  67. This is the best shave I have ever got with electric razor. I have used a rotor razor for 5 year and this razor is like night and day. I should have switched to a foil razor years ago. The price tag is a little high but it's worth it if we want a close shave with a electric razor

  87. I looked at reviews for some time before deciding on this shaver. It came down to the top of the line Braun and this.   88. Good shaver and cleaning station. Nice shave. Negative is that when cleaning station is finished the LED display on the shaver blinks on/off forever until shaver is removed.   89. I have bought the best available electric shaver, based on Consumer Reports and other tests, for the last 60 years. This has meant buying whatever has been the top Panasonic model over the last 15 years or so, whenever they brought out a new one... so three different models in that time. And I still have all of them, so I can do comparative testing. The GOOD news. Even the oldest of these three is still fine, has never had anything done to it, including no replacement foil. Wet/dry capability was added two models back. And the shave from each of them has been increasingly smooth with each new model. And with the latest model, you get an auto-cleaning system, probably added to compete with Braun who had it first. The BAD news. The price has gone up very fast and is now astronomical (except on eBay). But that's not the really bad news, which is that the 'trimmer' has been shrunk so that it's now almost useless for trimming sideburns and necks accurately, its main use for most users. It was excellent on both the preceding models, so this is a major backward step and the auto-cleaning system is complex and I never use it or needed it before--just blow the dust out after tapping it on the side of the sink. This is not a trivial error: it's like the recalls on the Toyota, a sign that the internal quality control has gone to hell, obviously because they got sloppy from being top dog for so long. No surprise that they lost half a BILLION dollars in the last year, reported today, and are laying off what will amount to a total of several thousand workers. A sad sign that success undermines itself; and guess what country needs to learn that lesson much faster than it is showing signs of doing at the moment. So I down rate it to four stars, probably should be three. PS I have six or seven of the little battery operated travel shavers, and the new ones either have no trimmer or a very poor one (as on the current Braun). None are very good for a clean shave, only just better than nothing.
  90. If I would have rated this product shortly after receiving and using it, I would have given it 4 stars. The only things keeping it from receiving a 5 star rating were the functionality of the charging/cleaning unit and the retail price. I'm sorry, but there is absolutely no way that this electric shaver is worth $400 retail. I feel bad for anyone who paid the full price for this product. I picked it up new for around $200 on Amazon. I feel that is a much more reasonable price point for this shaver. The problems with the charging/cleaning unit are 1)it is really not needed, 2)the cleaning cycle is ridiculously long and loud, 3)at the end of the cleaning cycle, the unit emits an incredibly bright flashing blue strobe that continues until you remove the shaver, and 4)there is no separate charging function when placing the shaver in the unit. After 5 months of daily use, I can disappointedly only rate it at 2 stars due to quality/reliability issues. The charging/cleaning unit is no longer functioning properly. After the last few attempts at using the cleaning cycle, I have found my shaver sitting in a pool of cleaning solution in the morning. The blue led display on the shaver is displaying non-sensical information. For instance, when I last finished charging the shaver, instead of showing 100% charge, the display shows 188% charge. The minutes used/remaining feature displays unintelligible numbers as well. Fortunately, this has not affected the shaving performance one bit, but I wonder about what is going to happen down the road. The shaver is basically controlled by a microprocessor. What if that goes next? This is my second Panasonic shaver and I continue to be impressed with the pure shaving performance of the shaver, but Panasonic is failing me in the reliability department. It is too bad, because I really think Panasonics perform well. I am not talking about their products failing after years of use. I am talking about their $400 flagship shaver having problems after only 5 months! I do not purchase a shaver of this type for it to end up being disposable. A previously owned Panasonic shaver also had problems with the battery holding a charge. I had it for a little over a year. Panasonic customer service wanted to charge me $40 for a refurbished unit, but gave me a one time credit after I pushed the issue. I have contacted Panasonic in regard to my current problem and told them that I am not interested in a refurbished unit. Hopefully, they will make things right. Fool me once... UPDATE 5/24/11 After emailing Panasonic through their website and receiving no response, I decided to try calling them. I explained my problems with the shaver to the customer service rep and he provided me with a reference number and contact info for the McAllen Exchange Center. I paid to ship the unit back and within a week of them receiving it, I received a replacement unit at no cost to me. The invoice states that it is a refurbished unit, which is disappointing because I specifically asked them for a brand new unit given the cost of the original unit and the length of time that I owned it. If it is refurbished, I can't tell. Everything from the packaging to the shaver and cleaning unit are exactly the same condition as my former brand new unit. While my customer service experience took a turn for the better, only time will tell if this shaver can make the grade in terms of long term reliability.

  92. This shaver is great while it lasts. Within 2 months of purchase the LCD started to malfunction. Byt the 4th month the cleaning/charging station stopped working altogether and now, in the 11th month it has completely died. This shaver has never been misused and I have kept it in meticulous order. There seems to be no reason for its death other than poor craftsmanship. Its a shame Panasonic self such junk at such an inflated price point. Because I live in Australia and bought it online from Amazon, Panasonic will not honour any warranties.. So it had to be binned. Very dissapointed

  94. I've used the higher end Braun's for years, was ready to buy another one until I read a few reviews comparing the Panasonic's. I took a chance on the ES-LA93-K model and here were my first impressions: 1. The shaver head is on the larger side 2. The sound is a bit menacing at first Getting past this, upon first use, it was very comfortable while shaving and you get a very close shave - better it seems that any of the higher end Braun's I've used in the past. I've you don't need or want the base unit, you can really do without it (as should I have) because you can simply clean it manually yourself with great ease producing similar results while saving a ton on those cleaning cartridges. So far, this seems to be the best one I've owned. Whatever the next model down is that doesn't have the base unit, I would recommend as I don't believe the shaver itself is any different. I highly recommend.

This time, I bought a higher-end unit, and I'm sorry I didn't do it years ago. It shaves much much closer than the old ones -- wife noticed right away -- and it's much easier to clean -- just drop it in the charger and press the button. Well worth the investment.
  100. I bought this product and even though I was supposed to give it a month to allow my skin to get used to switching from a straight edge, all the reviews I had read and even comments from the manufacturer's website suggested there would be minimal transition from straight edge to this razor. In the first three weeks I used this razor I had a rash all over my face and it constantly left hairs behind (it didn't matter how long I shaved for those same hairs never got picked up). Then, the last straw was when I went to replace the cleaning cartridge on the cleaning system but the status light never went off. I got there customer service on the line who went through a series of fixes with me over the phone and then decided I have a bad unit and should send it in. Instead I decided I was going to return it and the cartridges I had just bought. I spoke to an Amazon representative who said I could get my money back on the razor and the replacement cartridges but I only received a refund on the razor. Then I shaved with my old Gilette Fusion and had the best shave in weeks. For me this was a horrible horrible product!
  101. After 30 years of blade-shaving, I finally decided to try this Panasonic, which is my first electric shaver ever. Why switch now? Well, with a dozen of Gillette's latest Fusion blades costing nearly $50, the idea of dropping $195 for what many describe as the best electric shaver on the market actually made good economic sense. And since Panasonic backs it with a 30-day money back guarantee, I figured I had nothing to lose.<br /><br />Now, since it's my first electric, I can't compare it to Braun, Norelco, etc. But with me, the comparison was the holy grail for electric shavers: it had to be at least as good as, or better than, the shave I get with a blade. And by that standard, this Panasonic has proven itself a clear winner.<br /><br />I've only had it for a week, but from the first shave, it was faster, easier, and (yes) closer than my Fusion blades. I shave \\"wet,\\" using the Billy Jealousy Hydroplane gel and I've had no discomfort or irritation. In about 3 minutes, I'm done and as smooth as the proverbial baby's butt, with none of the missed spots that I would often find and need to do over again with blades. My beard is tough to shave because it grows in several different directions, but the Panasonic handles that challenge with ease. As others have noted, this shaver is smaller than it appears in photographs and it handles incredibly well.<br /><br />A few minor niggles, but nothing for which I'd detract a star: the cleaning cycle is a little noisy, though quiet when it's drying; the insanely bright blue LED which flashes whenever the shaver is in the cleaner/charger unit could light up a harbor in dense fog; the shaving head is a bit large--I have a close-cropped goatee, and shaving along the edges of it can be a little tricky because the shaving head somewhat blocks my view.<br /><br />To sum up: The King is dead! Long live the King! The Panasonic LA93-K. Thanks for taking the time to read my review and I hope that you found it helpful!
  102. if you are considering purchasing this electric shaver, DON'T! My wife calls this contraption a cylon device- I wish it were so then I can at least vouch for its efficiency . My issues with it are covered by other reviews .I have had better shaves with a cheap 2 edged razor. It requires multiple passes to get a semi decent shave and it is way too loud when cleaning. \\"Move along ,these are not the droids you are looking for\\"

  104. Looked on Amazon.co.uk and cheapest price was £229 for a German sourced shaver otherwise £299. Decided to try Amazon.com where it was substantially cheaper. Using the checkout system was easy and additional customs duty was automatically calculated before total price was paid by credit card in £s. Total cost came to £158 including customs/p&p. Ordered 24th June and arrived 8th July. Shaver plug was the US style 2 flat pins rather than UK round pins but it plugs straight into the shaver socket fitted in my bathroom with no problems - charger works with 110v-240v. Great shaver and a lot quieter than my previous 7 series braun. Cleaned using cleaning unit twice so far and has left the head spotless - doesn't matter about the length of the clean/dry cycle as I just set it when I finish shaving and go to work. Overall recommend the shaver and also recommend importing via Amazon.com as it was easy and saved £70!
  105. By comparison, I have used Brauns and other Panasonics for at least fifteen years and have a fairly heavy beard and angular face. I have used this shaver for about a month and my overall impression is that it is very good. The wet shave (with shaving cream) is extremely close, in fact E XTREMELY close. Dry (using a pre shave like Afta) gives a very good shave- absolutely no complaints. As another reviewer noted, the ES LA93 looks large and bulky in photos but it is very light and easy to use but it did take some additional effort to shave up close below my nose because the shaving head is larger than any of my previous shavers. However, it just takes a little effort and is hardly a complaint considering how well this shaver works overall. The vortex cleaning station really cleans the shaving head very very thoroughly but when charged the constantly blinking blue light is on the bright side so that I actually have to keep the bathroom door closed at night. Neighbors no doubt now have confirmation of my behavior being related nightly to alien abductions! The cleaning solution is just over three weeks old and I still do not have a low or change light indicator coming on. Per instructions, I change the water reservoir once a day (which is very easy. I do it at night so the unit is ready to clean after my morning shave). I am definitely pleased with this product and would recommend it without hesitation.
  106. I bought this razor at the beginning of September 2011 and have been using it at least every other day since then. My problem with this unit is after only 3 months, my charger / cleaning base quit working on the cleaning side. What I mean is, the unit sounds like it is working but will not pump any fluid to actually clean the unit. Now if you are like me, you read the first few reviews, or even the first 10 or 15 but what you need to do is read the 1 star reviews. This unit has a proven track record of being garbage (the base) and Panasonic's customer Service and Warranty policies really stink. You have to send the ENTIRE unit back, leaving you without a razor for several weeks while they decide to replace your defective unit with a refurbished one (they have multitudes, based on how often they break). DO NOT buy this or any self-cleaning razor from Panasonic or you will be stuck like many others of us. I just ordered a new Braun razor to replace this one because for the last 15 years I have owned braun and they have worked flawlessly for me. I really like the razor, it cuts well even on my beard which is quite coarse. I like the fact that I can use it in the shower and rinse it off as well. The things I don't like about the razor are the head size is HUGE, so it's hard to get any precision with it. The cleaning / drying cycle takes about 2 hours to complete and is pretty noisy, espcially if someone is trying to sleep near the bathroom. The power button is right where I put my thumb while holding it, so I turn it off in the middle of shaving and the base unit is total garbage.
  107. There is nothing positive that I can say about this shaver. I feels cheaply made, and gives the impression it would be destroyed were it to be dropped on the floor. In fact--I'm doubtful it would survive a drop into the sink. It is a less successful shaver than my Panasonic of ten years ago--leaving most gray hairs untouched--unless you press about as hard as is practical. Then, after going back and forth repeatedly--it will cut your beard. In addition, the shaver was quiet for the first week. After that, a much louder rattle came from the shaving head and nother I could do would abate it. But the worst, by far, is the noise of the cleaning and drying cycles: drying alone could be heard in another room at the end of the house, the cleaning cycle sounded like there was construction going on in the street--or a small factory was manufacturing something in the bathroom. Suffice it to say I tried 'cleaning' once only. And drying, I left to open air on the bathroom counter to accomplish.
  108. I have had the shaver for 5 weeks and I love it! The first couple of times I shaved with it I wasn't too impressed but then... I guess I need a couple time to get use to holdig a new shaver.   109. Well, it's been a little while since mid-November when the shaver arrived, and I still love it. Best shave ever. I've used Panasonic shavers since 1984 and have alway been happy with them, but this is the best ever! I hesitated to put that much money in a shaver, but now, NO REGRETS. It is a closer shave than any I have before. The last shaver was a Braun 4775, a gift, and I was never happy with it. It wasn't as close as my previous Panasonic. Not so with this gift to myself the ES-LA93-K. It is quicker, smoother, more comfortable than any shaver I have ever had. A joy to shave. Only complaint, a minor one, is that when it is in the charger/cleaner, after any of the cycles, the led display flashes every other second. It is BRIGHT! Too bright, it lights up a room with blue flashes. It is a bit annoying especially at night. I don't know why they chose to make it flash all the time. It does come with a carry case and shield for the head of the shaver and you can charge it by connecting the power cord directly to it, both these items are unclear in the information on the AMAZON informational pages. You can travel without the charger/cleaner base unit. I do recommend it. Wish for: All previous Panasonic shavers had to be replaced because the internal ni/cad batteries died. I would wish for end-user replaceable batteries!
  110. I've had a few electronic shavers, mostly rotary shavers. I was never particularly happy with any of them. However, this shaver has changed my mind entirely. I get a close shave every time. The self cleaning unit makes it feel like a new shaver every time I've reached for it. I'd highly recommend this to anyone in the market. Yes, it's pricey, but it's well worth it!
  111. In the last 36 years of using electric shavers this is the first electric to ever leave my neck completely smooth and clean of all stubble. And it did so in just a little over 3 1/2 minutes! I've used many different brands looking for the perfect shave over the years starting with Sunbeam, Remington, several Norelco's, and a couple of Braun's, the last being a Series 7. All were top of the line shavers but none could ever get all the hairs and stubble from my neck. I've always had to keep a disposable razor handy to drag over my neck a few times to get all the stray hairs that the electric's missed. But not with this new Panasonic. It get's all the neck hairs and shaves so far below the skin level that my 5 o-clock shadow is a thing of the past! I can get through the entire day now with that fresh shaved look. This shaver is amazing. I tried it this morning in the shower and what a luxurious shave that is. I just used some Dove bar soap and my face shaved smooth and clean. I had a little trouble with it shutting off several times because while you're trying to keep hold of it with all that soap on it you inadvertently keep squeezing the power button. But I remembered it has a lock button, so I just turned it on and locked the button. Problem solved! It took a little longer in the shower because I don't have a mirror in there and had to shave by feel, but the results turned out fabulous! It's something I'll probably only have time for on the weekends though. The cleaning station as far as I'm concerned is far superior to the one that came with my Braun Series 7. I much prefer the smaller and cheaper dry cartridges to the much larger, messier, and more expensive alcohol based ones that the Braun uses. I could only get about 6 weeks out of the Braun cartridges even with cleaning the shaver every other day. The system is not sealed so the alcohol just evaporates whether you use it or not. The water based system on the Panasonic appears to be much better sealed, and of course you could always add a little more water if you needed to, so I can easily see getting 2 to 3 month's out of a cartridge with this setup. I've always rinsed all the whiskers out of the shaver head first (yes, the Braun's head was washable) before putting it in the cleaner base to help keep the load and odor at bay. This helps the cleaner in the base stay fresher longer and also reduces clogs in the system as well for reduced maintenance. I'll probably only use the wash cycle every few days with the Panasonic because it cleans up so well under the faucet with just using the \\"turbo\\" cleaning method. The cost of these cartridges through Amazon's subscription purchase is only $2.83 each. I have been paying $4.33 on average for the cartridges for the Braun, and then they only last 6 weeks. So this will be a nice savings if I can get a few month's out of these. I feel the cleaning system is worthwhile because it keeps my shaver clean, fresh, and dry so much better than if it was just left up to me. And Panasonic's cleaning station allows me to select \\"dry only and charge\\" (where the Braun's doesn't) so on those day's when I choose not to use the cleaning cycle, I can still dry the shaver head in the station which I feel is important to the longevity of the blades. Plus since there's no alcohol in the system, it won't erode the finish on the shaver like it did with my Braun. All the paint flaked off around the base of the head on my Braun due to the alcohol. I'm really enjoying my new Panasonic shaving system. The only gripes I have with it all have to do with the way it's programmed to do certain tasks. Let's start with the base. This is an excellent system and cleans the shaver immaculately. However, who in their right mind would program it to dry the shaver for 1 1/2 hours! That's right, the fan runs for an hour and a half to dry the head. That's ridiculous! The cleaning cycle only takes 10 minutes, and that's fine. But it shouldn't take more than 20 to 30 minutes max to dry the head with the fan. Who comes up with these things? Then there's the infamous flashing blue light display that it reverts to after the battery is fully charged. What would make any one ever think that the customer would be happy with a blue beacon in their bathroom flashing all night long!?! How absurd is that! When the shaver is done charging the light should just go out - end of story. But no, it has to flash and light up the whole room endlessly flashing like a little lighthouse. Who-ever is in charge of programming these shaver's and bases needs to be moved on. In summary, this is the best electric shaver I've ever used. And the cleaning/charging station does an outstanding job keeping the shaver in tip top shape. It is only flawed by a couple of really dumb programming choices. But I've discovered that you can just tip the shaver to one side in the base to make the flashing blue light go out. It doesn't look quite as elegant as when the shaver is straight but it works. You can also stop the drying cycle that way too. Despite these annoying flaws, I still highly recommend this shaver to anyone that wants one of the best shave's that can be had from an electric shaver. Yes, it's that good.
  112. I've been using an electric exclusively for about 11 years now and my last two shavers have been top of the line Brauns. I was ready to purchase the current top of line Braun (790cc) when I ran across this Panasonic. Based on the reviews I changed my mind an bought this shaver. I couldn't have been any more excited for my first shave, but unfortunately I found that although it did shave extremely close on my cheeks and chin, it did an awful job on my neck - the main problems being hairs that were completely missed and irritation. I really tried to like this shaver, trying it both dry (how I usually shave) and with gel. EIther way, I had the same problems. Also, shaving your upper lip with this thing is a challenge. I gave it a fair shot (about 2 weeks - yes I know it's not the month you're supposed to take to adjust) and ended up returning it and ordering the Braun.
  113. I've had this shaver for about three weeks now. This is my first \\"real\\" electric shaver. I haven't used the cleaning feature yet as it's simple enough to just use soap and water. Drying time is very long (3 hours). Panasonic should really extend their return period time to a 60 day period to give customers a full month the use the shaver. There is actually a little card inside the box that says you should use the shaver for a month to let your face adjust - ironic that your refund period will expire at the same time! Bottom line: I'm I happy with my purchase - YES FYI - Do a search for reviews on this product and you'll find a link for a cheaper price listing on Amazon!

  125. For years I have tried a number of electric razors. the Braun 7, and Norelco's SensorTouch 3D being the latest. At last I got the shave I was looking for. Close and very comfortable; effective around those nagging neck hairs; wet/dry (excellent ) and unlike the Noreleco it can be charged whilst travelling. I am sold on this product. It combines the best of the other two mentioned above in a well made body.<br />I do have one cavil however, and that is the washer that came with the razor. To me it over complicates the cleaning process, and the drying takes - wait for it - 180 minutes. The cleaning is done, but the other two cleaners - the Braun and Norelco - are far faster and seem to do as good a job. The Braun has a rather nice citrusy smell in its cleaner too.<br />Overall: the Panasonic is the best electric razor I have owned.

  131. hey &#34;brothers&#34; if you've been looking for an electric shaver this is the one...I have used hand trimmers for ever on my face and head because any and I mean any razor breaks me out...I was online shopping...at work no doubt...hey don't look like that I'm not the only one...anyway and decided to make this purchase....best decision I've made...now I know you're not used to paying this amount for a shaver and neither was I but...one shave in and I was like wow...there was absolutely no pulling and the shave I got was better than with a razor and with zero irritation...for best result &#34;for me&#34; shave with your hand trimmers and the next day or two use these then after that unless your hair grows like bamboo then every other day will keep you looking your best...don't use with a weeks worth of hair and then say they don't work they are best for stubble... they work for everything...head, underarms, and the boys if you like to keep them shaved too...make sure you pull the skin taught on the underside of the boys

  133. I highly recommend this shaver especially for everyone with very sensitive skin and tough beard like myself. I have been a Philips user for almost 15 years and then I switched to Panasonic with an ES8228, then I moved to an ES8249, and finally I bought ES-93, which is the best shaver available in the market at this time. I like a consistently close shave and no irritation on my neck. Of course, it is costly but you get what you paid for. The only problem for me is that due to my tough facial hair I need to change the foil and blades every 7-8 months, which could be perceived a bit expensive by some. However, the comfort and healthy looking skin are more important for me than any other considerations. I have tried the new model of Philips 3D as a long standing fan of old Philips models and I can attest that the Panasonic shaver is still superior. I have no experience with the Braun shavers and I have no desire to try as I am very happy with my Panasonic. I am slightly puzzled by some negative reviews for this shaver, my guess is that the competition cannot compete with Panasonic via technology and thus they may use different tactics. In any event, I highly recommend this shaver, which I bought not only for myself, but for all my relatives and friends who are grateful and happy with my choice.

A blade may get you just a hair closer (I know, bad pun) but you can also remove a layer of skin each time you use a blade. I did have one issue with my shaver base and Panasonic replaced the unit within one week with a brand new one.   146. very impressive! This is actually 4.5 stars. I already have best norelco and the best braun. Heres why this is best: The norelco works great in the shower but because its circular the upper lip area is not served well. Couple that w the fact that its not a close shave and the battery just progressively getting worse w each charge (and yes I dont over charge it), it ultimately fails as a stand alone. The braun does work well as a stand alone as its a very close shave, a little bit closer than the panasonic actually! but it takes forever, and the replacement blades are extremely expensive, and it cant be used in the shower (owing to its slowness). The panasonic however, IS a wet/dry shaver, it is efficient, its pretty darn close and it is incredibly fast. im not saying I dont have to run the same area twice or anything, but its far and away the fastest. One guesstimate is that its about 50% faster than the Norelco. The braun is about 4 times slower. That huge, humongous head actually is easy to use, and bc its linear it can be used for the philtrum area. It is a little tricky in the side burn area as Im always a bit nervous about shortening it unnecessarily, but im sure ill learn how to do it eventually. 1/2 star deduction for that, its slightly less close shave than the braun, and how the blue light blinks powerfully in the bathroom at night when it charges. literally had to close the door bc it was bothering me! Great product panasonic! wish I bought you first!

I haven't used to self-cleaning system yet, I just remove the foil and rinse it out. Still on my first charge after about 8 shaves. Update: One month later on second charge and it's working great.   156. I'm one of those who take avantage of other customers' reviews and rarely write one of my own, but I thought this the Panasonic ES-LA93-K deserves one. My 10-or-so-year-old Braun shaver (dry) finally died so I tried one of Gillette's new technology razors. It was alright - it reminded me that I liked the feeling of a foam shave and the warm rinse afterwards. When Amazon put the ES-LA93-K on Deal of the Day, I jumped on it not really knowing what I was buying - only that it seemed to be a great deal. When I finally tried the shaver with foam, I had to ask myself why I hadn't tried it before. The shaver glides over the foam so smoothly. With its 14000 cpm, I don't feel any tugging or pulling. It is also great for dry-shaving, but I just like it with foam better. Oh, and no, 14000 is not a typo. That's 233 per second dudes! The package comes with a little note that asks you to give the shaver 30 days to allow your face to get used to it. After just two days, I don't feel any discomfort whatsoever and my face comes out so smooth! I've also used the trimmer - it works as advertised. I like the cap - it's easy to put on and it fits two ways (hard to explain, but it snaps on one way, and it'll also snap on if you turn it 180*). The locking mechanism is probably going to be important for me as I travel for business quite a bit. When I do, I'll be using the custom pouch the shaver came with. The cleaning kit looks pretty cool. I like that the cleaning solution isn't a big container of alcohol like my old Braun's. Oh and lastly, it charges fast - with an indicator of % complete. I'll follow up if I find anything negative, but as of now, I highly recommend the ES-LA93-K.

I have rinsed it out after every use and feel it is unnecessary to replace the cleaning cartridge any sooner. The previous shavers that I have had in the past were a couple of Norelco triple head shavers and a Remington foil type shaver like this one, and neither one came close to shaving as great as this shaver. I do not have a real thick beard and I use the Panasonic shaver every day. It only takes a few minutes and it does a great job on your neck. That is why I wasn't crazy about my prior experience with electric shavers. I used a triple blade razor before purchasing the Panasonic and the only time that I have ever gotten a closer shave is when you put in a brand new blade, which you and I both know only stays sharp for the first one or two times you shave. The bottom line is: I highly recommend this shaver! I love the fact that you can use it in the shower if you want. I like the built in trimmer. It shaves almost as close, if not as close as a blade. The flexibility in the head allows it to closely shave the contours of my face and neck. Even after a weekend of not shaving, when typically I would have to use a trimmer to get it short enough to use the razor, this Panasonic cuts right through! I chose this razor over the Braun because of the ability to use it dry or wet. And although it does a very nice job when wet, I've found I like to use it dry better. Primarily because it seems to bog down once its full of hair and shave gel. Yes, you can rinse and continue, but that's time wasted. When I use it dry it doesn't cause razor burn and leaves me smooth everytime. It has cut my shaving time down from 10 to 12 minutes to about 5! No more 5 O'clock shadow either because the floating blade system lifts and cuts for a clean finish everytime! Some of the negatives I had read about are NOT the case for me. I have no trouble shaving my upper lip. I have had no issue with the trimmer on the burns or around the ears. The cleaning/charger station does an excellent job and I've had no issues with it what-so-ever! I bought it on Amazon and paid $220 not MSRP of $400. I expect many great years of shaving with this razor and think that it is well worth the money. If you have a tuff beard, you can't go wrong with this Panansonic!!! It still does a better job than any of its competitors.I just purchased this new razor from Panasonic. I got tired of hair left on my face that neither the Braun Pulsonic 7 or the Norelco Arcitec couldn't get. My family always tell me about the long hairs that were missed and the constant strokes over the same spot to get a reasonably close shave from the competition.<br />The new Panasonic worked well out of the box. It took 60 minutes to charge it. All I had to do was fill a little water tank with water and slide in the cleaning pack. It couldn't be any easier. My Panasonic was now ready to give me the closest shave I have ever had. I bought some Edge shave gel for sensitive skin, put some warm water on my face and applied the gel. The shaver did the rest. The trimmer worked perfectly and had no problem cutting my sideburns evenly and straight. I haven't used a shaving gel for a long time but the results were remarkable. It zipped through my beard and didn't leave any uncut hairs.. Clean up was simple too. I just rinsed off the shaving creme from the heads and placed in the hydroclean system. I had to set the clener for clean, dry and charge and my razor is now ready for my next visit.<br />This razor might be pricey but well worth the price.
