I had a coupon for 20% off at a different internet retailer. I know it's alot of money but so far its worth it. I bought my son-in=law a top of the line Panasonic about 6 years ago. He replaced the blades and the screen and the shaver just died a couple of weeks ago. If this lasts that long, it will be worth the money.<br />It is now more than a month since I purchased this shaver and the shaves are getting even better. You don't have to press hard and the closeness of the shave is incredible. As for the cleaner, it does a very effective job, just rinse the shaving creme off the top which takes seconds and put it in the auto cleaner. The razor comes out like brand new. I have opened the razor after cleaning to see that it is spotless. I was really suprised. I haven't changed the cleaning solution yet because I am waiting for the indicator light to go on. The auto cleaner is definitely worth the money. It saves alot of time.<br />UP-Date<br />It is now Feb 20th 2010 and this shaver is still the best ever. You don\\"t have to press down to get a close shave. And the hydra clean system still produces an imacculate razor after the cleaning/drying process. You just have to rinse the shaving cream off the outside of the blades and let the collected water drain off( you're talking about seconds to do this). Then it is ready for the hydra clean system. Your beard has finally met its match!!!!<br />It is now more than a year later and I have tried the new 3d from Norelco and the new Braun 7 razor and I have to say that the Panasonic is still the top shaver.   176. As someone with a very rough facial hair, I can say without a doubt that this is the best shaver I have ever used. When I first started shaving I used electric and it always worked moderately well. After I blew through my second shaver in as many months I switched to Wet Shaving with a Fusion. Ignoring the fact that I used to cut my face to ribbons it was the closest shave I ever had gotten. But as I got into my morning routine after College I realized a problem, I hated holding a razor sharp blade to my face every morning. I began looking for a solution. I finally found it with this shaver. This thing can tackle my scruff after 2 days of not shaving. Understand that after 2 days I usually had to do 2 passes with a bladed razor.<br /><br />The actual Razor fits well in the hand and doesn't slide around, like some, when I use it. Because of how rough my facial hair is I usually restrict the movement of the head with the switch on the back, just so I can press down a bit harder. I have yet to actually uses this thing enough to drain the Battery past 80%. I bought mine with a Cleaning station, and I don't think I will buy another Razor without one. One of the worst parts of the electric experience in my opinion has always been the daily cleanup. The amount of time you save is lost with having to break the razor down and clean all the hair out. The Cleaning Station always manages to clean my razor completely, there is no hair in it at all after its done. The only complaint I have is the Cleaning solution gives the razor a mild smell (The smell is so mild I can not smell it unless I'm working on my upper lip). Additionally you can use the cable from the base as a charging cable for the razor directly if thats more your speed.<br /><br />As a whole this razor is of astonishingly good quality. It doesn't just fit in the hand well its solid weight and great power mean that I will likely use it for a long time to come. Highly recommended.

  182. This shaver is NOT made in China, as one reviewer inaccurately stated. It's made in Japan and is clearly marked on the shaver and on the box. Big Difference! I am 35 yoa and have been using a blade for the majority of my life, though I do have some experience with various electric shavers. Compared to other electrics that I have used, this Panasonic blows them out of the water. It basically shaves as close as a blade, though it does its very best work when used daily. It doesn't punish you for taking three days off from shaving by pulling at your hair, but it does take a couple more passes to get everything. When used daily, however, it works like a dream and I can completely shave in under 4 minutes. Ergonomically, it feels great in your hand and against your face. I've primarily used it dry, but it can be used with shaving gel/cream and in the shower. It took a little getting used to after being accustomed to using a blade, but after just a few shaves it felt very natural. The quality of the shave is outstanding. I've used the self-cleaning base several times and it works great. The key is to follow the instructions in the User's Manual. Change the cleaning solution at the appropriate time and you should never have a problem. I noticed that one reviewer criticized the base unit because it was too loud. That seems ridiculous to me. Just set it and let it clean as you're leaving for work if you don't like the noise (it's really not that loud anyway). With this shaver, I actually enjoy shaving again. I've had absolutely no skin irritation or razor burn from the shaver. I absolutely love this product and I think it's worth every penny. Plus, I got a GREAT deal on it from amazon. The side burn trimmer is not super impressive, but I've never used an electric shaver that had a great side burn trimmer. They just don't seem to cut close enough. Due to the design of the shaver itself, it actually trims up my side burns rather nicely (without having to use the side burn trimmer). I'm sure it's not the shaver that will meet everybody's needs (what product could really do that anyway?), but I believe it will work very well for most people. I'm giving this Panasonic shaver a 5/5 because its one of the best products I've bought in recent memory. I love it and can enthusiastically recommend it.
  183. Yes. It's worth the money. I replaced an old Panasonic shaver and this one is sooo much better. Maybe just new but I don't remember the old one shaving this well or this fast.
  184. I was skeptical, to say the least about being able to get a nice truly smooth shave on my head with an electric razor. This razor is awesome. It shaves just as close as a bladed traditional razor, with the exception of a couple of small odd places on my scalp. That's no fault of the shaver, but simply the consequences of being beat about the head on occasion as a youth. So with an extra 20 seconds of touch-up with a blade, I get a perfectly smooth head. If you're concerned about the razor pulling the hair out, which has always been an issue for me with electrics in the past; it would seem that they've sorted that problem out as well. Not even a bit of a tug. This is an amazing razor, worth the cost.
  185. My husband recently had stents put in & was put on blood thiners, causing problems w/bleeding when shaving w/his razor. But he could never use a shaver before due to his heavy Italian beard. He was not a believer until he tried this Panasonic. This shaver is wonderful. It shaves him clean without even using lotions or creams. No more problems w/bleeding. He really loves it! I love it because he shaves more now!Shipping was on time & it was a pleasure as usual, ordering through Amazon.
  186. Works fairly well as a shaver. The trimmer is almost worthless as it does not seem to be angled right for trimming sideburns. Does a nice job with wet shaving, but is apparently not very well sealed as the electronic display is failing after only 5 months. Unit has never been immersed in water, but the top segments of the display are out, apparently from moisture infiltration. This does not affect the operation or charging/cleaning, at least not yet. The cleaning cycle is noisy and seems to run very long. Overall, not a bad shaver, but there are probably better out there.
  187. Provides the best & closest shave I've ever experienced from an electric razor. I've historically used Philips Norelco electric razor systems, but after using this razor for one day I'm sold on the quality and results of this Panasonic unit. The only downside I can note thus far is it is relatively loud compared to the rotary type. This was noted in previous reviews but that is a small price to pay for such a nice razor overall.
  188. I've only used this maybe three times in the year I've had it. Not impressive and no better than any other shaver.
  189. To start, I've used a few different razors and electric wet/dry shavers from a many different brands. I've never been completely satisfied with a shave before. I thought when Mach 3 moved on up to 4 blades, I'd get such a better shave, but that wasn't the case. I've been using an older electric shaver from Panasonic, one of the junk ones you buy for 20-30 bucks. I read the other reviews on here and of course I was completely skeptical, being let down many times before. The reviews looked too good to be true, but I'm thankful that my concern was ill warranted. I just tried this thing for the first time last night. Took it out of the package, skimmed the instructions real fast, noticed it had enough juice in it to make a run or two so I gave it a try before doing an initial charging. After I was done, I was speechless and hairless. It usually takes me 10 minutes to shave. With the LA93 it only took me about 5 minutes to shave and this was only my FIRST shave with this thing. Pros: This thing shaves FAST. This thing shaves CLOSER than a razor. This thing left NO razor burn. This thing shaves EFFORTLESSLY. This thing is SELF cleaning. This thing in black looks NICE. Here I am almost 24 hrs later and I STILL feel smoother than if I had shaved with a razor. I can now say that I found an electric shaver that I am completely satisfied with. I had considered Braun, but I'm glad I went with Panasonic. I'll come back in a few months and re-review this products to let you know if I still like it.
  190. Having tired several different high-end electrics over my 40 something years I'd resolved myself to being a standard blade guy. Every time I had to buy new blades though I'd wince because I really only got about a week out of a new blade. Throw in that I now shave the few hairs on my head and this was a financially painful process. I decided I would give an electric another try....the last time having been 5-10 years ago. I read the reviews on this one, made the purchase, and WHOOO HOOO I found my solution!!! This Panasonic does it, and does it well. Shave wet or dry, foam or no, face or head, it is excellent. I have been using it for over a month now and my shaves are getting even better as my beard has grown accustomed. My only gripe (and it is a minor one) is that when charged in the cleaning unit/stand the light blinks repeatedly when it reaches full charge. It looks like a police car is parked in my bathroom at night! It's tolerable, but could be better. Believe all the good things being said about this razor and buy one.
  191. I have a very difficult beard and it is hard for me to find an electric shaver that does a good job. I have tried all of the \\"best brands\\" and I have found this one to be the best. It shaves me close and the charger/ cleaner unit works very well- the cleaner cycle is a little noisy but one cannot have it all I guess. I highly recommend this shaver!
  192. I bought this shaver for my husband because he was complaining about the length of time it takes to shave every day. He's been using norelco rotary wet/dry shavers for over 10 years. He prefers shaving in the shower for a closer shave. He always spent a lot of time shaving over the same areas over and over to get all the hairs cut. He also had a problem with a little razor burn and bumps. After using this shaver once, he was thrilled with the close comfortable shave. He says it shaves as close as a straight razor. It now takes him 2 minutes to shave and he's ecstatic with the results. We highly recommend the shaver! The cleaner seems to do a good job. It's little noisy, but we just keep it in a guest bath so we don't notice the noise.

Being 82 years old my skin is a little loose,so I used a little EDGE to lubricate my skin and got the closes and the best shave I ever had and no skin irritation.I would recommend this shaver to anyone.

  195. This is the BEST electric razor I have ever used. I tried the major top of the line electric razors(except Panasonic) and have ALWAYS returned to the blade. I even tried a straight edge razor and that was a disaster. I looked at all the evaluations of this electric razor and decided to give it a try. It is fantastic. I always get a very blade like close shave without any irritation or rash on my neck. I have shaved both wet (shaving cream) and dry(with and without Pre-electric) and have the same enjoyable, yes enjoyable, close shave. Another plus is that you can manually clean this razor with superior clean results. This razor is expensive but well worth the price. Amazon had the best price by far so check it out.
  196. I purchased this unit about a month or so ago. There simply is no electric shaver that can give you as close a shave as a blade. I decided to try again as I have problems with ingrown hairs and decided to try something different. When I used this product, I was amazed at how well it performed. I beleive I have a closer shave now than when I was using a regular razor. It was easy to operate, and cut a lot of hair on the first pass.<br /><br />One note - When the razor has finished charging, I noticed that the blue led screen flashes - it can be a little annoying if you can see it outside the bathroom.   199. I have been shaving with a Norelco for 25 years and decided to give this one a try based on claims of a closer, more comfortable & longer-lasting shave. I just use a standard pre-shave lotion - nothing fancy. So far I am loving this shaver. It does a great job, is easy to clean, and gives me a much better all around shave than my Norelco, especially now after a month or so and my skin & beard are becoming accustomed to the foil-type shaver. This is a precision instrument. It runs quietly and after each shave I clean it with a little handsoap gel & warm water just like it says in the instuctions. No need to use the expensive cleaning cartridges that come with the charging unit. If you get one be sure to use the \\"FREE\\" position to allow the head to float as you shave and try it for at least a month to allow your skin & beard to get used to it.
  200. After 5 years wanted to upgrade my shaver from an old Norelco Rotary. Did a bunch of research mostly considering the Braun vs. Panasonic. In the end the discount on this unit was too hard to pass up. I went on a shaving strike for 4 days before using the new shaver. Doing so with my old Norelco would normally result in a painful pull fest but the Panasonic cut through with ZERO discomfort and very very close. As this was my first shave, it took some getting used to a foil vs. rotary but after a few tries in each direction and about 2 minutes I was done. Looking forward to trying the Wet Shave capabilities out. But my trepidation over switching from a rotary to this foil was for naught. This unit is cool Easy to set up...cleaning system looks interesting (have yet to try). A little louder than I had expected (I think this is generally true of foils) Clean Shave... no cuts or redness.
  201. I believe that Panasonic has made a shaver that will shave as close as an electric can shave and probably as close as a blade can shave but to shave this close with the Panasonic or a blade you need to shave against the grain. For me there was a short adjustment period going from my Braun 8595 because with the different design and the larger offset head the way I hold the shaver is different.I'm 68 years old and have an average beard, not real coarse and heavy. The Panasonic ES-LA93-k gives me the best shave ever in about 3 to 4 minutes time. It does a really good job for me on my neck also. As others have said you should not apply much if any pressure and you will need to go over the hard spots more than once to get a near perfect shave. I always dry shave after my shower and use about 6 drops of Pacific company shaving oil rubbed into my face. I've never tried to wet shave with an electric shaver so I don't know if it could improve the results. I suspect that shaving shortly after a hot shower like I do would be as good. I also believe that dry shaving will make the shaver last much longer than taking it in the shower or using it with shaving cream. I've only used the cleaning system twice so far and it does an excellent job but it is noisy and about the same as my Braun. No big deal unless someone is sleeping nearby.For those who have good quality tap water I would recommend saving the money and buying the the model without the cleaning station. I have hard well water so I use distilled water in my cleaning station. I have kept my Braun and use it to preshave my lip area under the nose which makes it easier to use the Panasonic against the grain there. All things considered this is the best shaving product I have ever used.
  202. I've always used non-electric razors on my beard and I've never been bald or balding, until recently. Due to cancer treatment I started losing my hair in clumps. Needless to say, that was Not a good look! I decided to try an electric to handle both my head and my beard. I hadn't even tried an electric (in the last few decades)..... I did some research, read many Amazon reviews, and decided on the Panasonic ES-LA93-K Men's Shaver. It is a bit spendy, but worth every penny. I'd say my beard and hair are medium in weight and thickness, and it makes very short work (so to speak) of my beard, as well as the hair on my head. After it arrived, I first tried it on my beard for a couple of days to see if it was going to be workable, or going back in the box... From the first pass of the razor I could tell. This was the answer! Close, comfortable, and handles nicely in either hand. I cut most of the hair on my head with my Remmington beard trimmers, then used the Panasonic to shave. Oh, and all this was done in dry mode. I couldn't believe how smooth and irritation free this razor leaves my head and my beard. Shaving one's head for the first time ever in January, in northern climes, is clearly not ideal. This razor made it exceedingly easy. I do a touch up every day, and it usually takes me around 4 to 5 minutes for both head and beard. I know this because it tells me how many minutes it has just been used for, as well as what percentage of charge is left. Handy. This product far exceeded my expectations and I could Not be happier with my purchase!

  204. I bought this product in Okinawa Japan, about 7 months ago. This product works great for African American with sensitive skin. I also knew that in about 3 days my face would look like the back of a Mr. Goodbar (take a glance next time you eat one...) With this one you can still get that feel without the candy bar reference (haha). After doing a thorough review while in Okinawa of this product I finally broke down and bout it ($280 US) I must say that it was the best buy hands down of 2010 for me personally. If you are an African American male looking for a close shave with no residual pain (PFB) this will work for you. Its a win win...I'm gonna go and eat a Mr. Goodbar now, I just made myself hungry!!<br /><br />Happy Shaving!!
  205. The shaver works great; however, as others have reported, the Cleaning/Charging module has a defective design. 6 weeks after my purchase, the red status light came on. I followed all of the cleaning instructions and replaced the cartridge. I repeated this process 3 times but the red status light remained on, which disenables the unit's cleaning cycle. I called Panasonic. The CSR just read from the book and then told me to send the unit back at my expense. I asked for a supervisor who agreed to email me a prepaid mailing label but guess what?.........it's been 2 days and no label yet. Just for the heck of it, I ran the DRY cycle and after it completed, the status light went out. I then ran the cleaning cycle this morning, and it seems to be working. UPDATE-6 MONTHS LATER: Cleaning unit kept failing and now the red status light is always on despite my cleaning efforts. I've been trying to get a response out of customer service with no success other than \\" the appropriate department will get back to you\\". Despite the cleaning unit problems, the shaver does work well.

  207. Extremely sharp and comfortable. The best electric shave ever and I am extremely critical regarding shaving. I use shave gel or lather, then sometimes touch up with a safety razor.
  208. After reading some of the reviews of this product, I guess I got my hopes up. I've been looking for an electric razor that would at least give me a decent shave. Unfortunately, this isn't it. I read the literature that came with the shaver and gave it the time necessary to \\"acclimate\\" from razor to electric shaver shaving. After shaving with this razor for about 3 weeks, I have gone back to using shaving cream and razor. I thought that (because of the PRICE) and the reviews, that I would be able to use this shaver as my primary shaving tool. I was wrong. One of the reviews stated that once you started shaving with this shaver, you'd never go back to a blade....WRONG!
  209. This is a fantastic shaver. I have shaved with Braun for many years and Norelco before that for several years. This is the closest to a blade I have ever felt. Especially after a few months, when I decided to try wet shaving with shaving cream. The shave feels just like a blade shave, without all the problems I had with blades. Plus, with the Bruan, a shave took 5 to 7 minutes, going over and over the same areas, since the beard on my neck runs all different directions. With this one, my average shave it about 3 minutes. Only issue I had was that the hydrocleaner kept clogging up and leaving the shaver standing in a half inch of water, not finishing its cycle. So I eventually just got rid of the cleaner base and now I just use the method in the instruction manual -- run the shaver under the faucet for a few seconds (not plugged in of course) and then pull off the screen and run a little more water to catch stray hairs, blow or shake off excess water, cap it and let it dry on the shelf. Works great, and now I won't have to constantly buy the hydro refills. The manual discussed a \\"turbo clean\\" mode where you put some hand soap on the screen and hold the on button for two seconds and it goes into a turbo mode (you can hear the difference) and the shaver puts a little icon on the screen when it wants that cleaning. But just running it under the water for a few seconds (screen on) seems to clean it pretty well. I didn't like the smell of the Panasonic hydro-clean solution anyway, not as nice as the Braun. But when I think of what I spent over the years buying those CCR2 refils for the Bruan, one per month, just using the tap water is appealing. So I still give it five stars because the clogging hydrocleaner made me realize it was unnecessary. The blow dryer isn't necessary either; it's all stainless steel and nothing is going to rust. Love this shaver.
  210. This is by far the best electric shaver I've ever owned. Feels close as a blade to me. I should qualify by stating that I've primarily used lower end Norelco electrics up to this point, so I can't really compare this to any high end electric shavers. However, I can't imagine a better one than this!

  212. I have a very sensitive skin, and I can't use a conventional razor more than twice a week without my skin to bleed from everywhere. Then I tried a Philips (rotary), and I found it painful and not doing quite the job. This one is very expensive. I checked a lot of reviews about electric shavers before buying. The first week, it was okay, but not the result I wanted, specially on the neck. I continued because I felt it was getting better everyday. And after a mont, I can say I am pleased! It's a fabulous thing to always be shaved, everyday. The buy of the year in my case! Notes: It is strongly suggested to use shaving cream for the first 3 weeks, and I did. Now I can use it no problem no cream. Easier because I have a mirror! I got to cut myself at Adam's apple a few times though... Also, I find that if you are not using for a couple of days, the next shaving won't be as good as if you are using it everyday.
  213. In my 61 years, I've shaved once with an electric ... and was very irritated. The instructions say to shave for three weeks with lather and then try dry shaving. I had a four-day-old beard when it arrived and so I thought I'd put it to the test. I shaved dry as soon as it was charged and the shave was painless and very close -- about 95% as good as the Gillette Mach III that I always use. With lather on a one-day beard, it will probably be as close. I noticed that with an electric, you have to go over and over an area to get all the hairs cut. With a blade, it's once only. So it takes about twice as long to shave. I'm very happy with this (really expensive) shaver.
  214. I will add to the 5 star reviews because it is an amazing piece of technology. My skin is as soft as if I shaved with a straight edge. Its comfortable to hold and feels solid. I have super sensitive skin and did not irritate at all. It took me 5 minutes to get everything but I did which is more than I can say about my old Braun 8995, which I I've had for 7 years. The Braun was a very good but always left behind a few of my neck hairs. It was also not nearly as close of a shave as the LA93. Ive never owned a wet/dry shaver before and within a day I cant Imagine using a dry only model. The only thing I am not crazy about is the Vortex cleaning station's dry cycle. It can take an hour or more to dry which is double the time of the Braun's cleaning stations whole cleaning cycle. They should have used a combination of mild heat and a fan. Other than that everything else about the LA93 is top notch if Panasonic keeps innovating like this I might have to stick with the brand until they fall off.   216. I have been using this shaver for about 1 year now. When I originally saw this shaver on the Men's Health awards for best electric razor I was intrigued. I had always found electric razors to be clunky, noisy, and inefficient. The reviews came out for this product and they were rave! I was getting very excited about a shaver that I may enjoy using every day. I dropped the cash and haven't looked back. The Dock: Amazing how far technology has come since my father's era of safety razors. A rechargeable, self cleaning, self drying razor with a digital display. The dock performs two functions, cleaning/drying, and charging. This makes it very easy to maintain a clean razor that is free of oils, hair, etc. After a shave one simply puts the shaver in the dock, presses one button and the rest is history. There are cleaner packs which must be changed every 30 shaves, but these can be purchased very cheap here on Amazon; $9.99 USD for a 3 pack (that is 90 shaves for $10). The Shaver: The machine itself is easy on the eyes. It's shape is attractive without being too futuristic and gaudy. It inspires confidence in the grip whether holding it right side up or up side down. The head has a wide swivel range and with only small adjustments to my shaving angles it performed dry as well as any traditional razor with cream that I had ever used. The motor in here is incredibly strong, smooth, and quiet. I can't remember the figure off hand but I think the motor revs to 14,000 RPMs, which is 3-5k higher than other razors. After coming from a Wal-mart $80 electric razor this thing was like driving a Ferrari after being stuck in a Toyota for years. It completely changed my opinion of electric razors. The Shave: Smooth, very close, and with little to no irritation. With the dexterous head there is no place on my jaw line that it fails to cope with. Someone else had complained about the upper lip, but the confidence this shaver gives me I have never had a problem getting a perfectly smooth shave beneath the nose. The End: You cannot go wrong with this shaver in my opinion. If you are looking to get out of your current electric razor this one is worth the scratch. The price may be up there but it is absolutely worth the money. If you are currently shaving with a traditional razor this may be more of a step out of your comfort zone, but this guy at least can say it was the best personal hygiene choice he has made since switching to solid stick deodorant.
  217. I read the reviews here and on other sites. I replaced my Braun Synchro shaving system with this and couldn't be happier. The Braun would lose effectiveness quickly and never gave me a close shave. I didn't realize how radically better my shaving experience could be until I bought the Panasonic. The ability to quickly get a clean shave and the ease of clean up are my favorite things about this product. After I finish shaving I pop the foil off and run the cutter under the faucet while running, and rinse the foil. I then put the shaver back together and into the cleaning unit. It gives the shaver a quick clean and dries and charges. Simple. The built in display is annoyingly bright at night, and blinks every second if you've completed a cleaning cycle in the base unit. I tip the shaver off the contacts to stop the light. That's my only beef with the design. Great product!

  223. Had this shaver about 2 weeks now and on a scale of 1-5 this shaver is a 10! Every few years I buy a new shaver and have tried ever shaver imaginable. THIS is by far the best electric razor on the planet. I bought it ONLY because of the reviews and had every intention of returning it. Only in the last few days did I actually open up the cleaning solution and started to use the self clean mode, which is excellent by the way. Every few years I try a new shaver and always seem to go back to Norelco because its the lest irritating. 3 years ago I bought the top of the line Braun foil shaver and it was miserable experience. My face is very sensitive with very fine and thick hairs on my beard. The Braun's motor was not strong enough and felt like it plucked out my hairs, giving me ingrown hairs, rash and after 2 months small part of the foil broke giving me deep scratches all over my face. Put the Braun in my drawer and bought a top of the line Norelco. Norelco is OK, quiet, but just doesn't shave that close. Saw the new Norelco 1280x, was going to buy it but thought I give the Panasonic a try because of the great reviews. This Panasonic is AMAZING!!! It is by far the fastest and most COMFORTABLE shaver I ever had. If your a Norelco/Rotary shaver make the switch to the Panasonic ES-LA93. The Ultra Fast 14,000RPM motor, vibrates (pulsates)lifting your beard, giving you an incredible close and comfortable shave. Thought this was just a gimick but it really works and works amazingly. I shave in 1/2 the time of my old norelco and without irritation. Only 2-3 passes of each area and you are done. Wet shave is amazing to but I really prefer a dry shave. Dry shave is faster and just as close. Don't let the big head on this bad boy intimidate you, it functions so perfectly, cuts down shaving time and easily gets every hard to reach spot (ex: under nose, neck etc...). First thing you will notice is how quiet this shaver is (compared to my old Braun).Then the power, like have a Ferrari in your hand. Even after 2 days it easily shaves my beard without breaking a sweat. The motor doesn't even slow down. It is so quiet, smooth and gentle I had to keep feeling my face to confirm it was actually shaving my beard. The closeness is amazing and gets better the more you use it (and get comfortable with the shaver). I have only 2 complaints. 1. When charging it has an annoyingly BRIGHT, blue LED light that blinks. This light is so bright you might have a Jet land in your bathroom. 2. is the side burn trimmer is a little small (and close to the shaver). Still functions fine but would be perfect if it was an inch or 2 longer. SUMMARY: The Panasonic ES-LA93 is hands down the best shaver out there. If you are a Norelco guy (like I was) do yourself a favor and try this. You will never look back. The Panasonic shaves just as close as a blade and is way more comfortable. The self cleaning feature is like having a new shaver every day. Nice thing is replacement blades are $17 which is very reasonable, compared to 38-50+ for Norelco or Braun.
  224. I have a heavy beard. I shave once a day. The closest shave I get is with a Mach 3, but sometimes I get cuts or irritation. I tried a different foil electric shaver in the past, but found that it took longer per shave than with a Mach 3, I still got the same amount of irritation, and the shave was no where near as close. This shaver is much better than my last. It shaves closer, but still not baby smooth. My shaving time seems to be around 3 minutes and 30 seconds (it has a timer that tells you how long you shaved for). It irritates a lot less though, and can be used dry or wet (I seem to get better results dry). Only problem is it often misses a lot of hairs around the lower neck area, which means going over and over that spot in different directions to try and get them all, and this leads to irritation. Sometimes no matter how many times I go over that area, there are some hairs it just can't get. I'm almost tempted to use a razor to finish the job, but I'm trying to just get used to it. The cleaning base does a good job, although it takes about half an hour, and can be a little loud in a quiet house (goes on an off). All in all it's a good shaver, and I'll stick with it, but it's not a revolutionary product. There's pros and cons compared to a Mach 3 shave, and cost adds up to more or less the same in the long run. UPDATE: I gave up on the cleaning base. It's too loud, takes too much space, takes too much time, and starts to smell after a while. Just rinse the thing under a tap and rub some soap on it now and then. Easier, takes less time and doesn't clutter the bathroom. If you can, just buy the model without the base and save some cash.
  225. I have skin allergies, and face shaving was always like a torture for me. Using traditional blades or cheap machines did not help at all. I could shave at most with two weeks intervals, since my skin was severely irritated. However, after buying this product, my problem with face shaving is solved! It gives a very close shave with near-zero irritation! This is the machine I was looking for very long time. I am very pleased with its minimum irritation property. Its battery life and usability are also perfect. I strongly recommend this product, especially with the people with sensitive skin. It worth its price.
  226. The shaver is better than most but doesnt work as well on certain spots or angles especially in the neck areas and the angle of the neckline to the jaw. For the amount of money I paid I expected it to be more thorough. Also you can get razor burns if you press too hard on a particular spot it hasnt taken care of.
  227. I have been a Philips users for the past 10 years but i have never had a close a shave than what my new shaver offers me! Great product. So easy to use and maintain.
  228. I am not impressed easily, so this shaver was a wonderful surprise. I am a long time user of Panasonic shavers, this one replaces a failed ES8168 I purchased in 2007 (ES8152 in 2004, and ES8003 in 2002 - still works today). Have used the last two daily in the shower - always followed by razor, as it was never close enough. Same was true with the Norelco I had before these, the only other close shave was from a Braun, but it was not a wet/dry shaver and was cord only. Today was the first time ever that I did not need to use the razor touch-up! very clean shave and no irritation what so ever. Actually I was not going to purchase another Panasonic, after the horrid experience I had with their customer service getting the last one repaired (display stopped working a couple of months after the purchase), but the limited choices in wet/dry shavers led me back to the ES-LA93-K, and I am glad I gave it a try. Aside from its slick look, it is comfortable to hold, and is by far the best electric shaver I have ever owned. So lets hope this keeps working, and I do not have to call their support again ;^)
  229. I know they all claim to shave as close as a blade and most dont but the Panasonic ES-LA93-K really does. This shaver is a joy to use easy to clean and very mild on sensitive skin. Great value at the amazon price
  230. I had been using a Gillette Fusion manual razor for about 3 years, and I suppose it worked just fine. It would cut pretty closely, but always give me razor burn no matter what I did to prevent it. I felt like I needed to switch to something that wouldn't keep hurting my skin. I did a lot of shopping, and a lot of review reading here on Amazon. My brother had recommended the [[ASIN:B003YJAZZ4 Braun Series 7- 790cc Pulsonic Shaver System, Silver]], which he owns. I tried it out, liked it, but felt like I could find something better...enter the Panasonic ES-LA93-K. This thing got really great reviews, and even got the Good Housekeeping \\"Seal of Approval\\", all of which meant nothing to me. I had to try it. It was on sale for about $175 + a mail in rebate, so I bought it. I have to admit, this thing seems like a beast at first. It has it's own massive box, full of documentation, Vortex cleaning/charging dock, power cable, case, and even a nice hard plastic cap to protect the foil. I took it out, charged it up (charging is FAST, and you never need to worry about ruining the battery by leaving it plugged in, it shuts down once it reaches 100%), and took my first dry shave. If you've never done a dry shave with an electric razor before, you should probably start with a wet shave. This thing is great, the wet shave feels really nice, cleans up easily, and really reduces irritation. The first 40 days with this razor were the most difficult for me. One day, my face just got completely irritated, and bright red; which made for an extremely uncomfortable weekend. But, this thing will give the closet shave ever...it's ridiculous how great it is. After those first 40 days, the zones of my face that used to get REALLY red and irritated, no longer do. The cleaning station works extremely well, and I use it every day, with no problems. I think the cartridge should last a little longer than one month, using it every day. I cannot give this razor more than 5 stars, but I would.
  231. Happy with the: speed of the motor, shaving time, closeness, shaver info, no added hair/razor bumps, over all feel after shaving, and it does what is stated.
  232. I purchased this shaver to replace an older Braun model and the difference was immediate. I noticed a much closer shave right away. The previous complaints about the bright LED light are correct but there is an easy fix if the shaver is in your bathroom, which it most likely is, just close the door. It also takes a while for the cleaning system to run but that is not a big deal for me. I am very happy with this purchase.
  233. I found this to be a well engineered product. This has been the only electric razor, I've owned so far, that would cleanly cut the stubble on the neck. Another plus it's very smooth and quiet and easy to clean.
  234. For a baseline, see my review of the 8078 this replaced [...]. After nearly five years, the batteries on the 8078 gave up and forced me to buy a new shaver. By the time the this puppy arrived, I had a week of growth on my head and beard. I figured this would be a good test, and my first shave was dry with LectricShave pretreatment. The shaver went to town, leaving smooth skin on the sides of my head (where hair grows) and getting the elusive few that try to annoy me on the top. It did the same with my beard, and left no irritation on either the normal skin or the skin that had radiation treatment. I rinsed the head by dunking it in hot water halfway through to clear an appreciable amount of hair, and when I continued I was surprised to find that the wet foil didn't tug on my skin like the 8078 would when wet. I'm guessing that this is attributable to the vibrating head. Since the first shave, I've done completely dry shaves, my normal wet shaves with Edge cream and dry with Billy Jealousy lightening bolt pre-electric lotion as well. Dry is satisfactory with and without pre-lotion, but most comfortable with lightening bolt. My favorite is still to shave in the shower with plenty of Edge. The shape is definitely different from the old Panasonic, and the head is designed to allow drainage on the top and bottom. The older one had no such drainage and I have found that if I hold the shaver in a way that prevents draining, I have to work harder. This is not a big issue because the head can go 20 degrees or so in every direction, but it took some getting used to. If you're switching to electric, I don't think this will have the curve that less expensive shavers have, but if you're not thrilled on day one give it a few weeks. I have a mix of thick beard on my chin and under my substantial nose, thin beard with sensitive skin that was radiated in the 1980s on my cheeks, moderate hair on the sides of my head and only a few stalwart survivors guarding the top. I have yet to need an aftershave.
  235. Bought this for my husband in the military and he said its the best shaver he has ever used. He can use it everyday and not get any razor burn like with other razors electric or not. Worth the money!!
  236. Easy to use, I have curly beard and I use this product to help control bumps and ingrown hairs. First I heat my face with hot water then apply an oil or skin cream I shave through this oil. The oil barrier leaves me a decent shave but not so close that hairs get caught under the skin. It cleans easily in the shower. I also use it for a touch up shave by shaving dry but applying minimal pressure, just barely touching the skin and I have been successful wiith this method as well but remember that the technique is partially hand talent.<br />Downside, so far it does get every hair so a little touch is required every other shave, especially under the nose<br />Bottom line,I got more than my $ worth, it makes my life easier and convenient , you can shave almost anywhere
  237. I choose this shaver because it has 4 heads for a closer shave. It contours to your face and neck. I like the lock on the power switch. It has a sleek style and the blue LED'S are attractive. This is my 2nd Panasonic and I am completely satisfied.

  244. Best electric shaver ever. Tried Braun 4 years ago and changed for Panasonic ES8249. At that stage, the Panasonic shaved closer than a Gilette Fusion with less irritation. I wanted to upgrade to get a full floating head. Wet feature is great. Shaves closer under the shower!
  245. I've been using Panasonic Wet/Dry shavers for almost 30 years now, so I won't go into the discussion on shaving quality. Let's just say that shaving performance has gradually improved throughout the years. Instead, I will point out a few features that have changed with recent models: Improvements: -Sliding lock for power button. This is a much needed feature for travel. With prior Panasonic shavers it has happened twice that I've gone on a long trip (without bringing the charger) only to find that the shaver accidentally has started in the luggage and run the battery empty. -The cradle automatically handles charging. You do not need to manually enable charging by pressing a button on the cradle. Set backs: -The razor has a very bright blue light that blinks when charging is complete. This is the way it was in previous models (e.g. ES8168) and this is perfectly fine when charging was manually instigated like in previous model. However, the new ES-LA93 cradle automatically handles charging, which means the blue light blinks every day and night. Totally useless and irritating. This blinking is clearly a remnant of previous models and it is an oversight of Panasonic to leave it this way. Needs to be fixed in next version! -The razor cannot stand on its edge like in the picture. The edge is rounded. You have to lay down the razor. Consequently I always want to store it in the cradle and as a result I am punished with the blinking light. I think this is the first Panasonic shaver I've owned that does not let me store it in upright position. Missing feature: -No way to make the cradle default to \\"dry\\" mode. I prefer to clean the razor with hand soap after each shave (as described in the manual, and as I have been doing for 30 years). Then I put it in the cradle to dry. Every time I need to press the button to set the cradle to dry mode. Why can't this be automatic? This is how I use the cradle - it should be possible to \\"configure\\" it to do my desiredevery day action automatically. I remove the shaver from the cradle to shave, then I clean it after each use, when I put it in the cradle it should know to start drying automatically. All in all this new shaver did not meet my high expectations. The ES-8168 was a great shaver and the ES-LA93 only marginally improves things while it adds a couple of new annoyances. Two minor software fixes (disable blinking light and add cradle auto dry) would have made this a 5-star review. Update: It appears the blinking light annoyance is fixed in the new 5-blade ES-LV81 model.
  246. I've been using the ES-LA93-K for the past 6 weeks. I'm a long time electric shaver user (20+ years), having used various models in the past - Philips rotary, and several Braun foil models (most recent was the Braun Activator series). This Panasonic is my first wet/dry shaver, and I have to say that it offers the closest and most comfortable shave I've ever experienced from an electric.<br /><br />There are so many reviews for this shaver (mainly positive which led me to purchase mine), not wanting to be repetitive but I'll just share some of my experiences & observations:<br /><br />Pros:<br />Shaver: not as huge as it appears in the images, and not too heavy, fit my hand just right after a short (2-3 day) 'getting used to' period. The head is on the large side, and took some getting used to / maneuvering for some areas (under nose), but still doable. The nice thing is that the head pivots on 2 axises (side to side, front and back), this is what sets it apart from single axis shavers - it follows the contours of the neck, chin & jawline really well.<br /><br />The foil is very smooth, and glides with hardly any resistance, catching pretty much everything in a pass or two. Even with a couple days worth of stubble (quite a bit in my case), it doesn't pinch or snag the hairs like other models I've used. I find that I am taking 2 to 3 minutes less to do the job with this shaver than my Braun predecessor. As for the noise, it's a bit more noisy than other shavers I've used - but the motors in this shaver are oscillating much faster than others, so I'd say it might be the higher pitch that makes it seem louder, it's a trade off for an exceptionally close shave. The wet shave / clean feature is a great thing to have. LCD screen is intuitive, showing total shave time, battery level and cleaning indicator.<br /><br />Cons:<br />The pop-up trimmer is on the smallish side, and due to the placement / head size is hard to maneuver in tight spots. The charging / cleaning base isn't overly large, but I am really disappointed in the cleaning time (and noise) compared to my old Braun. The cleaning / drying cycle is 3 hours, and the base uses an annoying fan to dry the shaver. Braun's Activator base was silent (and much faster), using an inductive heater to dry. It's much faster (and silent) to just wet clean this shaver with a drop of hand soap, and pop the foil off to rinse and let it air dry...no need for the charging base. Another nuisance mentioned by others is the LCD screen flashes bright blue every 2 seconds when it's plugged in (or in the base) to indicate full charge. It's like an annoying flashing nightlight...a simple LED indicator or unlit LCD would have been perfectly adequate to know when the thing was charged. I would have preferred a rigid travel case for this than the soft pouch they included - to better protect the shaver when traveling.<br /><br />All in all, this offers an exceptionally close & comfortable shave (which is why I bought it); and despite having some design quirks, the pros clearly outweighed the cons in my book.
  247. Purchased this shaver from Amazon with the included cleaning/charging base. Background: I am a life long blade shaver and up until recently used the Mach 5 Fusion battery powered razor. I have a coarse, moderately thick beard. I never feel I get a very close shave with my blade razor after a \\"normal shave\\". I usually shave in the shower. If I want a really close shave for a wedding, pictures etc, I usually shave normally with the grain, then reapply shaving cream (Billy Jealousy Hyroplane)and then shave AGAINST the grain. This gives me a very close shave at the expense of significant irritation the next day or two. I have been trying to find a way to get a close have so I don't look like I have a 5 o'clock shadow at 1pm... My father purchased a Braun 7 series electric razor on a whim. I tried it for 2 days when he was visiting and really liked how well it shaved. It is a relatively small shaver and a bit noisy. It does not give very good feedback as to when you are picking up left over hairs (some shavers you can hear as they cut extra hairs, the braun, it is just always loud). I was going to purchase the Braun since I liked how it shaved, but it is a dry shave only, not water proof. I stumbled upon the Panasonic while I was researching razors and decided to give it a try. Initially, I was a little disappointed. I didn't think it shaved quite as close as I remembered the Braun shaving, but memories can be deceiving...I was also taken back as to how big the shaver head was. Some reviews on here say it really isn't as big as it looks in the pictures...baloney...it is every bit as big as it looks which makes it more challenging than the Braun the save the mustache area. I was about to return the razor, when my dad visited again and I did a blind test with my wife and father. I shaved half my face with each razor for 2 minutes and had them compare. They both felt the Panasonic side was just a bit smoother. I felt the same way... THEN, I decided to try it in the shower since that was the real reason I went Panasonic (I had not tried wet shaving for the first couple of weeks just to get used to the razor...) EUREKA! The Panasonic produced the best shave I have yet had while I was in the shower. I took a normal shower as I always do to let my beard get moist and soft. Then I applied a small amount of the Billy Jealousy Hydroplane silicone shave cream (Love this stuff). The silicone cream allows the razor to glide around your face in any direction minimizing the irritation and pulling and allowing you to go over areas in multiple directions to get more hairs. I shave between 3 and 4 minutes and get a great shave. The razor is then easy to clean in the shower too. I rarely use the cleaning station (hot tip, if you will wet shave most of the time, save the $$ and get the razor without the cleaning station). Overall, I really like the razor now that I have used it for several weeks and started using it in the shower. It gets my beard closer than a blade but does leave a few hairs behind. I hope this improves as I use the shaver longer and my face gets used to the electric shave. Hope this helps.
  248. I am using Electrical shaver from past 15 years, I tried all brands but This is Gem. Very close and easy to clean
  249. I've been using this razor for about 18 months. Construction is high-quality; battery life substantial; cleaning of device with tap water is simple (I didn't want to buy Panasonic's cleaning tablets). Trim is effective for neck and earlobes (the stray hair). However, I was initially a bit disappointed with the razor, as it did not, for me, shave as closely as a straight razor (my razor of choice was a Fusion). Once I discovered that I could make a 2 minute and 30 second pass with the Panasonic, followed by the Fusion, I was very happy: closest, most pain-free shave I've ever had. Total procedure takes me 5 minutes, and there's never any discomfort. Some weekends I just use the Panasonic and forego the Fusion. Haven't nicked myself in months. My wife much prefers the barber-shop closeness as well. For me this double razor system does work, even with tough to get corners and curves around jaw and neck. Review should be a 4.5 star.

  263. I have owned both the Braun 5 and 7 series, as well as many other shavers in my life and the panasonic LA93(The LA63 is exactly the same but without a cleaning station or the special contact points to use it)is by far the best, it has no problem clearing a 3-4 day beard without trimming first. It can be used with shaving cream, in the shower and it really does shave as close as a razor with minimal razor burn. My only complaint is with the cleaning solution, it is just a small cartridge filled with dry detergent that the instructions say is only good for 30 days no matter how much or how little you use it. Where as the Braun cleaning solution will sterilize your shaver, smells like a powerful cleaning solution (Like scented rubbing alchohol), and is good until it turns dark from being filled with shavings no matter how long it takes. But I guess the cleaning solution isn't really a big deal since both the panasonic LA63 and LA93 have another cleaning option where you hold the power button down for 2-3 seconds to put the shaver into \\"turbo\\" or \\"sonic\\" mode meant only to clean the shaver(instructions warn not to shave in this mode as it could damage your skin), while in \\"turbo\\" mode you simply hold the shaver under running water and add a little hand soap. My advice would be to save a few bucks and buy the panasonic LA63 as it's the exact same shaver as the LA93 and I'm not that impressed with the cleaning solution, besides it has the built in cleaning option. Also do a search for rebates for this and anything else you buy, I found a $30 rebate for this shaver.

  265. My husband loves this shaver.
  266. Panasonic has really outdone themselves this time, this shaver impressed me right out of the box when i first saw the super sleek HI gloss black finish on the shaver, not only that, the shaver pretty much does everything from telling you it needs a rinse while shaving to letting you know how long you've just shaved for, down to the second. It comes with a travel case and charger so you dont have to take the cleaning station with you on trips. When you're done with a quick shave, set it in the station and press select twice to start the fan that dries your shaver or press once to start the insane cleaning process which from what i hear seems like a 10 stage process. in short, it's AWESOME all the way around and I will never go back to razors.
  267. Shaver works well and creates a smooth shave. The shaver moves well along the face. Would definitely buy another if needed.
  268. Easily the best electric shaver I've owned.<br />For years, due to sensitive skin, I've shaved with electric and then followed up with a razor. I no longer have to do that. I've had this razor a few months and have no complaints, only praise. The cleaning process is a bit noisy, but if you put it in the cleaner before you leave for work, you'll never be around to hear it. The auto clean works exceptionally well. The change holds well and while it's slightly difficult to get the head between your upper lip and below your nose, it can get it done.<br />The cleaning cartridges are fairly priced and better than an infection from the razor yuck getting in your pores.<br />When this razor dies, which hopefully won't be for a while, I will replace it with another Panasonic of this quality.
  269. This is one of the most fantastic products that I have purchased, its quality is incredible and has a lot of details, also looks great.

  271. This Arc 4 shaver does the job...but it could be better at lifting tough laying hairs that are around the jaw line and neck area.   273. I have never used an electric shaver before. I always thought that they could not shave as close as a blade, especially with my tough beard. This shaver proved me wrong. I have used it both wet and dry and I get a very close shave. It is also easy to clean (I have only used the liquid soap option with the dryer function on the charging unit). It may be a bit pricey but with the convenience, portability, and close shave I am very satisfied with my purchase.
  274. I bought this in October 2010. Disclaimer-- I have seriously thick hair and it grows in a swirl pattern at the jawline. Shaving takes me 15 minutes for a good job, with a blade, it's messy. So I bought this after reading the reviews. For most people, I think you get a good shave, while it works. For me, it was no better than the blade, but without the cuts. However, it didn't justify the price. Then came, the cleaning and replacing costs which are obscene.<br /><br />Lastly, the battery progressively wore out along with the LED screen. This week, it completely died.<br /><br />I have replaced it with the Phillips Norelce 1290. So far It's an improvement over this from its day 1 performance, but not amazingly so. That said, for me and my particular shaving challenges, I thinks the broad circular heads of the Norelco is a better system.
  275. It's a really good shaver. It gets close, especially if you take it into the shower and use shaving cream.   276. Been using this shaver for 6 months now and have one big pro, and one big con. I have used electric shavers for 20+ years. I have always used the norelcos. I liked them, with exception of neck rash during dry climate times. This Panasonic does not do that, which is very nice. BUT, its very loud. My old razers could barely be heard, and this thing can be heard 2 rooms away. I will probably use this for a few years and then go back to the norelcos, but I do like the shave it gives. I dont use the cleaning part..just rinse it out every few uses.
  277. I just received the Braun Series 7 and the Panasonic ES-LA93-K in the mail. I originally bought the Norelco 3d but it did a terrible job of shaving my face so I sent it back. It left long hairs on my neck and it took for ever to shave. Also it irritated the heck out of my neck.<br /><br />I ordered the Braun Series 7 and Panasonic ES-LA93-K and they arrived at the same time. I tried both of the shavers out on the first day I got them. From the first use I loved Panasonic ES-LA93-K. It shaved my face extremely close, which is basically the only thing I care about. It did a really good on my neck as well as my face. I used some pre shave oil and it shaved my face as close as a razor. Today I used solely Panasonic ES-LA93-K and my face is so smooth its ridiculous. I am going to give the Braun another try tomorrow by itself and compare the shaves.<br /><br />Panasonic ES-LA93-K is very comfortable to hold and seems like it effortlessly shaves my facial hair very close. I am in love with it. The Braun had better do a tremendous job tomorrow morning or it will be heading back.
  278. I bought the Panasonic ES-LA93-K Men's 4-Blade shaver to replace my Braun 7 series that after 18 months under went product failure. I was hesitant to buy another shaver over $200. However, after reading the reviews and seeing the rating on the Panasonic ES-LA93 I was impressed. Yet,most places I looked the price was almost $400 - that is until I went to Amazon. Amazon has the shaver at 50% discount making it cheaper than the Braun 7 series I bought!<br /><br />I've had the shaver for about 2 weeks. The shaves I've gotten are better than any razor blade or electric shaver I've used. Shaves are 3 min or less. Even the fine hairs on my neck are gone after one pass.<br /><br />The shaver has a good ergonomic fit to my hand. It is quietier than the Braun. I like the fact you can shave wet or dry giving me the option to use shaving cream or pre-shave. Cleaning is simple - use the self-cleaner - much quieter than the Braun unit - and takes about 90 min to cycle. Or you can clean the blades with liquid soap and water, turn the shaver on for 20 sec rinse, dry and it is done! I don't know how long the cleaning cartridge lasts since I've only started using the system.<br /><br />If you're in the market for an electric shaver, this is the one to get. And as long as Amazon has it at the 50% or better discount it is a bargain that shouldn't be passed up!
  279. From experience this shaver, when used with shaving cream, shaves closer and more comfortably than the Braun Pulsonic and the Norelco Arcitec competitors. The Braun did not do the neck well, and both it and the Arcitec required repeated passes over the same area to get the job done. The Arcitec did a poor job in the area immediately under the nose. The Panasonic also does a better job than the Gillette Fusion blades. It is a cinch to clean using liquid soap as directed or by using the accompanying cleaning machine. It will do almost as well shaving dry, but then you risk the possibility of the shaver pinching the looser skin on the neck. The only drawback is the length of the cleaning/drying cycle, which can last up to 3 hours. Just drying takes half this amount of time.
  280. I'll admit it...I was a drinker of the Braun\\" Kool-Aid\\" for over 20 years. Having been very disappointed in the fit and finish, performance, and numerous problems with my last Braun 790 (gave up on it in just under a year), I decided to try this Panasonic model. First, the fit and finish of the Panasonic far surpassed the Braun 790 by a wide margin. I paid a hefty premium for a German \\"engineered\\" product that was slapped together as cheaply as possible in a Chinese sweat shop. Having been used to the feel and handling of a Braun, the Panasonic took about 2 shaves before I was proficient with it. The Panasonic may appear bulky, but it handles incredibly well, and the ergonomic handle and articulated shaving head are an excellent combination. The Panasonic delivers a superior shave, in my opinion, and accomplishes excellent results in fewer passes. It surpassed the closeness of a braun with a new foil and cutter block! The cleaning features differ slightly from Braun. I actually prefer using the smaller, and more convenient Panasonic cassette system. I love the results, and in my opinion, the Panasonic system leaves the razor more clean, and leaves no cleaning solvent residue. I personally have a beard; so if you have any concerns about the maneuverability of this razor's cutting head, it is a non-issue.
  281. My first review of the Panasonic ES-LA93-k said that the reviews of this Panasonic ES-LA93-K Vortex men's shaver are true, and that it really did give the closest shave with an electric razor, and nearly as close as a safety razor. The instructions could be a little more useful, but the shaver is great. That was my review in October 2010. It's now July 31, 2011 and I am on my THIRD Panasonic ES-LA93. The first two had to be returned because they stopped working. My third Panasonic ES-LA93 has died, just like the other two, for no apparent reason. It just stopped working, despite a full charge and being clean. It doesn't matter whether Panasonic would give me another one if I returned this one, I'm TIRED of returning them, of not having a good shaver to use, and of having to keep a backup shaver at the ready all the time. Panasonic obviously has quality control problems here, despite Hammacher-Schlemmer's glowing reviews which induced me to buy this shaver in the first place. Btw, the comments about the cleaning process taking hours, and being very loud, are entirely accurate.
  282. I've used disposable razors my whole life and recently decided to re-visit the electric shaver market after poor experiences with the cheap stuff. After much reading, I narrowed my choice down to Braun (top model, can't recall #) and the Panasonic ES-LA93-K. The Panasonic won largely in part to a special that Amazon had and I have not regretted my decision. While it doesn't deliver a shave as close as a razor (I don't think it's possible?), it's still very, very good. My skin is a lot happier for it too. No burning, snags or nicks after 1 month of near daily, dry use. A lot less messy too. My average shave time is just over 4 minutes and the Panasonic easily cuts down 1, 2 or 3 day growth. The base station makes maintenance a breeze. Just drop it in, hit a button and walk away. It gurgles, buzzes and blows it dry leaving you with a clean and charged shaver ready for the next day. I haven't replaced the cleaning cartridge yet, but it looks simple enough. As with most other Panasonic products, the quality is very good and the manual is complete and readable. Overall, I am satisfied with the Panasonic ES-LA93-K shaver and would recommend it.
  283. This shaver is giving me the best shaves ever. I have a particularly tough beard and I've experimented with many electric shavers over the years, always going back to a safety razor.   287. It is difficult to review this shaver, because one aspect of it is so good, and the other is so poor. First, let me say that I just bought a new one, to replace the same model that I purchased just over four years ago. So, I must like it well enough to spend another $200 for another one. And I do, but at the same time, I know what I am getting myself into.<br /><br />First, the good. This shaver gives an amazing shave. I shave in the shower with shaving cream, and it is absolutely the best electric shaver shave ever. Nearly as good as a double edge razor shave. The battery lasts over a week on a charge, and the cleaning unit does a good job of cleaning and charging it. I do wish that that were an option to run the clean/dry cycle without charging (as some other Panasonic models allow), so that I could clean the shaver while running a longer discharge cycle on the battery. However, that is not a huge issue.<br /><br />Now, for everything else. For a shaver that is supposedly &#34;wet or dry,&#34; the water sealing is not very good. Neither is the overall build quality or materials. Here is the history of the shaver that I just replaced:<br /><br />Bought the shaver in January, 2011. Everything was great until about 11 months later, when the display started to get wonky. Some parts would display, while others did not. There is a two-year parts and labor warranty, so I contacted Panasonic, who suggested that I send it back, and I did. I received either a new or completely refurbished shaver and cleaning unit in a new box. All was fine for about another 11 or 12 months, when the display started going wonky again. It kept showing that the shaver needed to be cleaned (it didn't), or half the charging display didn't work. Sometimes the display would come on after using the shaver, and not go off for hours. However, I realized that I had waited too long and was just outside the warranty period, and I did not want to pay to have it repaired. The shaver was still working otherwise, so I decided to keep using it. It continued to work, although the display continued to get worse and worse, until finally it would just light up with absolutely nothing displayed on it. The shave was still good.<br /><br />Over the course of the next year, two thing happened: I noticed that after shaving and removing and rinsing off the screen and head, when I turned the shaver upside down, water would drain out of the shaver. Not sure where it was coming from, but there was more than would have been just from the blades. Also, the back part of the case of the shaver started to peel and deteriorate around the area where it joins the front case. Finally, over the course of the last six months or so, the trimmer stopped working. It was at this point that I decided to replace it.<br /><br />I looked around, but could not really find another shaver that seemed to offer the shave that this one did. There was a $25 off coupon offered on Amazon, so I bought another one. Does this make me a fool? I don't know, but I really like the shave that I get from the shaver. I will watch the warranty dates more closely this time, and return it for replacement at the first sign of trouble.

  297. As a life-long user of &#34;regular&#34; razors, and high-quality shave cream, I was somewhat skeptical of an electric shaver. However, upon taking a job that required me to shave every day, and seeing the havoc that wreaked on my face, I decided to take the plunge with an electric razor.<br /><br />For the first week, shaving took longer, and still required a lot of touching up with my old razor. Then, after about two weeks, WOW, was I impressed. For the first time in my life, I can shave against the grain. Plus, I've found that this is most effective when you dry shave--shave creams just cause your facial hair to adhere to your face. I've been using this shaver for a month now, and can't imagine going back.<br /><br />If you're considering the version without the cleaning module, don't. Having cleaned this with regular water while on the road, and comparing that to using the cleaning system, there's no comparison. The system leaves the shaver clean, dry, and smelling great.<br /><br />A costly shaving device, but you will save on creams and razors in the long run.
  298. Liked it a lot more at first. Gave it 5 stars when I was less concerned about closeness and speed. Am now finding that it takes longer than a multiblade razor and doesn't shave as closely. The differences are not terrible: blade shaving time about 2 minutes in a shower vs electric at maybe another minute. The blade, however, gets a much closer shave to the touch. I originally bought it to go over areas that had recent surgery where I did not want a razor possibly nicking the skin or stitches. Now that all is healed, I find that I get better results with a multiblade razor in the shower in less time. The best results with the Panasonic were also in the shower with the same shaving gel. It seems now that it was unrealistic to think that a foil between the blades and the skin could ever be as close as a blade in direct contact with the skin. The price of the Panasonic could pay for at least 5 years of razor blades. Not displeased with it, but only use it occasionally at this point. It certainly works fine to its ability. For travel, particularly international travel, the weight factor always requires shifting back to blade razors. The charger is convenient and fast. Overall the design and workmanship are excellent.
  299. I am a long time Panasonic shaver user and I am really impressed with the closeness of the shave and ease of use of the ES-LA93. I have used both the ES882 and the ES8078 Linear shavers for the last decade or so. Each was significantly better than the last. The ES-LA93 is a significant upgrade over the ES8078. With the recent discount I would recommend to anyone holding onto their older Panasonic shaver to upgrade. It takes only 2 - 4 minutes to get a close shave that took 6 - 9 minutes on the ES8078. The shave is also closer for two reasons. First, the shaver does a better job on flat surfaces due to the larger head and mutliple cutting blades. Second it is so much faster on those surfaces that you have more time to concentrate on the trick curving areas of your face. As an additional benefit the wash and dry unit is much quieter and easier to use. You just place the shaver in the unit and it charges straight away.

Panasonic will then either repair or replace it at their choice. They will then mail me either the repaired unit or a replaced one. That's almost a MONTH! A MONTH!   306. I used previously two Braun shavers that lasted for 25 years, and still they do, but I was needing to replace the blade and make an adjustment, so I decided to change and buy a Philips Norelco 8170xl. I did it one year and a half ago. The Philips is very quiet and shaves fine, but I prefer the non rotary system of Braun and decided to buy their newest pulsonic model. Looking in Amazon and based on the reviews of Panasonic I decided to change my mind and buy this model. I was a very bad decision. Here are my comments for the three aspects that you need to consider when buying a new shaver after 6 month of use: The Shaver. Shaves well but not a real difference with my other cheaper and older machines. Some time it leaves difficult to cut hair as others reviewers says, probably it leaves more hair than the Philips that I´m using now (later I will say why i´m still using it), but in any case I prefer the feeling of the Panasonic or the Braun blade to the rotary of Philips. Panasonic is as noisy as the Braun but this is more comfortable to hold due to its shape. The pulsating system probably work but I don't appreciate it. I would give to the shaver 4 stars The cleaning module. Work well whiles it last. As other reviewer this is a bad part of the bundle. It cleans and also dry the machine. It can dry only if you prefer to wash it with soap and after only dry. This module is very, very noisy and uncomfortable if you are trying to listen the radio in the bathroom after the shave. Also it fails, may be because is sensible to the humidity and it stops to work for me, after the second change of the cleaning liquid. I would give 2 stars to this module. The service. The worst of everything and the reason why I´m giving 1 start to the entire package that you buy for the price that you pay (shaver, cleaning module, service). When I contacted them for the problem with the cleaning module, they told me that I have to return everything and they would sendme a new one. I insisted that I only wanted to repair the cleaning module and I would like to keep the saver so I would continue using it. They told me: don't worry they will send me very fast a complete new replacement unit. He told me that they always do that due this is a personal care item. I accepted. After more than two week I received a used one in a refurbish box nor as the original box that I sent them. This unit had clear signs of been used and I decided to open the head to to see if it had hair inside and I saw that it had some blades dangerously folded inside. I was so disappointed. Then I called them and after speaking with several people, they recognized that they were sending back refurbished units even for personal care products and doing that even if the yours is a working unit and nearly new as the mine. I had to return again the used one that received and I´m still waiting, for more than one month, to receive an used refurbish unit. Summary. Never again Panasonic,don mind if it is a tv, radio, shaver, anything.
