  314. I used this shaver for about a month and have found the results it produces to be very poor. I have a moderately coarse beard and this shaver is incapable of giving me a decent shave. I have followed all the instructions carefully and tried using it dry, with gel and I even bought some expensive shaving oil to try and improve the shave with only marginally better results. Shaving generally took me between 9 and 12 minutes with this product and still the results were quite poor compared to a sharp razor. It also caused me moderate skin irritation and frequently cut my face. I cannot recommend this product to anyone. It may produce acceptable results if you have very fine facial hair but even then I'm somewhat skeptical after my experience. My conclusions lead me to question the validity of some other reviews here that make claims such as \\"It's the best shave I've ever had\\" and \\"it takes me 3 minutes to shave\\". If you buy this product I suggest you make yourself familiar with the return policy and be prepared to do so!
  315. I have had mine for about two years now and still love it. It is nice to be able to clean it every day by pressing a button and I use Amazon for replacement cleaner and cutting heads. I do wish the cutting heads would stay sharper longer - I get about 8 months before replacing and notice a difference when I slap that new one on. I was a Norelco fan for years and would say that it did a slightly better job on my neck, but I see a lot of mixed reviews on Norelcos these days. I also used a Braun and have good things to say about that brand as well, but this Panasonic is best. Only problems I've had have been my fault. Got the cleaning/charging unit wet and it was replaced under warranty and didn't lock the switch off when packing for Europe. I heard some strange noises at the airport which I later realized was my razor running. It was completely discharged when I got there and I forgot to bring the charging cord. Had to get a razor from the front desk and lost about a pint of blood shaving each day. Reminded me how much I love this shavers over razors.
  316. After years trying electrical shavers and this is the one!<br />I use it everyday on either dry or wet shavings and it does the job beautifully. It took me three days to get the hang of it. Now I'd not change back to blades.<br />Above my expectations.
  317. I prefer shaving while i shower and was happy to find a good wet/dry shaver. I had no issues with the shave...if an area wasn't smooth i just ran it over the area again.<br /><br />After a month or two of use the LED started to flake out and display broken characters. No biggie as it wasn't impeding the use. A few days ago though it quit displaying any of the symbols or numbers, yet the display was lighting up.<br /><br />Being bored, I opened it up and found all sorts of hairs and moisture inside of the sealed, waterproof casing. With some cleaning and drying of the boards and display, I was only able to get the display partially working.<br /><br />The cleaning kit...can't say i really needed it since i wet shave and it takes up a good chunk of my counter. When it showed the little faucet icon i looked to see if it was actually dirty, but never saw any hair buildup.
  318. I have a Braun 7 series and liked it. Still use it, but am glad I picked this one up. It gives me a better overall shave and as long as it does that can we complain? Like any new razor, your skin has to adjust to it with a few shaves.
  319. I've always used blades and wet-shaved. 15 years ago I considered electric shavers a gimmick, but manufacturing, electronics, and materials have advanced some so I thought I'd try one out. I bought this one thinking I should go ahead and try one of the better shavers available. I tried it dry and then wet with and without a cream.<br /><br />The result is this shaver is much slower and far more tedious than a blade. The only reason I can imagine anyone using something like this is if they can't help cutting themself with a blade. With a blade, I can shave a 1, 2, or 4 day beard in less than 4 minutes total, with no more than 2 minutes of blade work (the other 2 being washing, lathering and rinsing). After shaving for that long with this Panasonic shaver, it's very spotty. I can go over the same area again and again in different directions, pushing, pulling and stretching, and it just doesn't shave it all. With a blade, one pass is enough, two, one in each direction is the most I'd ever use. This shaver is worthless to me. I can't say that among electric shavers it's particularly bad by comparison, but I found it useless.<br /><br />Any reasonably sharp blade is far better than this. I've used gilette cartridges, disposables, a straight-razor, safety-razors, BIC, whatever. I'm slower with a straight razor than I am with a t-handle, but the straight-razor is still faster than this electric.
  320. Awesome shaver. It is quick and does a fantastic job. A great replacement for my old Norelco shaver. Well worth the money. Lasts about 12 to 14 shaves between charges. Very quick recharge rate. Easy to clean.
  321. It does a good job on my face but not so good on my neck. In addition it smelled like B.O. until I had used it for about 3 weeks. Now I either got used to it or the smell has dissipated. I have to keep going over my neck and it never does get clean shaven. I'm afraid that, despite the rather high cost, this is not the &#34;perfect&#34; electric razor.
  322. Relatively good razor for the money. Good shave, good charge.<br /><br />However, about 10 months in, the screen failed. It now lights up every single icon / number on the display, so I can't tell what the charge is or what cleaning needs to be done.<br /><br />I called up customer service, as the razor is under warranty. However, they won't send me a new razor without sending the old one in. Given that this is a product I use daily, and is not a cheap razor that has had major issues within a year, this is not ideal. I asked if they could put a hold on my credit card and send me a new razor preemptively, and then remove the charge when they got the broken one, and they said they could not.<br /><br />In summary - poor display failed under a year, and customer service won't make my life easier. Not what I expect for a $200 product.
  323. I have owned 2 Panasonic shavers over the last 4 years. Both of them were top of the line at the time and both had the cleaning/charging base. The Shavers work very well but they do not do very well on the neck or jaw line. That is a minor issue. The real issue for people considering purchasing a Panasonic shaver with the charging/cleaning base is that the base will only last about a year then it will start to leak and the electronics will fail. Both of my shaver bases did the exact same thing in almost the exact same amount of time so it is definitely a quality problem. I take care of my shavers so it is not a case of abuse.<br /><br />Forget about any support from Panasonic - it is the absolute worst customer service you can imagine. They tell you to send in the razor and the base which of course leaves you without a razor for 6 weeks or more. Why do they need the razor when the problem is the base leaks all over the counter? The leak has nothing to do with the razor. When you try to explain this to them they just tell you to send everything to them and wait for them to decide what to do. In the mean time you will just go buy something else.<br /><br />I know the reviews here are all very positive and I liked the razor so much that I bought another one when the base started leaking after only a year. But when the second one did the same thing I had too much invested in these things to go buy another razor so I just threw the base in the trash and charge it from the wall with the standard cord.<br /><br />I recommend these with a huge \\"buyer beware\\". Also be sure to keep a towel near so you can mop up the counter when is starts leaking.<br />Personally, I'm done with Panasonic razors after dumping nearly $500 into them over the last 4 years.
  324. Husband loves it! he has very sensitive skin and after purchasing many different razor and product this is the first one he never has issues with , been using it for a while now and still loves it
  325. Great Product! I will buy again if I need it. Perfect Shaving and fast. I recommend the cleaning station, makes more easy the cleaning shaving experience.
  326. I have been using a Braun series 7 for about a year. I was getting pretty good results, but thought I would try this Panasonic after reading the many 5 star reviews. Maybe I'm doing something wrong, but I am not happy at all with results I'm getting with this shaver. I end up having to finish with shaving cream and my Gillette Fusion razor. I switched to an electric razor when I was hospitalized for three weeks and could not get up to shave. I bought my Braun from Amazon after research and reading the reviews. My wife asked me what I wanted for Christmas and I told her that I wanted a new electric razor. So that is how I ended up with this Panasonic. I have tried it dry, with pre- shave and with shaving gel and cream. None of these gave a close shave. I hate to go back to using cream and a bladed razor. So I guess I will replace the blades in my Braun and give this Panasonic to my son-in-law.
  327. I have used this shaver for a month and it gives quick close shaves. Not impressed with the cleaning system. Cleaning under running water is fast and easy.
  328. A shave that makes your face feel soft and smooth again. The wide head, that floats sideways to ensure maximum contact, ensures that you can cover your entire beard growth area quickly and efficiently. I use this to shave my face and also my neck where untidy hairs grow. I have had two Panasonic shavers before this one and they have each lasted me around 4 years each before upgrading, so I know that keeping your razor clean is the best way to ensure that it remains at it's best. The wet cleaning system this shaver uses means that keeping my shaver clean, unclogged and sharp is no effort at all; hence I do not anticipate a performance degradation, with age, which I experienced with the previous models. This is now and very quick and easy process and I am very happy with my purchase. Even when away and without the cleaning base unit, just a small squirt with liquid soap and then running it under a tap does the job perfectly. A great product with an unbelievably fast service to New Zealand.
  329. The competition was very close between my Braun 760cc and the Panasonic ES-LA93-k which I got on an Amazon deal of the day promotion. The Panasonic basically takes the same amount of time to shave my face, but irritates my skin less, and the shave seems to last longer - probably because it cuts a little closer. After getting used to the shape, the Panasonic wins for me. Neither of them have a very good sideburn trimmer. For the record - I liked my old Braun 8590 (lasted for 10 years) much more than the newer 760cc.
  330. So I received this electric shaver and it's been 2 days, so far I like it a lot.<br /><br />Pros :<br />- Good quality materials are used,<br />- Easier to clean than Braun 7 series (my dad has one)<br />- Information displayed is very useful such as number of secs used, battery life etc.<br /><br />Cons :<br />- It takes 180 minutes to dry<br />- When the battery is full it flashes, it's kind of annoying<br />- When the shaver is in clean mode it makes a long beep noise every 5 secs, I am the first person who wakes up in the house and by the time I leave the house everyone is in sleep so I can't really clean the shaver unless I close the washroom door.<br /><br />Maybe I don't know enough about this shaver to configure, I will update later in a week or two once I figure out how to turn off the beeps.
  331. Bottom line up front: This is the best electric razor I've ever owned. Worth every penny. Quality product. FINALLY, a solution to my razor bumps!<br /><br />ME - I am in the military, which means I have to shave every day. I hate shaving with an angry, burning passion. I have been in the military for 18 years and the worst part about the job, day to day, has been having to shave each morning. Yeah, I dislike shaving THAT much. I have light skin and coarse facial hair that is very prone to ingrown hairs (aka razor bumps). I have tried everything to mitigate this condition... yes, EVERYTHING. A zillion different combinations of blades, techniques, shaving creams/gels, and after shave treatments like Bump Stopper. I have also tried several other electric razors... other foil and rotary shavers. I have tried blades and razors and creams reportedly designed specifically for sensitive skin. I've tried chemical depilatories. A few years ago, I even underwent several extremely painful laser hair removal treatments to try and get rid of my beard for good... that did NOT go well! Finally, I've found a combination of products that drastically reduces (although it does not eliminate completely) the number of ingrown hairs I'm liable to suffer from. This electric razor from Panasonic is at the center of that combination.<br /><br />MY HISTORY WITH THIS LINE OF RAZORS - I am speaking from experience. Panasonic helped me turn the tide in my battle against razor bumps about 10 years ago. I'm estimating this figure because it's been so long. I bought one of the very first models of their Linear foil shaver series... the ES8077, I think. I only recently replaced it with this newer model, the ESLA93K, because the cleaning/charging station finally gave up the ghost. Even then, it was probably due to my overzealous cleaning of the unit, that involved running quite a bit of water over (and ultimately inside of) it. Up until that point, the razor itself, the chargingbase, and the cleaning system worked exactly as well as they did when they were BRAND NEW. TEN YEARS AGO. When was the last time you could say that about one of your small appliances, especially one that used some sort of rechargeable battery system? I wish Panasonic made dustbusters, because I've been through about four of those suckers (no pun intended) in the past decade... they stop holding a charge the second you take them out of the box! As long as you periodically change the foil, the blades, and the cleaning cartridges, you've got a product that will last you a LONG time.<br /><br />WHY A PANASONIC LINEAR SERIES RAZOR vs. OTHER BRANDS? - Several reasons I will cover here:<br /><br />1) SPEED. This is really where these razors shine. 10,000 - 14,000 RPM cuts FAST. If you've got a coarse beard like mine, a speedy razor allows you to make one or two slow, smooth passes to get all the hairs, keeping you from overworking the area and causing irritation.<br /><br />2) BATTERY LIFE. I think they power these razors with Plutonium. Two months ago I went two weeks in the field with my ten-year-old razor (and battery of similar age) without charging it and it still shaved with the same power on the very last day as it did when it was new.<br /><br />3) QUALITY. My razor has survived countless road trips, field exercises, and two year-long deployments to Iraq. Snap the plastic cover over the foils, drop it in its little pouch, and off you go. Other than regularly changing the foils, blades, and cleaning cartridges, I haven't had to replace a single part. No dinky plastic pieces sticking out waiting to get snapped off, no chintzy base or poor quality electrical connections or components... it is, quite simply, extremely well built. That is why, even though the cleaning/charging station died, I'm keeping the razor itself so that it can permanently live in my shaving kit.<br /><br />4) WATERPROOF. If your face can stand a wet shave (mine can't... it cuts too close, then I get bumps), this is a phenomenal razor. My wife has used mine on her legs sometimes when we are travelling and it leaves them silky smooth every time.<br /><br />5) IT'LL HACK THROUGH YOUR BEARD LIKE GRANT THROUGH RICHMOND. I've taken on whiskers at least 1/4 of an inch long (about a week's growth for me... I don't shave when I'm on leave if I can avoid it) without doing any sort of pre-trim with clippers. It takes a little longer, but it'll get through it. Try THAT with a rotary razor!<br /><br />6) COMPARATIVELY LOW COST VS. BLADES. You do the math for yourself. How much do you spend on blades per month? Multiply that by 120 (number of months I owned my last razor before buying this one). If it's less than the following, then the electric razor is a good deal for you. I spent $125 for the unit, I changed cleaning cartridges about every four months (a $15 three-pack would last a year), blades every six months ($30 a year?), and the foil every year ($25 or so?). Yearly upkeep was $70, or $700 for a decade plus $125 for the unit itself, is $825. Divided by 120 months, is a cost of less than seven bucks a month. I've also thrown a lot less stuff in the trash over the course of that ten years.<br /><br />7) WATER-BASED CLEANING SOLUTION. Other systems use an alcohol-based solution that, over time, will degrade the plastic and rubber components of a razor or charging base.<br /><br />8) EASE OF CLEANING. If you buy one with a cleaning/charging station, then DUH. Periodic (semi-annual?) cleaning of the cleaning station will help clear out any schmutz that builds up in the water tubes or elsewhere in the base. Don't rinse the whole doggone base under the faucet (see above under \\"reasons why I'm buying a new razor\\"). Even without a cleaning/charging station, you just pop off the foil cover and rinse it under the water. How much easier can it get?<br /><br />DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE ES-LA93K AND MY ORIGINAL PANASONIC LINEAR SHAVER - I haven't had it for long, but some things have come to light... some good, some not so much. See below.<br /><br />1) IT IS FASTER. Between the higher speed and the extra foil cutter (four heads vs. three), I can shave off a day's worth of stubble in less than three minutes if I'm really in a hurry. Not really because I can move the head faster, but because it definitely allows me to get a great shave in just one or sometimes two passes. Fewer passes and less pressure equals less irritation which equals fewer razor bumps.<br /><br />2) MORE COMPLIANT / FLEXIBLE PIVOT. It took me almost no time to get used to the new configuration, with the head sticking out at an angle from the handle... I like how there seems to be less spring tension on the moveable head, it really allows it to follow the contours of my face closely without requiring much pressure. It also pivots in two axes, vs. one from my old razor.<br /><br />3) VIBRATING HEAD. Okay, I'll admit that I thought it would be a marketing gimmick, but it is another great method for reducing the pressure required to get a nice close shave. Are you picking up on the theme here? Less pressure = less irritation = well, you get the picture.<br /><br />4) IT IS A LITTLE LOUDER. Some folks complained about the noise in their reviews, both for the razor and the charging station when it's in its cleaning cycle. I guess I'm just used to it. Still... loud compared to what? A chainsaw? No. A razor blade? Yep. Your wife's \\"personal massager?\\" That depends... what kind of batteries does it take? The point is, sure, it makes noise. Close the doggone bathroom door for a few minutes and shave your face.<br /><br />5) THE LED DISPLAY IS UNBELIEVABLY BRIGHT. Okay, no arguments here. Fortunately, I cannot see into my bathroom from my bed, because if I could, I would have a recurring dream every night that I am a plane, coming in for a landing, and there is a bright blue homing beacon flashing at me through the clouds every few seconds. Seriously... you could signal aircraft with that display.<br /><br />6) ONE QUALITY ISSUE (with the cleaning/charging station). Do an internet search for \\"flashing red status light Panasonic razor\\" and you'll come up with a smattering of posts about this. Considering how I have long touted the quality of this line of Panasonic products, I was a little disappointed to have this manufacturing defect affect my unit. Fortunately, it was an easily remedied problem. The error occurs because a microswitch inside the base of the unit gets moisture or water or who-knows-what in it and thinks that you don't have the cleaning cartridge inside the base when you actually do. Since few folks would make the mistake of running a cleaning cycle without the cartridge in there (properly seated), it's an easy feature to bypass. The switch wants to be \\"open\\" (i.e. when there is a fault, the switch closes the circuit path) so all you have to do is undo three screws on the base and snip one of the brown wires leading to the switch itself... now it will think that it's \\"open\\" all the time. Hasn't been a problem for me since, but it's a shame that I had to take this sort of remedial action as a consumer.<br /><br />7) THE FOILS ARE ARCHED SLIGHTLY AND THE HEAD IS BIGGER. I was worried that the bigger head would make the shaver more cumbersome and harder to get into the nooks and crannies of my face, and that the arched foils would reduce the contact patch and cause the shave to take longer. I was wrong on both counts... it is extremely maneuverable and has no trouble reaching everything quickly and without requiring several passes or excess pressure.<br /><br />MY SHAVING / FACE MAINTENANCE ROUTINE - For what it's worth, here's what works best for me. Your results may vary, but this is the best combination I've found for a close shave that does not irritate my skin and cause razor bumps:<br /><br />1) Shower first thing in the morning, right before the shave. UseApricot facial scrub (with or without the 2% salicylic acid... I prefer with) [[ASIN:B0000536Y7 St. Ives Blemish & Blackhead Control Apricot Scrub, 6 oz]] to wash your face, scrubbing gently to get a nice deep clean. Dry face thoroughly.<br /><br />2) Prep beard by applying Remington face-saver pre-shave powder stick. [[ASIN:B00065QS3M Pre-Shave Stick]] I tried Lectric Shave and other pre-shave treatments, but this talc-based powder allows the razor to glide very smoothly. That means less pressure, which means... yeah, you get it.<br /><br />3) Shave against the grain of your face, or across it if the stubble is short enough. This will help \\"feed\\" the hairs into the foil holes. The slotted trimmer in the middle of the two main cutting foils will do a good job batting cleanup if you shave in this manner. I work as rapidly as I can without missing hairs or pressing too hard, because if the razor runs for a long time (unless you are wet shaving) then it will heat up a bit. This doesn't necessarily make it uncomfortable, but it does seem to drag a bit more when it is warmer. I hit the hardest and most sensitive spots first, then I do my cheeks and sideburns last because they are the easiest and the most resilient, so if the razor has warmed up a bit, it won't have as much of a detrimental effect on my shave.<br /><br />4) Stop halfway through, pop off the foil cover, tap it out, and pop it back on to continue shaving. ESPECIALLY if you are using talc, you'll get stubble and talc residue building up inside the foil cover, so it's a good habit to get into in order to keep from overburdening the razor. Once you have the \\"battle drill\\" down, this takes all of about three seconds to do and get back to shaving.<br /><br />5) Check to make sure you didn't miss any stray hairs. Get really stubborn ones with the pop-up trimmer. Rinse your face with water to get any remaining talc or loose hairs off. Pop off the foil cover again and rinse both the razor and the foilcover under the water. Tap them dry, reassemble, and place in the cleaning/charging station. If you do not have a cleaning/charging station or you are travelling away from it, I recommend applying Remington \\"Shaver Saver\\" spray [[ASIN:B00006IV41 SP-4 Spray lubricant and cleaner Shaver Shaver - For all Shavers & Groomers]] to the reassembled unit and running it for 5-10 seconds before stowing it. If you do have a cleaning/charging station, I alternate... one day I will simply set it to \\"dry\\" and the next day I will select \\"clean / dry.\\" This helps my cleaning cartridges last longer.<br /><br />6) I have a prescription for a combination topical antibiotic and benzoyl peroxide (called Benzamycin) that has really helped keep razor bumps at bay (I rarely, if ever, break out anywhere other than a hair follicle site). Once my face is dry, I apply the product.<br /><br />7) After letting the Benzamycin dry for a few minutes, I apply Gillette conditioning after shave gel [[ASIN:B003W3P1TC 2 BOTTLES GILLETTE AFTER SHAVE SENSITIVE SKIN GEL 2.5 OZ.]]. It is not alcohol based so it doesn't sting, and it helps moisturize and protect my face (the Benzamycin dries it out somewhat). My wife also LOVES the way it smells!<br /><br />8) Throughout the day, I do my best to keep from touching my face. Hard to do, but it reduces the chance that I'll introduce bacteria into a tiny break in my skin that has been irritated by the shaving process.<br /><br />9) In the evening when I get home, I use a face wash (like Neutrogena) [[ASIN:B001EUQBRQ Neutrogena Oil-Free Acne Wash Facial Cleanser, Pink Grapefruit, 6 Ounce]] that has some salicylic acid in it to clean the day off of me. Then, at night right before bed, I put on another application of Benzamycin and follow it up with the after shave to re-moisturize (and because I'm about to climb in bed with a beautiful woman who likes the way it smells). If your face is susceptible to over-drying, you might want to be careful about combining salicylic acid and benzoyl peroxide treatments... my face doesn't seem to mind, but your mileage may vary.<br /><br />10) When razor bumps do pop up, I pull the hairs out with a tweezer. A dermatologist would probably advise against this, but it seems to let the accompanying pimple heal much quicker with the hair not in there continuing to irritate things. The biggest challenge for me is to not try and yank out a hair before it's long enough to grab. Otherwise, if you get just a piece of it, it'll break off as you tug on it and wind up leaving a jagged-edged hair that is back below your skin. Recipe for a few more days of disaster right there... better to just leave it alone for one more day and get it when it's longer. Be especially careful not to touch the site where you've removed an ingrown hair... you KNOW the skin is compromised there and you don't want to introduce anything that might cause an infection.<br /><br />11) On the weekends, or whenever I can, I give my face a break. It seems to allow it to heal and get ready for the next week's battle. Some might postulate that it's better to just shave every single day and let your face get used to it... doesn't seem to work that way for me. If I do wind up having a breakout, continuing to try and shave over an already irritated area just makes it ten times worse. It's like the zits/bumps \\"cross pollinate.\\" Awesome. When that happens, the weekend just can't get here fast enough for me!<br /><br />MAINTENANCE SCHEDULE - Read the manual to see what they recommend. Now that this razor in particular will tell me when the cleaning cartridge needs to be changed, I will probably just do that upon demand. Before I was changing the cartridge [[ASIN:B000BF1396 Panasonic WES035P Vortex HydraClean Shaving System Solution Cartridges for Men's Shaver (ES8109S, ES8228S, ES8249S, ES-LA93-K, ES-LV81-K) (Pack of 3)]] (and the water in the tank) about every three to four months. I changed the shaving blades everysix months, and the foil every year [[ASIN:B002N5MHL0 Panasonic WES9025PC Replacement Foil and Blades]]. This kept my unit cutting like new throughout the entire time I owned it, and I will likely keep up a similar schedule with the new razor.<br /><br />Well, hopefully you'll find this review helpful. I know that these razors can be quite an investment, and they aren't for everyone. If you're looking for some guidance or reassurance before taking the leap, maybe you've found it here. No promises, but I can say with absolute certainty that they've been a godsend for me. If you decide to give one a try, I hope you wind up being as satisfied as I have been.<br /><br />Best of luck!
  332. It provides a very close and comfortable shave. The base is very useful, though the battery life seems quite good.
  333. I'm a long-time Panasonic user. The shavers are really great for tough beards like mine, and they work in the shower, which is fantastic. I remember reading in a Braun manual once about how a dry shave is always better than a wet shave, and maybe that's true for them German beards, but for my beard it most definitely is not (and I've experimented with both).<br /><br />After three months of daily shaving, I'd say this is by far the best Panasonic (and closest shaver) I've ever used. It gets all the tough spots and does an all-around fantastic job. I did deduct a star for a few flaws.<br /><br />The first flaw is that the manual says, \\"it is recommended that you replace the outer foil at least once a year, and the inner blade once at least every two years, to maintain your shaver's cutting performance.\\" Ridiculous---unless your beard is made of peach fuzz, there's no way the razor's blades are going to last the full 24 months. In my 6 years of using Panasonic razors, I've found that after 9 months, the performance is noticeably down from when I first bought it, and that I need to replace both foil and blades. Yes, I have a tough beard.<br /><br />The second flaw is that the shaver's performance depends heavily on how much it's charged. Between 70-100% charge it does its best job; between 40-70% it does a good job, but takes longer to get to the same result as 70-100%; and below 40% charge, it's basically as good as a Norelco (which is, for my type of beard, not very good). This charge-dependent quality is true not just of this shaver but of all the other Panasonic models I've tried.<br /><br />The third flaw is the quality of the slider that takes you from flexible grip, to firm grip, to trimmer activation. The slider is extremely easy to trigger accidentally (I've frequently switched from fixed to flexible without intending to do so). Minor gripe here.<br /><br />The final flaw is with the whole vortex cleaning system. This system suggests you use the same pool of soapy water 30 days in a row (or else spend $$$ on vortex refill pods unnecessarily). I'm not sure it's such a hygenic idea to keep on re-using that water for so long, which is why before using vortex, I make sure my razor is as squeaky clean as possible (using the ultrasound quick clean mode). I would have preferred an alcohol, rather than water-based cleaning system. However, don't try putting alcohol inside a vortex system thinking you're going to be so smart. I did that on an older unit, and it broke within a few weeks. That having been said, Vortex does get the job done---no mildewy smell ever on this razor (and without some type of cleaning system, be it vortex or something else, you WILL get the mildew, guaranteed, even if you rinse the razor religiously).
  334. I was satisfied with my Braun Pulsonic 9595 until the trimmer broke so I started the search for a new shaver. I have a thick beard so I wanted something that would really mow the lawn. With this new Panasonic I have never had a closer shave, maybe not even with a blade. Going from the Braun's 10,000 cycles per minute to the Panasonic's 14,000 vibes is like night and day. So for me, this was the main selling point. That being said, there are some areas where the Braun scores. The shaver head of the Braun is smaller so it is easier to get in those tight corners like under the nose. The Panny head feels bulky. The Braun hair trimmer is rounded where as the Panny is flat with sharp corners so shaving the back of the neck is not as comfortable with the Panny if you don't hold it exactly flush with the skin. The Braun's cleaning solution is alcohol based so it cleans and dries much faster. The Panny takes about 80 minutes (I think) to dry. On the other hand, the Panasonic being water based should be more economical over the cost of the Braun's Clean & Renew cartridges. I also like the fact that after I'm done with the Panny I can just rinse it out under the faucet with some hand soap so I won't have to use its self contained cleaning system on a daily basis. Over time the Braun's alcohol based solution started to eat away and peel the paint on the shaver. The Braun also would leave the whisker clippings all over the sink area where as with the Panasonic the clippings stay under the screen until you pop the screen off to rinse. One small negative, the Panny has this bright flashing blue charge indicator that is really annoying at night. It looks like a strobe light from a bad '70's disco movie reflecting off of the bathroom wall. The simple solution is to unplug the unit at night or turn the shaver around in its cradle after it's charged, so not a big deal. If Braun ever came out with a 14,000 vibe unit this would be a much tougher decision. But for now, Ihave to give the edge to Panasonic.
  335. Have not loved a razor this much since Braun made quality electric razors in the 90's. LEss razor burn, really good craftsmanship (made in Japan!), and a nice package, all-around. Highly recommend.
  336. I expected a closer shave especially with this high price. I'm going to get new blades for my Braun, it gives you a better shave with less time and effort.
  337. This is the BEST electric shaver I've ever owned, without a doubt, and that includes a couple of Brauns I've had. Each shave is super close, and granted, I don't have a heavy beard, but this shaver always leaves my faces feeling baby soft. Equally as close as a razer, but without the nicks, cuts, and blood stained towels. I have the cleaning unit and even though I've had the shaver for over a month, I haven't seen an indicator yet that I need to change the cleaning cartridge and water in the resovoir (instructions say if you clean and dry the shaver daily, it will last for 30 days before requiring a change). If I had to cite any less than perfect aspects of this shaver, it would be that the cleaning system can be quite loud. Also, and maybe this is nitpicking, but the edger/side burn trimmer would have been better located on the same side of the cutting blocks (you have to flip the shaver around and flip up the trimmer). Other than that, this is one outstanding piece of work! Let's hope it lasts for a few years.
  338. Did what l expected, very close shave. As long as it holds out I would recommend this product. Little pricey but worth it.
  339. Fast, smooth operation. Didn't expect such a close shave, I've use Norelco and Braun before and this is by far the best shave I've gotten from an electric shaver.   358. I got this for a gift for my husband and he is delighted with his new Panasonic shaver.
  359. I have sensitive skin, and would often get irritation and burning from shaving, so all these wet shavers that I discovered over a decade ago were real (skin) life savers.<br /><br />I've started with the Phillips wet shave (the ones that had a built-in dispenser on the back)...6700 or something, but switched away from them when they adopted the 'open' system that had all the shavings fall out all over the place, once my 6700 broke.<br /><br />At that point, I decided to give Panasonic a try, because it had good reviews. I went with the 8109S (dual-blade predecessor to this one, also foil, wet shaving and cleaning base). It was great: much less irritation than the Phillips I had before, and it would clean itself. I went through two of these (one because the battery died and the price difference to getting a replacement shaver rather than a battery was negligible, the second when my cleaning base died, and I decided to see if this shaver is better).<br /><br />I did not expect the ES-LA93-K (or its sliver brother) to be better, and thought the extra blades are a gimmic, but whatever it is about this shaver, it actually IS better.<br />The shaves take me 4 minutes (took 7 minutes with the 8109s), which could account for the slightly lower irritation (it was low to beginwith the the Panasonic units anyways).<br />My chin is definitely less irritated thanks to this shaver really handling it well, whereas with the 8109S, I had to go over it many times to get it cleared (with this one, just once or twice and the chin is cleared).<br /><br />Other observations, for those who may care:<br />-it's made in Japan<br />-it's louder, but the pitch of the buzzing is lower and quite soothing<br />-battery is Li-Ion, similar to cellphones, where it suffers a lot less 'battery memory' issues. This is a big plus for me, as I would always worry with the 8109S that if I charge it every day, it would deteriorate battery life fast, so I would end up doing 'clean, dry', but not chargeuntil the battery was down to 30%. I was a bit worried when I saw that this shaver doesn't have that choice (you can only pick clean or dry, but charge is always picked for you as soon as you dock it), until I saw that it's an Li-Ion battery.<br />-cartridges are the same as the 8109S, so I didn't have to throw out the spares I had left over<br />-cleaning is easy. either dock it and let it clean (the manual gives you 30 days of usage once you start a new cartridge, so no sense in skimping out). I also use liquid soap (as per the manual) to clean every other time, and the soap I picked is an anti-bacterial, as my sensitive skin means I sometimes get rashes from shaving too (so far, not with this shaver, which I had for a month)<br />-shaver is heavier than the 8109S, especially at the top, but not too heavy to be comfortable.<br />-'shaking out the water' needs to be done with care on this one-put a finger on the head, and don't shake too hard, as the head is mobile, and heavy (in the 8109s, it was just sideways mobile, and stayed put because it was light).<br />-many users complain about the light, and yes, it is super-bright, and the bedroom looks like an airport at night if the bathroom door is open. Yes, Panasonic: it's nice that the screen is bright, but did it really have to flash every two seconds indefinitely once fully-charged? I just put a tissue or two over the unit and that's enough. I suggest doing the same to all those whom it bothers<br />-Shaver works very well with the Nivea Foam that I use (I found this to be the best for sensitive skin, both the white and blue bottles). Needs to be rinsed-out mid way, as the foam builds up too much, but other than that, it's great.<br /><br />Bottom line: super-recommended for those who still use the Phillips or other rotating shavers, and for those considering switching from the 2-blade units that Panasonic sells.
  360. I have had two older models both with the linear motor. I have the es-la63 but the '93 is the same shaver plus the Vortex stand. Great product.<br /><br />The shaver is much more usable without the \\"foil frame\\" where the black foil \\"carrier\\" is exposed. This way the shaver is much easier to get closer under the nose and easier to see what you are doing.<br /><br />But what to do about securing the cap? I made an elastic \\"chin strap\\" to hold the cap on. Using one of those hair bands with a hole (3/16 drill bit BY HAND) where each release tab \\"bulge\\" is. The \\"chin\\" being that area under the pivot. Just knot the band on the outside of the cover just like you would for a hat strap.<br /><br />Update:<br /> For the longer and stubborn neck hairs use the trimmer but drag it up your neck (upside down) with the foil facing down. This shaver now is a Five Star!
  361. I have used this shaver for 1 year now.<br /><br />The razor does a great job of shaving - close and comfortable. The head feels a little large, but you adjust to it pretty quickly. The trimmer while appearing small compared to the head is actually the same size as other Panasonic trimmers. It is just a little more awkward to use because of the large head. You do get used to it but I actually do not use the trimmer that much - I have another trimmer that is easier to use.<br /><br />The razor is a bit heavier than most but it is not overly heavy or uncomfortable to hold/use. It fits the hand well and it does not feel heavy no matter how long shaving takes.<br /><br />Cleaning - The module works well, but I prefer to just clean the shaver myself (the directions for the shaver say use liquid soap and water) and just use the drying function of the cleaning unit. Not sure if this helps the shaver last any longer, but I do like the idea of drying the shaver and not letting water sit on the unit.<br /><br />The display for the battery is easy to see - although the battery life does not display when shaving. This is only an issue if the battery is low when you began shaving and you want to know how much time before the shaver dies as your shaving. You have to turn the unit off to see the battery display. The good news is that the unit charges very quickly. It will charge enough to get you through a shave in about 15 minutes.<br /><br />Head Shaving: The other great thing about this unit is that I use it to also shave my head. It works great and I get a close shave over the entire head. Even if I miss a day of shaving my head and the hair gets a little longer, the shaver does a great job with no hair pulling or discomfort.<br /><br />I have been shaving my entire head and face with this unit for just over a year now and I have had no issues at all. While I am still using the original blades/foils and am still getting a close shave, I think it is just about time to replace them.<br /><br />Bottom line is that this is a great unit. I highly recommend it.
  362. No matter how much I cleaned the unit I kept getting the red light error message. Tossed razor in garbage and I would never reorder. Junk. OK shave but Braun better.
  363. The absolute BEST shaver I have used -- much better than my previous Braun. It gets very close. Not as close as when I use a double sided safety razor, but about as close as a disposable. I can get a good shave in about three minutes, and have no irritation (helped by ritually using Burts Bees Aftershave lotion immediately after shaving). The cleaning cycle works great, and the mixture last a long time before needing to be replaced. Also, it has no smell -- unlike Braun's. Braun's cleaner is more of an alcohol based mixture. Panasonic's cleaning cartridges are more of a filter element saturated in a soap. It has a tank that you fill with water, which dissolves the soap the first time it is used, and this is stored in the tank and repeatedly cycled through the filter on the cleaning cycle.<br /><br />Anyway -- great shaver and definitely worth the money considering the time I same each week by using it. I'm a daily shaver, and shaving with a razor used to take me seven minutes, so I'm saving 28 minutes a week with this shaver!
  364. 1) I have had this unit about 5 years now. I've had to replace the foil/blade quite a few times now, as one would expect. I know when it's time to replace when I feel my whiskers being tugged, generally every 6 months of daily use. I have tough whiskers (I could scour pots with my beard if I wanted to lol!) The battery, motor seem to be less efficient now than when the unit was new, so it's not immortal.<br /><br />Now for the good. Best shave ever by any method I've tried, and I've owned Norelcos, Brauns, and Remingtons a-plenty. My skin doesn't tolerate being blade shaved, I could be the poster boy for razor burn! I get the best results using it dry, promoting a baby-butt like texture to my face : )<br /><br />If you own this razor you probably already know but in case you don't, you can extend the life of the cleaning cartridges immeasurably by rinsing the blades and foil assembly under the faucet before doing a cleaning/charge cycle. I'll get another one of these if they're still available when mine finally gives up the ghost.

  367. A few thoughts on this great product:<br /><br />1. I'm writing this review over two years after I purchased it and after use multiple times each week it STILL feels like it's brand new. I've lugged it around on trips a handful of times and it's proven to be very durable and has lived up to it's high price.<br /><br />2. I use it as a dry shave and even so, it actually almost feels GOOD while I'm shaving with this. Yeah, I said it. That's how comfortable it is the first use after I clean it. It gives me as close of a shave as I can possibly expect from an electric shaver. I never get any irritation on my face. Once and awhile I'll get a little on my neck, but it's not much and it's gone quickly even without using any kind of lotion on it.<br /><br />3. The trimmer cuts through thick hair like you can't imagine. If I have let my beard grow out longer than usual to where it's pretty thick, I usually just take it out with the trimmer then finish off with the normal shaver head.<br /><br />4. I like the extras. The cleaning system works great and I haven't had any problems with it. In fact, last week I dropped it on my stone tile floor from four feet while I was changing the cleaning cartridge and after having a minor freak out I plugged it in and it worked perfectly and had no physical damage. That's actually what reminded me to write this review. The carrying case is very nice and has worked well when I'm on the road.<br /><br />Note on the cleaning cartridges: Panasonic recommends you change them every month, but I usually get by on two, even when I use the system a lot, which I don't. I usually simply rinse it under the faucet and it does fine. The system only comes with one cartridge, so you'll need more pretty soon. When that time comes, get these: [[ASIN:B000BF1396 Panasonic WES035P Vortex HydraClean Shaving System Solution Cartridges for Men's Shaver (ES8109S, ES8228S, ES8249S, ES-LA93-K, ES-LV81-K) Count - 3]]. It's a three pack that will last you over six months.<br /><br />If you're like me, you hate making big purchases. When I made this purchase, I put it off forever. But it was completely worth it. It has done an amazing job over the past two years and I fully expect it to last me a long time into the future.
  368. This is by far the best electric razor I've ever owned.<br /><br />Never did I believe that an electric razor could shave your face baby-bottom smooth, but this thing can.   375.   376. To start off with I have sensitive skin. For the longest time I used the most expensive Gilette Blade Razors available (at the time was Mach 5). In Nov 2009 after many nicks and cuts I decided to give electric shaving another try. See I tried using an electric razor in 2002. At that time I purchased the best that Norelco had to offer. Though that razor work well on my cheeks, it did a terrible job on my neck and I gave up electric shaving after 3-months. So as I mention, in Nov 2009 I started looking at electric razors again. I spent many hours researching and reading reviews and it came down between the best that Panasonic had to offer and the best that Braun had to offer. Honestly it was a toss up and I chose Panasonic because the ESLA93 was a brand new release model that had only been out a couple of months. The Braun model had not been updated for a couple of years. Yeah I know that sounds silly but that's how I chose the Panasonic. Well over 8-months later I can honestly say that I made a good choice. This Razor works like a charm and the self cleaning feature is awesome but a bit noisy. As recommended I change my cleaning filter monthly and this has kept my razor looking, smelling, and working like it is brand new. The shave is as close as a blade and does not cut me. The only issue that I had is that my skin took a little bit longer than the suggested 30-days to adjust to electric shaving. It wasn't until about the 7th week that I noticed that my skin was fully adjusted. Though this shaver is a little pricey, I would recommend it to anyone and put my stamp of approval on it.

  380. **I should start out by first prefacing that, before purchasing this, I have been using a Gillette Fusion straight razor for the past 4 years and hadn't used an electric shaver since before that time (I had an old Norelco one).<br /><br />So, after being a straight razor user for 4 years, I decided to purchase this electric shaver for a few reasons: (1) Convenience--I could shave anywhere, in the shower, in the bathroom, the car, etc., (2) It was supposed to be really easy to clean (to get a good shave every time), (3) my wife was tired of me &#34;forgetting to shave&#34; in those crucial moments that we are late and need to leave the house right away, (4) it got great reviews, (5) the price was right.<br /><br />The Panasonic ES-LA93-K doesn't disappoint. I put a lot of research into which shaver to get and it all seems to come down to personal preferences at the end of the day. The one shining point for me with this was that the general consensus on performance and design was extremely positive from most people that had purchased this Panasonic.<br /><br />From a non-performance, strictly visual/design standpoint, the shaver is gorgeous, both in and out of the included charger/cleaning base. It is also lightweight and the ergonomics when holding it and using it are really wonderful. You can tell that a lot of effort went into the design of it to get it to feel right in your hand and on your face. My wife also likes the way it looks on the bathroom countertop (which gives me brownie points with her!).<br /><br />The fit and finish of the base and cleaning system are great too. The shaver slides into the base very easily and rests in it nicely. There is a flashing blue LED that is constantly on when it is in the base that some reviewers have said is bright and annoying. I could give them that for sure. If you are plugging it in and setting it up within eyesight of your bed at night, I could see how that could be an issue. Mine is in my bathroom (away from my bedroom's line-of-sight) and so it isn't an issue for me at all.<br /><br />As far as performance goes--I am, seriously, impressed beyond all expectations. The shaver delivers a very close shave dry with absolutely no irritation of my skin (and I have VERY sensitive skin when shaving normally). That's a first for me! It generally takes about 2-3 minutes to get a really solid shave with this and it never feels uncomfortable or awkward to use--it just fits in your hand well.<br /><br />Where the shaver really shines is when it is used &#34;wet&#34; or with a shaving gel (make sure you use on recommended for electric shavers--regular creams and gels will clog up in the cutting heads). It is baby smooth and gets even closer than using it &#34;dry&#34;--again, with zero irritation.<br /><br />**A side note and recommendation that I have to get the most out of a shave with it, is something that I stumbled upon in some other reviews here (and I am so glad I did!) in regards to shaving cream/lubricant. There were a few reviews that recommended the Billy Jealousy Hydroplane cream with it (also available at Amazon). I wasn't even aware of the brand before that and didn't even know what it was. It is a specially formulated cream/lotion that is very light and extremely slick (for the blades). I can't tell you how awesome the combo of both the shaving lotion and this shaver are--it literally gets as close a shave as I was getting with a straight razor, with no irritation, my skin is actually more moisturized after, and it doesn't clog up the blades in the shaver either. The bottle is a bit pricey at $20 or so, but it will probably last about 6 months, and I couldn't, at this point, see me shaving without it (even with a straight razor--it's that good!).<br /><br />The cleaning system works well (you need to add some filtered water to the base and &#34;plug-in&#34; the cleaning fluid to it). I have not had any issues so far, and when I use it, the next shave feels just as new and as good as the first. I like that. If you don't use the cleaning base (maybe you're in the shower, etc.), it opens up and allows you to rinse it very easily too.<br /><br />Ultimately, I would say that if you are in the market for either a first jump into an electric shaver, or are looking to replace on that you currently have, I don't see a way that you could be disappointed with this. It looks great, feels solid and comfortable, gives a fantastic shave with no irritation to speak of and just performs the way you would hope a shaver would. Panasonic did an excellent job with this and I can't recommend it enough.
  381. a great gift for my father, and he likes it very much, and he said it is more comfortable and convenient to use this one shaver.
  382. Husband loved it! He does not use razor blades anymore. Good quality; have had it over a year now
  383. The ES-LA93K is a clear improvement over my prior Panasonic shaver. It is the fastest to use of any I've tried (still requires several passes but fewer than any other I've used and over the years I've used all major brands). The shave is noticably closer truly approaching razor closeness. I have yet to get any razer burn or rash. It is quieter. I like the recharging station better. And the shaver retains the same great features of prior Panasonic razors -- the main one being you can rinse it after every use under the tap thereby preserving the blades basically indefinetely. I rinse it each time I use it. If you are so motivated you can even use soap on it though I don't find that to be necessary. I put it in for a clean cycle in the recharging unit when it needs to be recharged. This regimine has kept my last Panasonic working flawlessly for 5 years. Because the razor is basically mostly clean when I put it into the unit, replacement of the cleaning cartridge is reduced to just a few times a year. Overall it is hard to find fault with this razor. For those who prefer a foil type shaver I highly recommend it.

  385. This is my fourth Panasonic razor, and it is also the most expensive. It gives an exceptionally close yet comfortable shave. It is also quieter than previous models. However, mine is dead after about 9 months of use, and that is far from acceptable for a luxury product in this price range. My work requires a fair amount of business travel, so my shaver gets packed frequently, but has never been dropped or misused. I have a very average beard, and shave in the shower with shaving cream, therefore, there is no credible reason why my shaver should have failed so soon.<br /><br />First, the LCD display on all Panasonic razors tend to be too fragile and are the first things to die; in mine, this happened after only 5 months of use. Previous Panasonic razors have had the display fade and fail after about 12 to 18 months of use. Panasonic should find a new supplier for their LCD displays.<br /><br />After 9 months of use, the Panasonic just stopped working. I cannot tell what is going on, since the display, which should tell the status of the shaver, stopped working months earlier. I will send it in for repair, but I suspect that the repair will cost as much as a new shaver, which is a shame. I really wanted this shaver to last, since I liked the close and comfortable shave, but it just is not built robustly enough to stand up to even gentle use. I am therefore unable to recommend this model. I will likely try a Braun next, in the hope that it is better made and will therefore hold up longer.

It is recommended to replace the foil & shaved blades but I have not done that & I still have a great shave (which is every other day). I'm thinking I should replace those parts soon, but why bother when everything still feels brand new. Buy this, of all my shaving products I have had this the longest.
  389. About as good as an electric razor could be. I thought, for the price, it would be as good as a cartridge shaver. Not quite!
  390. This is my second Panasonic Razor and I have to say it's the best. I stopped using my older one years ago and just got fed up with buying replacement blades on my Gillette Fusion. I just tried the Vortex last night and it gave me the cleanest shave from an electric razor I've ever had. With my older Vortex I would have to make multiple passes on my neck but this one it only took two passes. I also used a shave soap to help with any razor burn. It's been two years since my last electric shave but I have to say I was impressed with how good and comfortable the shave was.<br /><br /> I will make updates as the weeks go by.
  391. This shaver is awesome. Never had a machine shave so close. I've had 2 Norelco's. The first was great but it gave up. The second couldn't find a hair to cut longer than 1/8\\". I'm retired and the beard is occasionally allowed to grow. My beard's coarseness on a 1-10 scale is about a 6. With that in mind I'm finished shaving in 30 to 40 seconds.
  392. I bought the shaver for my son. He did not like it at all. I returned it.
  393. For Christmas I ordered my husband the Panasonic Shaver....it was the priciest one, but well worth it for him! He says it's the closest, smoothest shave he's ever had with an electric shaver.....and it's worth every penny!!
  394. i've owned a number of razers in my life but this one beats them all . it shaves as good as a razer. i highly reccomend this one.
  395. Best razor i ever had. You can feel your skin.
  396. I have used electric razors for 20+ years. I started with Norelco (Philips) and then changed to Braun. After 4 Brauns (each lasted 3 years or so), I just bought this Panasonic and it is the best razor for me to date. I always bought top end Norelcos and Brauns so the comparison is apples to apples. So far, so good!
  397. u've had this shaver for over a month now and I love it! I havent had one in a long time and the last one i used was a low priced one about 15 years ago. I am glad I had the money to get a good one when I decided to try one again. This shaver is great. It does take about 4 or 5 minutes to get a nice smooth shave, but i could never get this close with a regular razor before. I like the cleaning base as well, keeps the razor performing properly when used right. I shave with shaving cream and water with no problem. Great buy and would do it again easily!
  398. I have been a blade user for almost 50 years and suffered with nicks, cuts and raw red irritations on my neck. About 6 years ago I tried a Braun electric & 3 years ago I tried the Norelco Arctic, but still got red irritations on my neck without the close shave I experienced with a blade. Both razors were sent back during the trial period. I felt it was time to try another electric and stumbled onto the Panasonic razor. From the first day, I experienced a close shave with NO irritation anywhere. It is faster than a blade, not the 3 minutes that the instruction booklet says but maybe 7 minutes. After all when you measure the time of wetting your face, putting on shaving cream and then rinsing off the cream, it takes a while especially if you get nicked. Buy this shaver and never look back. I am sold. You will be too.
  399. I never imagined that an electric shaver could shave as close as a blade, but this electric shaver does. Great product Panasonic.
  400. I've been using this for several months now and decided to write a review. The Good: I no longer have to prime my face with hot water from a shower or otherwise like when using a blade. I can just start right away on my dry face. Does a decent job and I get a pretty close shave....at least above the neck/jaw line. Charge lasts a long time and is simple to clean with just soap and hot water. I never use the cleaning base anymore. The Bad: Does a terrible job on the neck and lower jaw. I have to go over and over the same spots at different angles and it still misses a lot. A little rough on the face and especially the neck. Leaves some razor burn marks/bumps. Overall it's a good product. It will not nearly come as close as a shave with a razor but the fact that you can just pick this up and shave without priming your face without water is a huge plus. I still use the razor if I'm going out and need to be extremely clean shaven. I haven't tried any of the other latest model/brand cordless shavers but would recommend this product. The base is cool for charging but it's absolutely (in my opinion) not needed for cleaning. It's just a waste of time and money buying the cartridges etc. Most would probably be happier just buying this unit without the base. If you want the cool look of the base for charging then get this one.
  401. Ok so I have only shaved a couple of times so far (and never with an electric razor), but all I can say is WOW! I was completely skeptical about electrics. I thought they would not give a good shave and definitely wouldn't leave me feeling that crisp clean and new feeling after a shave with a brand new mach3. Boy was I wrong. Not only was my shave close and super fast, but it didnt irritate at all. Super product! A little pricey to those of us who think that $20 is crazy for razors, but worth every penny.
  402. I have been shaving with an electric foil razor since around the late 80's. I have always had Braun electric razors until this Panasonic. During all of those years I'd say that actual shaving quality has improved little with battery life seeing the most improvement. Also during that time companies have figured out how to further monetize electric shavers through such things as cleaning systems. Be it for Braun, Panasonic, etc., it is of dubious value but some make it more affordable than others.<br /><br />After having Braun for so long I made the switch due to my neck. As my previous 8-year old Braun 7 Series' battery started to die, I began looking at alternatives that I thought would have a reasonable chance of finally being a \\"complete\\" razor for me. By complete I mean a razor I could use without having to do some small clean-up with a manual safety razor as I have always had to do for my neck. I felt I had given Braun ample opportunity over the years, but while they have always been top notch in reliability and offered a great shave on my face, they have failed continuously to shave my neck to a reasonable degree. Thus this Panasonic enters the picture.<br /><br />I am not a big fan of cleaning systems which as mentioned before are over-priced and offer dubious value. I was actually looking at the non self-cleaning version of this razor, when I found I could get this version for $150 here at Amazon. For less than $20 difference I felt it was a good enough deal especially as it would serve to hold the razor and the cleaning solution itself is vastly cheaper than Braun's (although a bit more cumbersome). Upon receiving this unit I charged it complete in it's base overnight before setting out trying it for the first time.<br /><br />I will say that I am glad I waited a week before writing this review because my first reactions were not very positive. However, after spending more time with the razor I began finding better ways to wield it around my face. My face is well adjusted to foils after all of these years, but I found the angle you use this at to be very important (more so than my old Braun). Therefore my personal star meter went from an initial two to the current four. This Panasonic shaved my entire face closer than my old Braun and, most importantly, it does finally allow me to shave my neck to a degree that I don't feel I need to clean up with a manual razor. Clearly a big win. While it is not perfect and not as close as a blade (at least not on the neck) it is close enough that my manual razor is now in the trash.<br /><br />Based on the timer function, I find it takes me between 6-8 minutes to shave complete. Longer than my old Braun, but to be fair, it shaves the neck and overall provides a closer shave. So, I find this to be a good trade-off. However, the Panasonic foils do get quite warm (I am not pressing hard either) while the Braun never did. For this reason I'd recommend shaving the upper lip area earlier in the process if you don't do so already. I typically did that area last, but found it a little uncomfortable due to the heat. The neck does take work at multiple angels and frankly there is no part of the face that won't require multiple passes. Despite the size of the head, I certainly don't think it is more efficient. I also don't think it glides over the face as easily as did the Braun. I should mention at this point that I shave dry and will continue to do so. If I have to buy shaving cream, etc., I have lost what I see is the major advantage of an electric. That said and you do have the option with the Panasonic while you do not with the Braun. The best part of this option for me is that I can at least clean it under the water quickly versus the Braun where I had to use a brush.<br /><br />I like the trimmer on this Panasonic more than on my old Braun as I find it to be more precise with my sideburns. It is a smaller trimmer, but I find it to be a bit more effective.There is a button on the back of the head that allows for free floating head (used for most of the face/neck), locked head (upper lip), and the pop up trimmer. Very straight forward. Just one on/off button in front and a superfluous LCD display which shows shave time, battery life, and other status. I really don't think an LCD is required as it is just another thing to go wrong. External led displays would have been sufficient for the statuses you need. Additionally, if left charging, the LCD will blink a very bright blue color continuously to let you know it is finished. Extremely obnoxious. Why they think that this info is so critical as to require a neon flashing sign is beyond me. An exit sign in a burning building is okay. Saying that the charge is done...not so much. I actually place my razor at an angle in the base so that it doesn't charge each day and I don't have to come in the middle of the night just to be blinded by the thing.<br /><br />The cleaning process is more involved than the Braun which just requires the cartridge. The Panasonic also requires filling a canister at back with water. However, given the much lower cost of cleaning solution versus the Braun, and I'd say this is a fair trade. The cartridge supposedly lasts as long as the Braun's which is daily for 30-days. Like the Braun I will use it weekly. The cleaning cycle/drying is extremely long at something over 90 minutes. I cannot fathom how such a small device would require this kind of time. That said and you don't need to stand there and watch it. I also don't find the noise it makes to be any greater than the Braun's system although again it does last substantially longer. This unit also comes with a carrying case, however, the case is not big enough to house the plug (unlike Braun's). I also understand that, unlike Braun's unit, you cannot use this razor while plugged in. I haven't tried this, but frankly it was not a feature I ever needed to use with Braun. I havenot tested the accuracy of the battery life indicator against reality as I charge it once a week. The LCD would indicate that it is the best I can get, but again have not confirmed. I don't see this is a big problem.<br /><br />Ergonomics and build quality seem okay, but not up to Braun standards. What this may mean for longevity is obviously something I will eventually find out. I would be very surprised if it lasted as long as my Braun's have.<br /><br />It is impossible for me to say whether this performs better than a new Braun would have. What I can say is that it was much cheaper for me and it does the job. I think I paid a fair price at $150, but would not agree that this is a $200+ shaver. Certainly the cleaning system isn't Worth $70+ over their non self-cleaning version.<br /><br />Pros:<br /><br />- Shaves very close and does an acceptable job on the neck<br />- Good trimmer for sideburns<br />- Option for wet and dry<br />- Much cheaper cleaning solution vs. Braun<br />- Option to self-clean with soap and water for \\"free\\"<br />- Quick charge if you run out of juice<br />- At $150 was a fair deal<br /><br />Cons:<br /><br />- Foil gets quite warm<br />- Does require work to get that close shave<br />- Obnoxious flashing blue display<br />- Extremely long clean/dry cycle<br />- Travel case does not fit plug<br />- Cleaning solution doesn't smell that great<br />- Cannot shave while plugged into an outlet<br />- Too expensive at its current regular $200+ price point<br /><br />Update: I have since found that this razor does not last me a full week on a single charge. It lasts me about 6-days which equates to roughly 40-minutes of shave time. The unit will kick off immediately upon reaching zero although since you can turn it on again for a bit, means that the battery isn't really dead. There is only a brief second or two decrease in shave power to alert you to the shutdown. I can confirm that the shaver will not work while plugged in which is unfortunate. That said and if you plug in the razor for a few minutes to charge, you should be able to get through a shave afterwords. In other words it does do a reasonable quick charge to make up for the lack of use while plugged in.<br /><br />Update 2: I thought I would update this review as it has been nearly 1.5 year since my purchase. I continue to use the blade and foil that came with the unit and I have not noticed any degradation in performance. Although I was a long time electric foil razor user, I did see my shave times drop after further use of this product to somewhere between 4:45 and 5:10 minutes per daily shave on average. I would recommend prior to putting the shaver through the clean cycle that you rinse it well. This won't take more than a few seconds and it will prevent the cleaning unit from clogging with tiny hairs. I also tend to put it through its charge/clean cycle whenever the shaver gets to 20% or less after a shave. I have found when using it under 20% that it can slow at a certain point so 20% is a good marker to make sure the last shave is a good one. I still have no troubles in recommending this product as laid out in the review above.<br /><br />Update 3: It has now been 2-years and unfortunately this thing no longer works. There is vibration in the head but the blades no longer move. Battery is fine and blades/foil were replaced a few months back. Extremely disappointed in the quality as I certainly expected this thing to last more than 2-years. Back to Braun for me.
  403. Needed to start shaving again. My beard was 12 years old and my circumstances have changed. So rather than manual ( Shaving cream, blades, blade holders ) I decided to try electric. Read the reviews. Decided to try this one. I used the side burn trimmer to thin the forest ( fine, not dense hair ), after clearing cutting, a day was given over for recovery ( yikes, who is that ) before going after the stumps in the desert. I have found that keeping the unit clean ( I dry shave ) by using compressed air after each use to remove the fine cellular & hair stubble from the mechanism ( pull the cover/screen ) appears to keep the machine working. I bought the whole kit with extra parts, I have used the cleaning ( wet system ) once or twice, it seems to do an OK job, my cleaning with air probably aids the process. I have used it on the side of my head ( Old baldy on top ) and it has worked OK just be aware of the need for multiple pass's over the same terrain surfaces are going to be necessary as it is not a single pass tool from my limited experience.

  414. I was wanting to get a better shave on my beard than I was getting from a rotary which I have been using for over a decade, and I have sensitive skin, and after researching the best sensitive skin razor, i decided to give the Panasonic a try to see if it made a difference. It did make a difference when i started using it, close, and works great in the shower, but its loud and if you are used to a rotary shaver, its going to take some getting used to. It shaves closer than the high end Norelco that i also tried out, and cleans up well too, I just rinse it off and put it away, never bothered with the included cleaning base as I saw that it was loud too, and I just don't like that. I am not sure it is as comfortable as the norelco, as that glides across your face and this does that but not as good as the norelco. The charge is good, i had charged it the first day, and did not have to charge it for three weeks, but I only shave two or three times a week. Its made in Japan, well built, and powerful, but it does not get the hairs at the neck like most electric shavers, and you have to go back a couple of times to get those spots, which can cause irritation.<br /><br />I ultimately decided it was too noisy, and not very good at keeping the irritation down on my neck and chin, but guess what, Amazon has a crazy restock fee for item that have been opened, they have a high one for unopened items that you just don't want, but its up to 50% restock fee for opened stuff, even if it was not up to par for what you need! You won't see this on their site in plain English, you have to search for it, but I am stuck with it, and only used it 4 times in a month. I will Ebay it, I paid 163.00 with shipping, so i can sell it on ebay for what i paid, since Amazon and other retailers are still selling it for close to 200.00!<br /><br />Nice shaver if you like foils, but amazons return policy has gone down the tubes, and I will only buy from here if it is something I know I will never need to return, and most things I do not, this is my first attempt at a return here, and it is pricey!
  415. The shave performance is best... closest shave ever...the cleaning was confusing.. not sure whether to use the cumbersome and costly device or the simple quick soap and water when the cleaning light goes on.. this is after i bought the extra cleaning supplies, etc.... would highly recommend

  417. buy Norelco and save $100 and get a better shave. I don't know why I still use this thing. I bought it because it was said to be the best.   418. Best electric shaver I have ever owned. Cannot go wrong. Very smooth, no nicks, close shave.

  420. No problems with &#34;breaking-in&#34; this electric shaver! I shave &#34;close&#34; with no pain or scraps.   421. My last shaver was a Braun which did an OK job, but I eventually just went back to using regular razors.   424. An update to my review: I initially gave this item five stars. I am now taking that back to three stars. What I wrote about this electric shaver still holds, but I would like to comment on the pop up trimmer, which I have tried using a few times in the month since receiving this razor. Simply put - the pop up trimmer is not very good. It does a poor job of cleaning up my sideburns and while it does trim, it takes longer than the pop up trimmer on my old Braun and does not leave a nice straight line. For some reason, some hairs just don't get cut leaving a jagged look. ------------------ I bought this as a gift to myself to replace an old (seven year old) Braun Syncro. I was torn between this razor and the newest one from Braun. To be completely honest, I was never that impressed with the Syncro even though I do like Braun styling. To me, this Panasonic razor looked clunky, but I bought it anyway because of the mostly glowing reviews. The reviews are right! This razor gives a great shave with minimal irritation (I have sensitive skin and I avoided shaving whenever possible. Some points about this Panasonic: It shaves quick (mine are 3-4 minutes average) and it leaves behind few hairs. It is mostly made of plastic, but it has a solid feel and does not look cheap. The bulbous head, though it looks unwieldy, actually does not detract when the shaver is being used. The pop-up trimmer is in a position such that when in use you can easily see where you are trimming. The shaver is a bit louder than my old Braun Syncro, but I've gotten used to that and it is no longer a distraction. In all, I'd say this shaver works great and worth the money I spent on it.
  425. As a (formerly) dedicated rotary shaver man for over 30 years I finally found a different razor I am happy with. Took a few weeks to get used to, but this works better than any electric. Still has, like all razors, some problems with the neck area, but clearly the best so far. I started shaving first with shaving foam, but as my technique improved I just shaved dry. Average shave time is around 2:15( 3 if I am slow) and about 30 sec to clean it--can't beat a 3 minute shave! I stopped using the cleaning system and instead just rinse it with a little soap after each use, as described in the manual. Dawn direct foam works great.The cleaning stand is noisy and clunky and takes a while, but it does work.
  426. I have been using exclusively electric razors for the last 40+ years. Compared to those quite well-known and respected brands, my new Panasonic ES-LA93-K beats them all, hands down. It has given me the cleanest shave ever. Since it is both a wet and dry razor, I think for safety reasons, it will not turn on if the charging cord is attached--I could not find any reference to this feature, but it is good to know that one cannot use the machine if the battery is totally discharged. Yet, once plugged in, within minutes the charge will be sufficient for a 4 to 5 minute session.
