This shaver has converted me, I will never go back to disposable shavers.
  430. The shaver itself is exceptional. I'd been a satisfied Braun user for many years but decided to switch to the Panasonic because of reviews I had read. I am very pleased with the closeness of the shave.<br /><br />But I am very unhappy with the cleaning system. Contrary to what the instructions say, I am having to install a new cassette of cleaning solution as often as every 7 days. The instructions say that doing this once a month is what one can expect.<br /><br />And Panasonic doesn't make it easy to get warranty service. After hunting down the correct service number, I was given instructions that made no sense by someone who clearly didn't know what he was talking about. And to make matters worse, my only warranty service recourse is to ship the entire package -- including the shaver, which is working fine -- to a service center in New York City or in San Francisco. This would leave me without the shaver for one to two weeks.<br /><br />One of the reasons I switched from Braun to this Panasonic was the cost of the Braun cleaning cassettes. But it is turning out that the Panasonic ones, less expensive per unit, will end up costing me much more because they need to be replaced much more often than their promotional piece indicate. I don't plan on using them any more; I can clean the shaver under running water.<br /><br />Bottom line: Buy the shaver and forget about the cleaning system. I don't see it as necessary anyway and it certainly is not worth the maintenance costs.<br /><br />A year later: When the warranty ran out, the cleaning system itself broke. That is, the red light began flashing and would not turn off despite my cleaning the reservoir, the entire unit, and installing a new cartridge. This made it impossible to engage the cleaning system at all. Furthermore, efforts to order a replacement resulted in their sending me the wrong part and then requiring several hours to trying to get connected to a human being. Not that the problem was resolved easily once I got through to a person. It would have cost about $100 with shipping to purchase a new cleaning base.<br /><br />All in all, I cannot recommend this system, despite the fact that the shaver itself does a good job.
  431. I had been using a high-end Braun for several years, so I liked the idea of an automatic cleaning system. This shaver definitely gives me a better shave. To get that excellent shave, I need to go over and over my whole beard-like about 5 minutes. Time consuming, but worth it. As for the cleaning system, I think I prefer this system to the Braun. It should be more economical as well. Overall, this Panasonic seems better built, better shave, and usable in the shower.
  432. I love this shaver. I owned a previous vortex shaver that was cheaper. I was fairly happy with that model but this model while far more pricey gives a fantastic close shave. You can renew the shaver with a replacement screen or blades eventually. The electric shaver finally comes to compare with a manual blade shave. Bye, bye gillette!
  433. So here it is... This is a nice razor, in the sense that it looks nice, it is from a good company and works well. All of the positive reviews of this shaver made a believer out of me, a man who has shaved with a blade for almost all of my life. So I bought one, and tried it, not once, not twice, but for a full 30 days. Although the shaver is large, it feels just fine in the hand. It charges rather quickly and I don't really care about the long clean/dry cycle... Really, who cares if it takes almost 3 hours to clean and dry it? Once you're done using it for the day, you're done using it for the day, and you don't need to use it in the next 3 hours; so just set it in the cleaning cradle and forget about it. The cleaning cartridges are really not that expensive, ($10 for a pack of 3 on Amazon) come on people, stop complaining about that. Now, on to the shave: This is in fact the fastest shaver head on the market, something ridiculous like 14,000 rpm, this is nice, but it translates to heat... Lots of heat being generated from the head after a couple of minutes of shaving. The shaver does an OK job on the face, nowhere close to a blade, but not bad. The neck and chin are another story. I have a normal chin, no cleft, no crazy jaw-line, just average man-chin. This shaver, along with all others I have tried, does not get close enough on the chin. Inevitably there are 10+ short stubbles left that require cleaning up with a blade. On the neck, even worse. Lots of hairs left behind, especially on sensitive areas which leads to shaving the area over and over and over which leads to...Yes, my friends: razor burn. Not to mention that even after shaving the neck until it is almost raw, I still had to break out my Mach 3 to clean up the left overs. After lots of after shave lotion, and some salicylic acid to prevent the inevitable ingrown hairs, I'm writing this review. Don't waste your money, I paid $170 for this shaver and it is being returned today. It simply is not good enough. It is just \\"good\\". For that price, it should not be just good, nor should I have to do any clean up with my blade after spending 5+ minutes shaving. Just not worth it. My advice, if you're a blade guy, stay in the club; nothing I have tried has come close to my blade, and if you're reading this, nothing you've tried has either.
  434. Unbelievably close shave. Closer than the Mach3 wet shaver I have been using for years. Dry shaving has not given me any skin burn whatsoever. Expensive but you get what you pay for.
  435. Usually I look at extra blades or foils on a razor as an extra attempt to appear more useful. But I was blown away at the effectiveness of this shaver! My shaving time is usually 2 minutes with my old 2 row +trimmer but now I can finish in half the time. The pivoting head proved useful as well and the motor is a little higher pitched than my old one but definitely not as loud. The only con I have is the bright, I mean, blaringly distractful, led light that blinks every couple of seconds. It's so bright I need to cover it with the travel pouch just so that it doesn't light up the bathroom at night. Also when you put it in the charger/dock washer, the display is upside down. This is poor design in my opinion because 99% of the time you look at it it's when it's in the charger. You can't see it when it's on your face. The last con I have is the cleaning system. It uses a cartridge that pretty much has dehydrated concentrated cleaning liquid. You fill the back reservoir with regular water that activates the cartridge, which is only rated for 30 days, no matter if you use the clean cycle daily, twice a week, weekly, or every other week. The plug also plugs into the dock in an awkward slanted angle on the right side instead of the back. Design appears to have gone entirely to the razor, which is fine, but it could have used some refinement.
  436. I converted to electric after shaving with a razor for 20 years. This shaves just as close as a razor. It does take a bit longer than shaving with a razor, but it gets the job done. I use this primarily to shave my head. After the learning curve was over, face takes about 2.5 minutes and my head takes 6-7 minutes to complete.
  437. Being a black man, and having the problems the most black men have when it come to shaving, the shaver works great !!! It allows me to shave more often, without the irritation and bumps!!! And the cleaner makes clean up a breeze!!!
  438. Was as advertised. fast charging, fairly close shave. Still not as good as a blade razor but I don't nick myself. Certainly better than the last electric I bought.
  439. I'm not well in english, so I'll do a very small review! When I bought this shaver I just wanted buy the best one! So I choose this shaver and I'm 100% satisfied! I didn't try the other one, but however I think this one is the best of the best shavers!
  440. I bought this hoping it would do a good job, and I'm very satisfied. I use it mostly for dry shaving, and it can get very close. But as with just about electric shaver ever invented, if you want perfectly smooth skin (baby style with no razor stubble in *any* direction), then you need to use a razor blade shaver. I've found that if I want perfectly smooth skin, I have to use the electric shaver for longer than I would the razor blade one. I also have to pull my skin tight and manipulate in a lot of different directions. Maybe others don't have those challenges. As of now I mostly end up using it in two ways; one, for quick shaves where I'm on the go or don't have time for a full shave. The second is to shave the sensitive spots, where a manual razor can catch my skin. I zip over those areas and smooth them out, then do the manual shave in the bath. I don't need to shave every day so that approach works for me. Sometimes I will do the complete shave with the electric. Overall, I have used Brauns, Norelcos, triple heads, straight heads and others ... and this is definitely the best. It's a bit pricey though, so think about your use and expectations before you make the purchase.
  441. I have really sensitive skin and I can shave every day with this thing. It's a beast too! I shave my face and my head in 9 minutes with no problems. I had the $90 model of this before I upgraded and even though it would shave my head it would take about 15 minutes for just my head. The cleaning stand is a little noisy, but whatever man, I keep it in my bathroom so I don't listen to it. Cleans and dries perfectly. I was kind of skeptical about spending so much money on it, but I would do it again without a question.
  442. The razor was nice, better than my braun 7XXX, but i have to say, the cleaner just simply useless, it crushed in just one month, and what i can do is send the whole system back to panasonic, they will send a new one to me, BUT, this situation will continue, till the warranty expired.
  443. After years of appreciating my Braun 8500 series, they went and changed the replacement cutter block and foil, and I just couldn't seem to get a decent shave (and yes, Braun apologists... it was a German-made replacement block and foil). So, I thought I'd treat myself to the [[ASIN:B003YJAZZ4 Braun Series 7- 790cc Pulsonic Shaver System]]. I was able to forgive how the top-of-the-line Braun was pulling hair and cutting me for a little while, but after 30 days of \\"OUCH!\\" and some gross scabs, we had to break up. Sorry, Braun. It's not me. It's you.<br /><br />I had heard good things about Panasonic, and basically stumbled in to a great deal on this razor, so I had to give it a shot. And, I have to say, I wish I had become a Panasonic convert sooner.<br /><br />The quality of the shave I got was excellent and consistent. It was comfortable from the very first shave, and only seems to improve. Not a single hair pulled, and not a single cut on my neck. And razor burn? A thing of the past!<br /><br />I also really like how much quieter the cleaning cycle is on this razor, compared to any of the past three Braun razors I've owned. If I forget to clean it after I've shaved in the morning, I can do it before I go to bed without terrifying my family.<br /><br />So why only four stars?<br /><br />1) Coming from a Braun, the head on this razor is absolutely massive. It would be fine if I didn't have a beard and was just arbitrarily shaving, but hitting the line of my beard is really challenging, because the foil is encased in black plastic. So you have to get a feel for where the plastic stops and the foil begins.<br /><br />2) While the Vortex cleaning system seems competent enough, it requires filling a separate tank with water in addition to the Vortex cartridge. You have to pick up the base, unplug it, remove / insert the Vortex cartridge, remove the tank, fill it, replace it, and plug the base back in. By comparison, the Braun Clean & Renew cartridges are pre-mixed, so you push a button, the base pops up, slide the old one out and the new one in. Further, the Braun Clean & Renew bases all have an indicator (or indicators) showing when the solution cartridge needs to be replaced. The Panasonic base doesn't do this at all. And lastly, I'm mildly concerned about what impact my hard tap water will have on the longevity of the razor -- yes, I could pick up some distilled water, but how convenient is that?<br /><br />3) Another base complaint -- the Braun bases look fairly contemporary, and lock the razor in when it's being cleaned. The Panasonic base looks like it's from the future, if the future was envisioned in 1981. Yes, it's utilitarian, but at this price level, I don't think it's unreasonable to expect more than \\"functional\\".<br /><br />4) When Braun razors are charged, the LCD (or LED, depending on the model) just shows a charge. This razor continually flashes the blue backlight from the LCD display. Minor? Sure. But again, at this price level, I don't expect my razor to look broken when it has a full charge.<br /><br />Individually, I think that list is pretty minor. But taken as a whole, I can't say this is a five-star product when there are a number of improvements that could be made that wouldn't appreciably change the underlying price of the product.<br /><br />In saying that though, I'd totally recommend this to anybody looking for a decent electric razor.nd the new one in. Further, the Braun Clean & Renew bases all have an indicator (or indicators) showing when the solution cartridge needs to be replaced. The Panasonic base doesn't do this at all. And lastly, I'm mildly concerned about what impact my hard tap water will have on the longevity of the razor -- yes, I could pick up some distilled water, but how convenient is that? 3) Another base complaint -- the Braun bases look fairly contemporary, and lock the razor in when it's being cleaned. The Panasonic base looks like it's from the future, if the future was envisioned in 1981. Yes, it's utilitarian, but at this price level, I don't think it's unreasonable to expect more than \\"functional\\". 4) When Braun razors are charged, the LCD (or LED, depending on the model) just shows a charge. This razor continually flashes the blue backlight from the LCD display. Minor? Sure. But again, at this price level, I don't expect my razor to look broken when it has a full charge. Individually, I think that list is pretty minor. But taken as a whole, I can't say this is a five-star product when there are a number of improvements that could be made that wouldn't appreciably change the underlying price of the product. In saying that though, I'd totally recommend this to anybody looking for a decent electric razor.
  444. Works well, operates smoothly. Does not irritate much. Not quite as close as razor, but pretty good.
  445. Pros: looks nice, gives a very close shave. Cons: expensive and not a quicker shave vs competitors (especially against the other electric shaver I own), doesn't shave well around the adams apple of the neck. I have been using electric shavers my whole life, so I have a pretty decent idea of how well they work. I heard wonderful things about this shaver through reviews, and thought I would upgrade because reviews raved that this shaver was fast (some people saying 3 minutes to completely shave). I let my face grow 5 days and it took around 7 min and 30 sec to shave. I went back to my old razor (braun 8000 series) over a month later and timed my shave. It took about 6 minutes. I was expecting the panasonic to mow through the hair, but you still have to rub back and forth to cut the missed hairs. Cleaning station is pointless because it's a wet/dry shaver. The instructions that come with the shaver even promote cleaning without the cleaning station. As stated above, the shave is closer, which is why I didn't give it a 1 star. Not worth the price currently. Wait til sub 100 dollars.
  446. This thing cuts closely. TOO closely in fact. I cut myself more easily than any other razor I've used. That said at least they're sharp cuts and not at all painful. On the plus side if I am careful I can get a very close shave with no problems. It does take a few passes to cut hairs despite vibrating and being sharp, but that is true of any razor. The only minor downside I can see is that it is super noisy. This is WAY better than my previous Braun (and almost as good as my Braun before that... they've gone WAY downhill) and better than my old Norelcos. Panasonic has a new fan.
  447. I have been using an electric razor for the last 17 yrs. I have always had foil shavers. The last 7 years I have had a Braun 7526 that has always been good to me, a clean shave that never really missed any hairs. It has slowly been taking longer and longer to shave. I decided to start the search for a replacement. Being a Braun user for so long, I was really leaning towards just getting their 7 series shaver. The Panasonic ESLA93K was very comperable in every catagory as the Braun. The 4 Nanotech blades & dual 14,000 rpm motors are what sold me on this unit. I have been using my Panasonic ESLA93K for almost a month now & seriously couldn't be happier. I had 3 days growth when I used it for the first time. With my Braun I would have to have used a trimmer to cut the length down to a manageable size for my razor to be able to get through it. The Panasonic ESLA93K was able to cut straight thru it to a super smooth shave in under 7 minutes. I never felt even a single hair pull or catch. I have also not had a single day with razor burn (I only dry shave). I have cut my shave time down from over 10 minutes to under 6 minutes, my shave time doesn't increase even if I miss a day. All that said..... A couple things that aren't perfect with the Panasonic ESLA93K 1. It's size is a bit bulky, I have a little bit of a problem shaving my side burns close to my ear's tragus. 2. I find it harder to shave a nice staight line, for a goatee. 3. The cleaning unit is a bit noisey & takes a long time to cycle. 4. You can not clean the Panasonic ESLA93K without charging it too, I like to run my battery down to 10% or lower prior to charge. None are really all that bad. I have a smaller trimmer that eliminates all the negatives for me. I love this shaver & am extremely happy with it. I haven't had a single issue with it.
  448. I was a lifelong Norelco user but, I recently purchased a Panasonic ES LA93 and a Norelco 1280X/42 for a head-to-head comparison. Here's how I rated each. Obviously, this is subjective and not every item gets equal weight: Panasonic ES LA93: Comfort - 5 Closeness - 4 Difficult spots - 3 Noise - 2 Cleaning System - 5 Norelco 1280X/42 Comfort - 4 Closeness - 4 Difficult spots - 5 Noise - 4 Cleaning System - 3 Overall, I give both razors a 4 and would easily recommend either one, but different people will have different priorities on what they want to get out of it. Comments for each category: The Panasonic was very comfortable; using it I could survive without after shave if I had to. The Norelco is more comfortable than a blade, but there's still a bit of razor burn after using. On closeness, I find it impossible to get a perfectly smooth shave, even with a blade. If I want a \\"perfect\\" shave, I would take 10 minutes with a blade and have a stinging face all morning, so I don't bother. Two or three minutes with either one of these razors and I'm good enough. There was no appreciable difference between the two. For the difficult spots (under the nose, under the chin, etc.) I found the foil on the Panasonic to be farther from the edge of the body than I expected and particularly under the nose was a little tough to get to. The curves on the Norelco get right in there with no problem. The Panasonic is way louder, not unpleasant, but it made me appreciate how quiet the Norelco had been all my life. The cleaning system on the Norelco is okay, but 20th century compared to the Panasonic (kind of like a semi-automatic sink compared to an automatic dishwasher). Not a big deal to me either way, but if it were, this would have put Panasonic over the top.

  456. I had an older version of this razor, and loved it. Used it for the last couple years. I screwed up though and forgot the foil on one of the ports of the cleaning cartridge, and I ruined the cleaning unit. Razor still worked well, but I like the convenience of the cleaning system. I clean daily myself just with water, but when the battery is low and needs a charge, I love having the system to just drop it into to charge and get a good cleaning. Only maybe every three weeks, but it's worked great for me and that lets the cleaning cartridges last for quite a while.<br /><br />Initially I tried the Philips Norelco 1280X/4 system. It looked like a good alternative. But when it arrived I was very dissatisfied with the cleaning system. It's an open system, basically a bowl of water underneath the system. Bump it, and it spills. You can't move it easily. This is totally enclosed, so there's no worry about that with the Panasonic system. And when I tried to shave my head, the Philips just didn't do a good job at all. It was much quieter than these Panasonics, to the point where you wonder if it's even working right because it sounds so quiet, you think the blades could barely be moving. And it felt good, no tugging at all. But it took me two to three times as long going over my head repeatedly, and it NEVER got as close as my Panasonics had. It constantly felt like a 5 o'clock shadow on my head. People love how they work on the face, but on the head, it was bad in every respect.<br /><br />So I returned it and picked up this one, since this was the closest to what I had, just a newer version of it. Same cleaning system concept I was used to, but the razor is a definite step up from even the very nice Panasonic I'm replacing. The head pivots both side to side and &#34;up and down&#34; which made SUCH a huge difference when shaving my head. My other one only went side to side, and I usually left it locked anyway since it didn't pivot as smooth as this one does.<br /><br />I shaved my head in about half the time my other Panasonic took, and it's never felt this smooth.<br /><br />The grip is comfortable. The noise is just about the same as the other Panasonic. The lock button is a bit stiff, but since I rarely have to travel, it's not an issue for me.<br /><br />Fit and finish is fantastic.<br /><br />This is my third Panasonic now, and the other two still work - I always keep one as a backup in case of problems, so now I can retire the very old one that had been my backup.<br /><br />For me, worth every penny, as this is the quickest, fastest, least irritating shave I've ever had.oes.<br /><br />I shaved my head in about half the time my other Panasonic took, and it's never felt this smooth.<br /><br />The grip is comfortable.   463. Let me begin by saying I've owned this shaver for about one year now. I have always had issues shaving my face. My hair is very coarse and grows in several different directions and I get razor burn and ingrown hairs very, very easily. I've tried everything from rotary electric shavers to all different types of manual razors, and nothing seems to work well for me. This was my first attempt at using a foil, and I decided to go all out and get the best, but unfortunately, this didn't work for me either. Don't get me wrong, it is a very nice piece of equipment. I love the cleaning and charging dock and everything seems to be made exceptionally well. The shaver, however, does not do a very good job on my face. I have to go over most areas several times to get all the hairs, and even then it ends up missing quite a few. Constantly going over the same areas results in irritation and razor burn. I have a particularly difficult time shaving under my jaw/neck line, as the shaver usually misses most or all of the hair in that area, no matter how many times I go over it. I also have a difficult time above my upper lip/under my nose. When it comes to these areas, it seems the shaver head is just too big to be precise. When I am done I always have to finish up with a manual razor to get the areas this shaver missed.<br /><br />I gave this shaver three stars based on its exceptional build quality and the wonderful cleaning/charging station. I've read many reviews saying the cleaning solution only lasts one month whether you use it every day or once a week. I, personally, have found that if you remove the shaving head and rinse the foils prior to running the shaver through the cleaner, it does not use much solution at all. In fact, I am still on the original solution cartridge after one year, and I clean the shaver every time I use it, which is 2-3 times per month.<br /><br />I had high hopes for this shaver, and was really hoping that I would finally be able to shave every day or at least every other day with it. Just like with anything else, however, I can only shave with it once a week or it tears my face apart. I have no doubts this works wonderfully for many people, but it just does not work for me.

  474. While the shaver itself is excellent, the cleaning base is another story. I've now gone through 3 of them within 2 years. Panasonic doesn't seem to realize that the cleaning base/charger is prone to premature failure. My son, who also purchased this razor has had the exact same experience as me. At first you're delighted by the close shave that you get. You're enthralled with the fact that you no longer have to clean the shaver. Than, out of the blue, the base/charger stops working, or ends up leaking. Panasonic obviously knows that there is a defect in this unit, yet they have the gall to refuse to send you a new base once it's out of warranty. When you spend this much on a shaver, the entire system should last more than 2 years. Now, I don't even use the base, as it no longer works. I refuse to pay Panasonic any more money to replace it for a forth time. I simply wash the blades under running water and let them air dry. When the shaver needs charging, I plug it into a wall outlet. The bottom line is that this is an excellent shaver, but because it comes with a defective base. I only give it 2 stars.

  477. I've owned nothing but Norelco's for the past 4 decades but my last Norelco was always a disappointing shave. It just wasn't close enough. I decided to expand my options and after much research, I chose the Panasonic ES-LA93. I use to use Panasonic exclusively for everything from TV's to answering machines but I got burned once on a TV and then on a top of the line VCR so that put me off Panasonic, also for decades. Anyway, as I said after my research, I figured they suffered enough and it was time I gave them another chance. It's been about 3 months now and I am very much impressed with this razor. For those of you who dry shave, it is imperative you try at least once, a wet shave with a shaving gel in the shower. I never thought you could get such a close shave with an electric razor. Truly rivals a blade. The one small issue I have is that every once in awhile, it misses a face hair that just lays too flat on my skin to be picked up by the screen and cut. It doesn't pick it up for a couple of shaves and I notice it, usually at my work mirror, and by that time, it's long enough to pluck. Ouch. Another issue I had initially, but solved, stemmed from my pressing too hard with the razor on my skin. I was actually getting little nicks and cuts. This was because I was used to pressing really hard on my face with the Norelco to try and get a good close shave. I became aware that I did not need such pressure with the Panny and I bleed no more. Is there a Panasonic Viera plasma TV in my future? I am considering it but baby steps Panasonic, baby steps.<br /><br />UPDATE A YEAR LATER*<br /><br />Ok,a year later and I'm more impressed than ever. Panasonic recommends changing the screen once a year and the blades every 2 years.<br />I was noticing the shave was not quite as close after about a year so I ordered a new screen even though I couldn't see how it would make much of a difference. I thought the blades would make the difference there. I was wrong. The screen change restored the shave to like new.<br /><br />The single hair laying flat issue hasn't occurred for over 8 months or so. I'll assume it was my face becoming accustomed to the shaver.<br /><br />The cleaner charger has a slight glitch. Just this past month or so, and for the first time,the cleaner didn't work when i pressed the button to begin the cleaning cycle. The lights remained flashing on the cleaner as it does when the cycle is finished but the cleaner just did not respond except the charging for the battery continued. I unplugged the unit and when I plugged it back in, it the cleaning cycle started and worked fine.
  478. Genius. Pure genius. The closest, smoothest shave I've ever gotten with an electric shaver. Every man should have one of these. My only gripe is that it can't be used while plugged in. But I'll assume it's just part of this shaver's genius, and I'm just an idiot for wanting to shave with a corded appliance.
  479. This was for my boyfriend and here is his review:<br /><br />Coming from the Arc 3, this is a welcome upgrade and even a faster shave! No razor burn. Very smooth. Quiet. Long lasting charge. Used it for 4 shaves and it is still 100% charged. My only wish is that they sold the shaver without the Vortex Cleaning System. I just wanted the black shaver. It looks so much nicer...and with the $20 special reduction, it came close enough to the 63K silver version, so I went with this one. Both shavers ES-LA93-K and ES-LA63-K are identical except for the color. Also worth noting is that the LCD screen is very readable and bright. Much nicer than the Arc 3 I had, which is now retired. In case you are wondering, my facial hair growth is very heavy and course where the 5 o'clock shadow appears within a couple of hours.
  480. Shaves very nicely, very close. The pop-up trimmer is disappointing, too small and awkwardly placed. But I have a separate beard trimmer and don't really use the trimmer on the shaver. Another annoying thing is the cleaning base gets clogged easily with hair and doesn't drain. Never happened with my Braun shaver.

  482. Let me start by saying that the shaver is really great, but the cleaning unit is a problem. After I used the cleaning unit for several days, the status lamp came on. Since it still cleans and dries the shaver, I have not had it repaired. When the lamp came on, I searched online for more information and stumbled over many consumers complaining about the same problem. So, obviously it is a very common issue, which the manufacturer has not taken an action.<br /><br />I thought about giving three stars because of the faulty cleaning unit, but I couldn't because I like this shaver so much! So, the shaver is really really great. Very close and comfortable shave without cut or nick.
  483. I ordered this for my husband who has Demensia. We are still working at it. It will take a while for him to get used to it. It's especially great that it cleans itself!!!! So far it is doing its job. Thanks. Finally got rid of the razor blades.
  484. Having primarily shaved with a blade all my life, and having only used one other electric razor in my life (and a cheap $30 one at that), I thought I would give this Panasonic razor a chance. I was hopeful that it would speed up my morning routine and take some of the work out of the chore of shaving. I was also hopeful that given the relatively high price and recent advanced in technology, that this razor would do a good job.<br /><br />Well, I was disappointed. I gave the Panasonic a solid two weeks before giving up and going back to a blade. I don't have what I'd consider to be a particularly thick beard, but I do have to shave every day. While the Panasonic did an acceptable job on the sides of my face, I could never get anything resembling a close shave on areas with thicker hair, such as around my neck. As I stated at the beginning of my review, one of the primary reasons I gave this razor a try was in hopes of speeding up my morning routine. Well, to get a presentable shave, it took minutes with the Panasonic--making multiple passes over the same area to try to get a closer shave. In the end, I didn't feel like I was saving any time at all, especially when combined with the sub-par results. Spending more time with a blade would result in a better shave; with the Panasonic, it was just frustrating, and there were diminishing returns after a certain amount of time.<br /><br />As for the razor itself, the battery life seemed fine and was never an issue. The self-cleaning system appeared to work well, although is quite noisy, as some other reviewers stated. Noisy enough that you can hear it from several rooms away. Not a big deal if you shave and are out of the house, but if you work from home, or have other members of your household home while this thing is cleaning, I can see how it would get annoying quickly. Also, when this razor finishes charging, the blue backlight on its display continually blinks on and off. This light is BRIGHT, and if yourbathroom is anywhere close to your bedroom, this will drive you crazy at night. I ended up having to remove it from the cradle every night to get that crazy light to stop blinking. Maybe there is a way to disable this \\"feature\\", but it wasn't apparent to me.<br /><br />So, yes--I used this Panasonic electric razor for a solid 2 weeks and pretty much gave up on it. I'm keeping it for use when I'm traveling, or out hunting, since I think it will be \\"good enough\\" for those purposes, but I certainly wouldn't recommend it for daily use if you're coming from a blade. Perhaps if you're exclusively an electric razor guy, this might be a decent razor. I don't have enough experience with electric razors to make that comparison. But I do know what a good shave feels like (i.e., a good blade), and this electric razor doesn't come close. For lack of a better description, I'd say I still feel \\"dirty\\" after finishing shaving with the Panasonic, whereas a good blade will leave you with a \\"clean\\", refreshed feeling. And for me, when I'm getting ready to start out the day, I much prefer that \\"clean\\" feeling.<br /><br />Just in case someone out there is interested in a *great* shave, I'll give my humble recommendations on a good (and relatively cheap) set-up:<br /><br />* [[ASIN:B002FC7B2G Merkur Long Handled Double Edge Safety Razor Chrome #180, 10 Double Edge Platinum Blades]] (don't use the included Merkur blades, they are junk)<br />* [[ASIN:B001G5FOLI 10 Feather Razor Blades NEW Hi-stainless Double Edge]] - my preferred blade, but everyone is different. Many folks recommend getting a [[ASIN:B004UIZFQW sampler pack]] to start with so you can quickly and cheaply sample a variety of blades.<br />* [[ASIN:B000G647Y8 Tweezerman Men's Shaving Brush]] - you can spend a lot more on a shaving brush, but this one gets the job done, and the price is right<br />* [[ASIN:B001XURHNY Colonel Conk Evernice Model 775 Chrome Safety Razor Stand]] - OK, you don't *need* a razor stand, butthis thing works great, and adds a touch of class to your bathroom<br />* [[ASIN:B001JHEY14 Proraso Shave Soap, Sensitive, 150 Gram Jar]] - Shave soap - this will last you a long time. A good shave soap is a necessity - using cheap shaving cream or gel just won't yield the same results.<br />* [[ASIN:B000RIAD0W Proraso Pre and Post Shave Cream - 3.6 oz]] - Optional, but nice and refreshing<br />* [[ASIN:B001N9MJX8 Proraso Dioibarba Aftershave Lotion (Liquid) 100ml/3.4oz]] - again, this is optional, but is very refreshing and a great way to start the day

  493. This unit's technology does give the closest shave compared to all the other shavers on the market however, there are two major problems: 1. The cleaner base system is fragile. Mine broke within several months. The status light went on, and it would no longer clean or dry. In my opinion, this shaver requires the cleaner unit in order to give the closest shave and keep clean. So if the cleaner system is not working, the experience is not the same. 2. The second problem is that Panasonic Customer service call center is not very truthful. The service center has a Texas address, however the call center is in Asia-Pacific so there is a disconnect there. The call center service rep said they would replace my unit with a brand new one, however I am rather sure I received SOMEONE ELSE's rebuilt unit that had another, new problem: the cleaner will not drain, leaving me with a wet razor after the cleaning cycle. How is this supposed to be brand new? So, I am faced with a 2nd faulty cleaner base system and I am having to send everything back to them at my own expense again. I find this unacceptable for a personal care product costing $220+.
  494. I have to echo what a lot of other reviewers have said. This is a great shaver, hampered by a terrible cleaning system. I've had this for over a year now and still continue to use it. My previous electric was a Braun, and the Panasonic is a much better shaver. I get a closer, faster, less irritating shave with the Panasonic. Unfortunately, the cleaning system it comes with is pretty much useless. Even when it did work, I was not impressed with how the system worked or how well it cleaned. Hardly a couple months after receiving the system it stopped working completely. The red status link blinks continuously and it refuses to do anything but 'dry' the shaver. At least this is a Wet/Dry model, so I just take off the foil and rinse the blades and foil really well in the sink and allow the unit to dry it. Panasonic has got Braun beat on the shaver, however, it could learn a thing or two about cleaning systems from Braun.
  495. I don't normally write reviews, but this razor is great.   499. This product was a pleasant surprise. I have been using Braun's top of the line electric shaver's prior and this one blows them away.   501. This razor replaced a Norelco 3D whose battery decided not to take a charge after two years. I had used Norelco razors for decades, but had purchased a Panasonic wet-dry razor about 15 years ago because I wanted to shave in the shower (one of life's simple pleasures for us guys!). When my Norelco died, I did not want to reward them with another couple of hundred dollars for a razor that would die in a couple of years. And besides, now that my eyesight is not as keen as in my younger days (I have to wear eyeglasses now), it is much harder to trim sideburns with a rotary razor than with a straight edge razor. With that as a background, I went online in search of testimonials about various electric razors. Although the Braun faired well, I had had a bad experience with one a few years back, and at that time, their customer service was really poor. After that, I went back to Norelco - the one that died on me recently. So, remembering how much I enjoyed my old Panasonic, I purchased this one. I could not be happier, unless the razor shaved me by itself! Using this razor did require me to let my beard adapt, but after the first week or so, I began to get shaves as close as I was used to with the Norelco. I have now owned this razor for just over one month, and not only do I get really close shaves, I also take less time to shave. I can shave in less than 3 minutes, including making sure my sideburns are trimmed straight. This model also includes the charging stand/cleaning station, which is a neat way to maintain the razor, although not really necessary. As with my old Panasonic, you can clean this one under the faucet using liquid soap. But the charging stand/cleaning station makes it so simple. And if you decide to clean it under the faucet, which I probably will do when I begin using it in the shower, there is a drying-only feature in the stand that allows you to simply dry your razor. Another nice feature is that you can actually charge this razor with the cord, so when you travel (for extended periods), there is no need to take along the stand. That is different from my old Norelco 3D which charged by induction only and required me to pack along the charging stand in order to charge with razor if I was away from home for more than a couple of weeks. For me, Pansonic has hit a home run with this razor!
  502. think i will try Brawn next
  503. My husband is really satisfied with the appearance, material and the functions of the sonic washing part. But the shaving experience can be described as 'moderate' or ' OK', because it is not that fantastic as expected to match its price.
  504. Get a nice fine shave although not as fine as a mechanical one. Never used a mechanical shaver before and this electric shaver has ensured I won't ever need one.

  506. This has really made my life easy. Close shave every time and super sanitary. I highly recommend this razor to anyone that is looking for a quality device.
  507. Best Shave i ever gotten, as good as a blade, and better than any other electric.....I have tried them all...love this razor
  508. I purchased this to replace a Phillips three head rotary shaver.<br /><br />I did like the Phillips but much prefer the closer shave of this foil shaver. So much so that after three years service I upgraded to the new ARC 5 version.<br /><br />I have not used the charging/cleaning station so cannot speak for it's effectiveness.
  509. I've had the ES-LA93-K since May 2011 and it's been an awesome product.<br /><br />I primarily use this shaver to shave my head every 3-4 days in the shower; each use leaves my head smooth and blood free. It allows me to quickly shave my head without worrying about cutting my head.<br /><br />I've used the cleaning system a few times, however, since I primarily shave in the shower, I keep the shaver relatively clean and don't really use it often. If you plan on shaving in the shower, then you can probably go with the ES-LA63-S if you don't want the cleaning system.
  510. I've been using Braun for a long time - they're nice razors, but a bit slow...and with my thick stubble, it typically took about 10-15 minutes to get a shave. And, by noon, I'd have stubble again. I read a review about the Panasonic in Wired Magazine (go figure), and talked with a few friends who owned them. I decided to check it out, and placed my order.<br /><br />Upon setting it up, while there's SOME similarity to Braun, there's FAR more differences. The cleaning system is very different (but works about the same way, methinks). It took a bit to figure out what each cleaning mode was, but real world, the two modes anyone will use is Charge, and Clean and Charge...so who cares? Note that the picture is not distorted, btw...the head on this is HUGE.<br /><br />The shaver itself is FAST. I get a FAR closer shave with this then I ever got with the Braun, and in about 1/2 the time. This I like.<br /><br />In fact, it only has one downside. The display on the shaver is sweet...tells you how long you shaved, and the % of battery left. When you charge it, it tracks the charge level. THEN....until you use it again, it blinks a bright blue light every five seconds. No big deal...until it's 11pm, and the location of the shaver is directly opposite the wife's side of the bed. Not so good....a blinking night light.<br /><br />Took some work to get this straightened out, but beforewarned....that is a definite bright light at night.<br /><br />All that aside, this is a GREAT shaver...glad I switched!
  511. UPDATE: Well, I had decided to not return this shaver in hopes that someday I would like it. I was packing it up and found a leaflet in the box stating \\"stick with it, it's worth it.\\" Subtle but effective. So after a couple of months I decided to give this another shot.<br /><br />You really do have to stick with it-even coming from another Panasonic shaver my face had to adjust. But in the end this unit really does give a good close shave. The vibrating foil does help some, and the battery life is somewhat lacking. But I'm now six weeks into using this shaver regularly and really like it. For wet shaving in the shower I suggest a small can of shaving gel. A travel-size can will last a while, since you just need a small amount to help the shaver glide over your face. Also, if you intend to use this as a wet shaver consider the version without the cleaning base if the price is less. As a wet shaver the shaver is completely clean after a rinse, and the drying feature of the cleaning base is too time-consuming. So while my original criticisms stand, they don't stand in the way of this being a great product.<br /><br />* * *<br /><br />I have been a long-time Braun shaver user, and until very recently I had a Braun 9595 Pulsonic, now known as the Series 7 that served me well for five years. I'm also a Panasonic user-a few months ago I also picked up a Panasonic ES-LT71, which is Panasonic's entry level 3-blade shaver with a cleaning station. I travel very frequently and sometimes need to pack extremely light, such that the Panasonic is a better choice than the Braun due to weight and size and ease of cleaning in the field. So when my Braun just stopped working, I ordered the Panasonic ES-LA93K after reading so much favorable information about it, and I eagerly awaited the UPS delivery.<br /><br />The ES-LA93K gives a good shave, but has a few issues. First, the second motor in the head provides the vibrations for the \\"pulsing foil\\" concept, a version of Braun's Pulsonicidea. The problem is that while the main motor is 14,000 cpm the foil pulsing motor is much slower and is less effective. It doesn't do much aside from draw power. Which is the second issue-battery life. Most shavers now use the same cylindrical Li-Ion battery, but with two motors drawing power this shaver gets much worse battery life. My old Braun or Panasonic LT71 can go almost 2 weeks on a charge, but this one barely lasted a week. With more foils one would expect that this shaver might give a dramatically faster shave, but I found the effect to be less than expected. Next, to accommodate all those foils, the shaver head is comically large. On open areas this does a good job but detail areas such as above the lip or below the sideburns are more difficult. The final issue is the cleaning station. Overall the Braun has a superior cleaning system but it is higher maintenance, where the Panasonic system is less expensive to run. The problem lies with the drying-Braun uses an inductive heater to actually heat the blades after cleaning, and combined with an alcohol cleaning solution the result is a clean and dry shaver in 30 minutes. Panasonic advertises a \\"heated dry\\" but the heat is provided by the friction of running the shaver dry while a small fan blows over the shaver head. This is a missed opportunity, as a small heating element would have done wonders. As it stands now the cycle takes nearly 80 minutes. Overall, the shaver feels good in the hand, is well balanced and well manufactured, but suffers from some design flaws that I hope Panasonic will address in future models. Until then I highly recommend either the ES-LT71 or a Braun Series 7.

Also longer hair is not easily shaved with this razor. It constantly misses longer hair. If you like to shave twice a week or so then you will be missing a lot of the longer whiskers with this shaver and covering those areas again and again to get them cut.   542. This is my husband's 3rd Panasonic wet/dry shaver. He's loved all of them, but this one he says is even better than the Arc 3. He does the majority of his shaving in the shower with it every morning, & then does little touch up stuff when he gets out. He gets a very nice, smooth shave (you have to give it a couple of weeks if you're new to electric). It cleans up great in the base, & it's significantly more quiet than the Arc 3. The flashing blue light bothers me some at night coming from in the bathroom, but that's easily solved by closing the door or unplugging for the night. This one comes with an even better travel case as well.<br /><br />We also set the cleaning cartridges up on Amazon Subscribe & Save for every 3 months. This way we know he has them when needed, & we get the discounted price plus free shipping! Love Amazon; love this shaver!

Not that it causes irritation, but the cut seems to be smoother and fast.<br /><br />I have no doubt this is one of the best, if not the best, shaver on the market. My dilema is I am trying to see the advantage of electric shaver vs traditional razors? I have used razors my entire shaving career and thought this would be a better alternative. Shaving with razors take less time, and are a little bit closer shave. I am questioning why I decided to make the switch to be honest. But I am invested in a electronic shaver now; I'll use it until I die or it dies.

  554. After many years of being a Braun fan, the last iteration I owned totally turned me off Braun. I had another very bad customer service experience with them going back some years and so, will never buy or even consider another Braun. But, this Panasonic is truly a Dream Machine! It looks very good - sleek and elegant - and is also very comfortable to use. The shave is exceptional, really, in my experience, the best ever. The instructions indicate that it can take 30 days for one's skin to adjust to a new shaving regime but I tell you what: my skin said \\"Yay!\\" the first time! This is in my view, the Rolls Royce of shavers I have owned. The Brauns have been consigned to the recycling bin forever!<br /><br />The wet-dry functions on the Panasonic are great and although it can be rinsed easily under the tap or swished through some warm water and neutral detergent, it also of course has a clean and dry function on the base unit. This is rather noisy but provided you don't do it at night, should not be a problem.<br /><br />The other plus with the Panasonic is the fact that it copes with 100v - 240v so can travel internationally! All you need is an adaptor plug fitting.<br /><br />All up, I am so pleased with this purchase! Full marks Panasonic!
  555. i buy the product as a birthday gift to my father-in-law. He likes the birthday gift. so i like it, too.
  556. When I discovered Panasonic's line of electric shavers I took awhile to come around to taking the plunge. I had used electric razors before, but all were dry and all had the same problems. They filled with gunk from my beard quickly and they left me with seriously irritated skin.<br /><br />I would have never tried an electric razor again until I stumbled on this. I read and re-read the description of using this shaver wet. I thought about it and finally opted to try it, knowing it would be a costly experiment if it went wrong. The reviews here on Amazon coaxed me along.<br /><br />Here's what I found. The blades move fast, are lineier, and can handle soap, water and oil without gumming up. I have very sensitive skin and a very coarse beard that grows like weeds in a garden. I would not go a day without nicking myself and having to spend time stopping the bleeding before heading to work. My face would be red and irritated all day and I was generally miserable having to get up every day to do it again (I'm in the Army).<br /><br />I tried this, and like the box says, you have to get your beard accostomed to the new shaving technique. What I got was the smoothest shave with zero irritation. I was sold. I threw away the other gimmic products supposed to make razor shaving easier, bought oil shaving liquid and I haven't used a blade since.<br /><br />The shaver is loud, but not irritating. The loudness it a testiment to the cutting speed, which is the reason your shave is smoother and there is little to no irritation. The hairs are cut quickly and never pulled by the shaver. I have not once felt a hair tugged by the blades, and that is saying something. I shave wet, right out of the shower, and I cannot begin to speak of how much I appreciate this product being out there.<br /><br />The battery lasts for a good while, and I average using 15-20% per shave. You cannot use it with the power cord plugged in, for obvious reasons, but the batter life makes up for this. Because the motor is so powerful and there are so many cutting surfaces you do not need a lot of time to shave, so it is obvious Panasonic had this in mind for the dry shave traveling crowd who prefer to use these plugged in.<br /><br />The blue LCD is the perfect size and tells you everything you need to know about the state of the razor. The cleaning base has a smart compact design and uses water and detergent to clean the head. This is another selling point for people with sensitive skin since most electric razor cleaners use alcohol which can cause discomfort. The cleaning system takes a while and can be a bit loud, but it is thourough. It cleans, soaks, drains, cleans and then drys the head so it is ready for you the next day. i use liquid hand soap to clean the razor before putting it into the cleaner to keep most of the gunk out of there, but that isn't necessary.<br /><br />I have used the razor and cleaning station on deployments and on multiple trips. The razor is designed for the traveler, comingwith a case and protective screen for the head, and it is voltage regulated to handle 110 and 220 outlets. That feature in and of it self saves me all kinds of money in the long term.<br /><br />Since I bought it I have had no problems with the electronics, blades, display or anything associated with the razor. I can safely say that for the price you are buying a quality product that will last you as long as you take care of it. If you have sensitive skin and dred shaving in the morning, I encourage you to take the plunge and buy this or any other Panasonic wet/dry razor....you will love them.
  557. Have had it for about 2 weeks. Went from a rotary which died to this and get a far smoother shave than I ever got with the old shaver.
  558. This wet/dry electric shaver really does the trick. It has no problem going through thick tough stubble with a nice, clean cut.
  559. The linear motor gives the closest, smoothest shave, especially for hairs growing out at an angle. I was getting bad shaves from other shavers such as Norelco rotary shaver and eventually tried Panasonic's Linear shaver. I have tried the 2-blade, 3-blade, and now the 4-blade. I thought the 2 and 3 blades gave just as good of a shave; and actually the smaller size gave the added benefit of improved maneuverability. The 4 and up configurations may be over engineered and not necessary. I would probably go with a 3 blade with cleaning system in the future, as there doesn't seem to be any added value to justify the increased costs for four blades or more. The cleaning system is nice as it does make the shaver seem like new after each cleaning that also gets rid of that &#34;hair smell&#34;. However, I have had difficulties with the cleaning system in the past such as accidentally interrupting the cleaning cycle making the function permanently inoperable; and hope those don't repeat. This would be five stars if it were not for the cost. Hard to believe it costs as much as 1/4 -1/2 the cost of a washing machine.
  560. i bought it for my father, he said it was really great ~satisfied
  561. I used Brauns prior to this purchase and liked most of them. However, by comparison the motor on this Panasonic is much more powerful. Because I have a coarse facial hair, that's a big plus. The Panasonic is a bit larger to hold in your hand and a tad more cumbersome to navigate around the upper lip but not a deal breaker. The LED display gives you charge status. The cleaning station seems to work well. The shaver runs for quite a few days on a single charge.<br /><br />One negative. If you run the charge down to empty and plug the shaver in using the cord, the unit doesn't operate. You have to wait until it has been recharged a bit before using it again.<br /><br />Overall, I highly recommend it.

They say they upgraded their system and could not do any exchanges for 2 weeks and that's why it is so long. It took over an hour on hold just to get through to them, to be told the same story as 2 weeks ago. If there are that many of these in for exchange it doesn't bode well for the shaver. It might be okay when it works, but with this level of customer support and the short lifespan of the one I got, I doubt it. This is one purchase I wish I never made.

  584. This is my first experience with an electric razor. I was having breakouts on my cheeks for almost a year and tried everything to get rid of it. I figured it must be coming from the disposable blades that I was using, tried different ones with no luck. Every time I would shave the breakouts got worse since I was constantly cutting them open getting more dirt inside, what a mess. I figured I'd give an electric a try and wanted to buy one of the best out there. I read many reviews about many razors and decided to go with this one. For a first time user they claim the break in time for your face is about 2 weeks, well it took about a month for me. The reason being is that after years of disposable use your face builds up scar tissue from constantly pulling off layers of skin. I tried many different ways to use this razor from using oil, soap, in the shower, different times of the day and so on. I almost gave up on using this one since it was taking a long time to get used to. Finally I found that using the electric razor in the morning or at night with a dry face worked the best with a splash of jojoba afterwards. I don't know why but jojoba has worked wonders for me with shaving once a day or once every 2 days. It's been a year almost to the day and my face has been clear and clean for quite some time and I am not giving this razor up any time soon. I just got the new blade and foil set. It's great for traveling, not too big and the bag is a good size. It's only big enough for the razor though not the power cord. The self cleaning is also quite something. I however messed up with that part and didn't change the cleaning solution for almost a year, though I clean it out of the cleaner most times anyway. I have since purchased new cleaning solution and will probably change it once every 2 months, recommended is every month I believe based on usage. Long story short this thing works the cats ass and I hope it lasts me a long time. Another note is thatI have very sensitive skin and it's been great for mine.

  586. First, the item was delivered exactly as advertised and shipping was relatively quick. With regard to the shaver, it works great. It cuts quickly and efficiently. The charger base is compact and the cleaning and drying functions work well. I'm not sure that the 4-blade head is that much better then the 2-head, but it does seem to work well. I've been using a Panasonic wet shaver for years so I didn't have to get accustom to it. The shave head is quite a bit larger than previous models but as another reviewer said it's easy to get use to. One negative about the unit is that the large LED in the handle that displays the state of charge and the run time for your last shave flashes once every two seconds once the unit is completely charged. This seemingly insignificant function is rather burdensome as it generates a continuous strobe light effect that is annoying at night. It's quite bright and flashes into the bedroom all evening, sometime making it difficult to get to sleep. I found that I must remember to remove the razor from the charging base every evening at bedtime. It's not a really big deal, but clearly an oversight on the part of the designers.

  590. I have gone through probably 10-20 electric shavers in my lifetime. I started shaving in 6th grade. Yes, I'm Italian with thick hair that grows super fast. Have to shave every day. So I consider myself a near-expert on this topic. Now for my review:<br /><br />1) Good/great battery life. The blinking blue light when charging is very bright but is not a big deal if you plug it in while you're in another room. It does NOT take a long time to charge. Under 30 mins. Big plus.<br /><br />2) Big head and good pivot mechanism is a huge benefit - cuts down on shaving time<br /><br />3) I would call this a &#34;high horsepower/low torque motor&#34;. I also just replaced the cutter heads and I did see an improvement but not as good as I thought I would get. It runs at a very high RPM (higher pitched sound) but the motor bogs down if you go too fast. I had a Braun years ago that was the exact opposite- low RPM/high torque. Part of me likes the latter better, but that shaver is long gone.<br /><br />4) I never used the cleaner base. Still in the box after having this for 2+ yrs. I disconnect the head, rinse both parts with warm water and give it a few light shakes and then let it air dry. Been doing that for 20 yrs with success.<br /><br />5) Trimmer is good, not great. It has a tendency to &#34;flip back&#34; to its original closed position. With a little practice this can be minimized.<br /><br />Overall, I like this shaver - but does take a little bit of getting used to (big head)...but it's worth it, even at this expensive price point.
  591. It turned out to be a.very good purchase. It took a few shaves to get accustomed to an electric shaver but now i really like the close shave it provides.
  592. I bought this electric razor back in 2010 to replace my Mach 3 hand-held razor. I haven't been more impressed with it's shaving prowess and ability to provide the closest shave I've gotten in years! It takes approximately 4 minutes or so to shave my face and neck. I shave dry after my shower and find this method translates to the best results. I don't have to clean the razor as much because my clippings aren't soiled with my skin's oils. I haven't shaved in the shower with this unit, although this is yet another way to approach shaving with the LA-93k.<br /><br />What I like the most about the LA-93k is the cost savings when compared with using Mach-3 blades. I can shave with the same foil and blade set for at least 2 years without replacement which is great! These blades are made using the same process that Japanese swords are forged, thus providing an unparalleled cutting edge that rarely goes dull. Unlike other users, I rarely experience tugging or pulling of facial hairs over time and I think I have a reasonably course beard. I can easily go more than a year as well, on a Year's Supply of Vortex Hydraclean shaving / cleaning cartridges provided I empty the clippings after each use in the sink. Economically speaking, this electric doesn't tax your wallet like a manual Mach 3 would which is even more reason to go out and purchase one for yourself!

  599. The LA93-K is the third Panasonic shaver I've owned since 2004. Like the others, I purchased it because Panasonic bills it as wet or dry-capable. (I find that I get a less irritating and a closer shave in the shower, though I don't use it this way as often as I thought I would.) The LA93-K does a decent job, though I usually have to spend longer than I'd like to get good results, going over problem areas several times. Replacement blades and foils aren't cheap, and it's often difficult to determine which ones to order on Amazon because of the multiplicity of choices and product numbers.<br /><br />The shaver's weakest point by far is its LCD display. It pulses brightly to indicate a full charge, which is annoying at night. Even worse, the display started to malfunction after about a year. Some of the characters and icons on the display wouldn't appear until I recharged the shaver completely. Now, most of them don't light up at all, so I can't determine the charge level. I had similar problems with both previous shavers - I assume that moisture is the cause, but that shouldn't happen if it's water-resistant. This will be my last Panasonic shaver.<br /><br />UPDATE: After months using the shaver without a working display, the motor started to malfunction to the point where it would only operate for a few seconds or turn on by itself. I'm convinced that Panasonic doesn't know how to manufacture a shaver that is properly sealed. I expect a lot more for $200, so I've downgraded my rating to one star.
  600. I've been using the Panasonic LA93 for over 2 years now & love the razor. My beard is tough, but not thick - I'm a 3 minute shaver with this razor. To quote another reviewer \\"It's like moving a cloud over my face\\". I've also owned the high end Braun & Norelco electric razors. This Panasonic is the best of the bunch. I use the stainless Feather safety razor on the weekends for change of pace and enjoy the quiet shave. The Panasonic is as close if not closer than the Feather safety razor. Granted, the Feather is considered to give a mild shave - but with practice & patience the shave is very close. Initially, I used the cleaning & drying cradle that came with the Panasonic razor. Now, I don't use the cradle - don't need it. Just remove the foil head, rinse under hot water, tap out the extra moisture on counter, run cutting blades for a few seconds, towel dry the exterior & that's it. No need for the noisy cleaning & drying cradle that uses expensive soap cartridges. BTW - I use Billy Jealousy \\"Super Slick Shave Cream\\" (I think it's more of a gel). I've tried many shaving gels, creams & soaps. Billy Jealousy is the best.
  601. I am using this razor for more than a year now. It was more expensive when I bought and is the top of the line razor from Panasonic. So, I had high expectations of this razor. Even though, it is a wet/dry razor, I noticed that it works much better only in the dry mode for my beard. I have a tough and probably also a thick beard and used to suffer from razor bumps every time after shaving with a manual razor. After I started shaving with this Panasonic razor, I noticed that it offered only slight protection against the development of razor bumps. The only advantage that I found is that it is easier to deal with razor bumps when shaving with this razor when compared to the manual razor.<br /><br />Also, while I get a really close shave on the face, this razor doesn't work very well on the neck for me. I have thick beard growing in all directions on my neck and this razor just couldn't take care of that. I have to use the sub-par trimmer of this razor to get rid of the left over beard on my neck and that is disappointing. I don't know if I could ever find a good electric razor that could offer me a close shave on my neck.<br /><br />Another disappointing issue that I have noticed is that I develop break outs on my face after using this razor. I don't know if it is the heat produced that is causing this or if my skin is too sensitive to this razor. Since, I noticed that this razor works better only in dry shaving mode, I could not test it to see if this happens in wet shaving mode also.<br /><br />Overall, a decent shaver and I doubt there are any better electric shavers in this price range. But I don't think it is suitable for giving a close shave to all kinds of beards.
  602. The only thing this is missing is internet radio. That's it! :) Best shaver I've ever owned. Very smooth. Feels like I used a blade. It appears a little bulky at first, but surprisingly comfortable in the hand and very maneuverable.
  603. Almost 5 star but its head is rather bulky and its hard to trim around accurate lines, as well as the fact that the trimmer is absolutely USELESS. Otherwise, close shave and amazing... thought I had already reviewed it... but Ill do it again. Amazing shaver. UPDATE> been two years now and have not used it every day, but at the same time have used it at least once a week and it is still awesome!
  604. Let's face it people, shaving sucks. It's messy, time wasting, sometimes painful and overall; not a good experience. I once worked a job that required daily shaving, a routine that irritated my neck to no end, especially with razors. In hopes of, pardon the pun, &#34;saving face&#34;, purchased an electric shaver. I soon realized that shaving electrically wasn't the answer to reducing irritation, it actually made it worse. Needless to say, I stopped using the electric shaver and not too long after this I quit the job. I had tried a few other electrics only to be disappointed over and over. Then, recently, I was reading reviews on electric shavers and came upon the Panasonic ES-LA93-K. Well, against my better judgement I purchased it. Turned out to be one of the best decisions I've ever made. This thing is awesome. It's so ergonomic, visually appealing, charges in one hour and lasts for weeks, is so simple to clean, and shaves, wet or dry, as good as a razor with no cuts, nicks, etc. I know I probably sound like an employee of Panasonic, but I'm not an employee, just a fan. It's a little spendy but well worth it. If I could afford to, I'd buy one of these for each of my brothers.

  619. I have owned two of these units - Panasonic ES-LA93-K. I purchased the first one in November 2011 and then its replacement in July 2014. The first unit's trimmer stopped working, and then a few weeks later the actual motor failed. Figuring it had given me the closest shave by an electronic shaver, I ordered the same model in July 2014. Most reviewers here already covered how close the shave is (it's smooooth) so I have nothing to add on that. I have two negatives however that may become apparent after six or more months.<br />The first issue is with the display panel. I like the bright blue display but after about six months the display becomes distorted and displays non-sense symbols that no longer indicate battery life, time of use, etc. This is not a deal killer for me, but I assume the problem is the result of moisture getting inside the unit. The first model I owned was used in the shower (as they advertised), and the display went bad in five or six months. The second model I used was only used at the sink and was rinsed quickly after each use - taking care not to dampen the display area, but its display still went bad after six months. So my current Panasonic still works great - but the display now reminds me of the wrist device worn by the alien in the movie Predator.<br />Another issue is the shave performance. Both shavers gave less of a close shave after about four to six months. I use the vortex cleaning system with my shaver, so I assume my beard wears down the blades and foil over time. After about a year or so, I replace the blades and/or foil. The second shaver showed signs of a drop off much sooner than the first model I owned. This just means I need to shave a little longer to get the same close shave. This might be typical, but I would expect a longer period of like-new performance from a shaver like this.<br />Still, I have to say there is no shaver out there that has performed where it counts like this one. I have used shavers from Braun and Norelco and they never shaved as close as these Panasonics. I also really like the wet/dry aspect of this shaver, but when that is claimed as a feature I expect a more water-tight product.
  620. For nearly 20 years I have always stuck with Braun- however SOOOOO glad I switched to this Panasonic shaver.<br />I found that Braun always pinched me. If I didn't shave for 2-3 days it was very uncomfortable to shave as it kept pinching making the experience very uncomfortable. As soon as I switched to this Panasonic - I found the shave to be smooth, no pinching occurring, and even if I leave shaving for a couple of days this Panasonic works a treat. No problems at all. It still shaves cleanly, quicker than the Braun and much more comfortable and smoother to the skin. I highly endorse this product and recommend that if you electric shave you switch to this product for an easier life. For years I kept sticking with the same brand for the sake of it- however I finally made the leap, and so happy I did!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

  623. I'm no professional writer, nor am I a professional shaver, but I will give you the most unbiased review I can muster. Years ago I attempted to change from my triple bladed movie star to a mechanical, more convenient method. It was a catastrophe! The electric shaver made my neck break out like a 15 year old going to the prom. I already experienced slight discomfort and razor burn from my triple bladed warrior, but refused to go electric after that experience. Since then, upset at life and the fact that, if I shaved I would break out, if I didn't shave I would get in-grown hairs. It was true, facial hair had a tight hold on me. I had to do something before I attempted (Gasp!) Nads!<br /><br />Review after review, site after site, I tirelessly scoured every chunk of data I could for all the major hitters out there. I had my heart set on a Braun, I figured with a company that strong they have to have a good product, Right? They do, I purchased it (elsewhere) and it was enjoyable. But that darn 15 year old living in my neck wanted out. Every manufacturer will tell you to give them 30 days so your face can adjust to the shaver. It never happened. Well, not that they don't make a fantastic shaver, it just wasn't the best for me. However, leaps and bounds above my first experience, so I figured there has got to be one out there that has it perfect for my sensitive..er, my 15 year old boyish neck. Insert Panasonic here. It has been close to 2 months that I have had this shaver. My skin has never forgotten to thank me. I use this bad boy every morning and have never experienced razor burn or irritation. And I use it primarily dry, it's so choice!<br /><br />Now for the technical details - I can get through a full shave in under 4 minutes. Generally, I use it all week (Mon - Fri) and THEN I put it in to be cleaned and charged. It charges very quickly, within an hour. Hence, by the time it's gone through a complete clean cycle it's charged. It has a built in pop-up shaver, but I have only used it twice. It's so difficult to get the pop-up shaver to actually pop-up that I've given up on it. I don't need it, but I can't say how effective it is since it must be defective and won't work. Enough of me jibber jabbing, I'll break it down:<br /><br />Pros:<br />Fast shave time<br />Super smooth result<br />Zero irritation<br />Contours to face<br />Comes with a on-the-go case and protective shield<br />Lock switch so it doesn't turn on in your bag or what have you<br />Battery last plenty long enough for the whole week without a charge in between.<br />Included pop-up shaver<br />Self cleaning<br /><br />Cons:<br />Pop-up shaver is a pain in the &*% to get up (Must be defective)<br />Loud when it's being cleaned<br />Doesn't make me an omelet in the morning<br /><br />All in all, if you have suffered from sensitive skin (as I do) and have held off going electric, this is your solution. This thing is amazingly close and accurate. I have literally thrown out my old razors, maybe that was a psychological move to get me to really want to love this product, but it really does work. Replacing blades is expensive, so can replacing blades on electric shavers. Additionally, there are cleaning cartridges to purchase with this unit. It sounds crazy, I know, but I will tell you that for the fact that finally, for the first time in my life, I can shave and not be embarrassed about the red headed step child screaming for attention on my neck. This was a confidence boosting, life changing decision. Get more confident, get the Panasonic Arc 4.t I have only used it twice. It's so difficult to get the pop-up shaver to actually pop-up that I've given up on it. I don't need it, but I can't say how effective it is since it must be defective and won't work. Enough of me jibber jabbing, I'll break it down:<br /><br />Pros:<br />Fast shave time<br />Super smooth result<br />Zero irritation<br />Contours to face<br />Comes with a on-the-go case and protective shield<br />Lock switch so it doesn't turn on in your bag or what have you<br />Battery last plenty long enough for the whole week without a charge in between.<br />Included pop-up shaver<br />Self cleaning<br /><br />Cons:<br />Pop-up shaver is a pain in the &*% to get up (Must be defective)<br />Loud when it's being cleaned<br />Doesn't make me an omelet in the morning<br /><br />All in all, if you have suffered from sensitive skin (as I do) and have held off going electric, this is your solution.   630. This shaver gives me the best shave from an electric that I have ever experienced. I just retired my six year old Braun Pulsonic 9595 and the Panasonic shave is closer with less effort. This Shaver feels a bit bulky at first but you quickly get use to it. It is lightweight compared to the Braun, but seems well built. It seems to conform to facial contours better. You do not need to apply a lot of pressure to get a close shave and there is no irritation. I have tried a wet and dry shave and there is no substantial difference in closeness. The cleaning station sounds a bit clanky when cleaning but it does a thorough job. I like that it uses water and detergent rather than alcohol based solution. The cleaning cartridges are very inexpensive and are supposed to last 30 cleanings. I have a thick beard and a shave takes me about 5 minutes with this shaver which is about half the time it took with the Braun Pulsonic. I recommend this and would purchase it again.<br />The shaver is also easy to clean manually under running water so you can also buy the model without the cleaning station if you wish. He always has a red and irritated face afterwards but it does not seem to bother him. His cleaning and charging station developed a bad case of mildew or mold that made the bathroom stink when the dryer fan ran. In fact, the shave on my neck became horrible after the second replacement with long hairs being completely ignored.<br /><br />Then, to cap it all off, the display has now begun to show incorrect readings such as 4:88 for the time of the shave and battery life left at 28% after only one shave from a full recharge.
