  639. Well, first off, this shaver shaves better than any other electric shaver I've ever used. I've owned many high-end electric shavers over the years, and I've had my Panasonic for slightly less than two years. Before the ES-LA93, I owned a Braun Series 7 shaver. But the Panasonic has been a big disappointment, and rather than buying replacement cutter blocks and foil (which are due), I'll likely replace the unit with a Philips Norelco 1280X.<br /><br />For starters, soon after I got my ES-LA93, the cleaning function on the cleaning/charging unit stopped working. It wasn't worth the trouble to deal with the warranty, so I simply rinsed the unit after each use and put it in the charging station in order to dry it and recharge the unit. However, unlike the Braun, the Panasonic charging station won't automatically select cleaning or drying mode. This means, often (when I forget to hit the button on the charging station), the razor is cold and clammy during the next use. Not very nice.<br /><br />As well, for some reason, Panasonic designers saw fit to equip the ES-LA93 with a blindingly bright blue LED display that blinks whenever the razor is in the charging station. This LED is so bright that it is easily seen in our bedroom through the bathroom door. That's very annoying when you're trying to go to sleep.<br /><br />Also, the power switch is designed such that you will often hit it while you're shaving, which will shut the unit off. As a result, I often have to turn the unit back on several times during a shaving session.<br /><br />So, while the ES-LA93 does shave very well, it's other \\"features\\" make for a very annoying daily experience, and I wouldn't recommend it.

  645. I switched from straight razors (Gillette Mach III Turbo) nearly two years ago after hearing a commercial for Panasonic's new expensive electric shavers that were supposed to rival a straight shave. I went out and bought the 4-blade ES-LA63 model which I have been using steadily ever since.<br /><br />Now, I recently upgraded to the 5-Blade ES, attracted to the claims that 5 blades will give even a better shave. At the time of purchase, the LA93K with cleaning system was only $5 more than the LV81 without, so you can guess which one I bought. I really didn't need a cleaning system since I had gotten used to manually cleaning my 4-blade ES-LA63 by running it under the faucet with some soft soap. For $5 more I am not complaining.<br /><br />I am going to talk to all of you about what it's like switching from a straight razor to an electric, just in case you are contemplating doing so.<br /><br />First thing I need to say is that nothing does as an outstanding shaving job as a straight razor. While an electric razor can can give you the same perfectly smooth shave that the straight razor provides, it does have flaws.<br /><br />What these Panasonic electric shavers will provide you with is a shave that is undistinguishable from a straight razor. In fact, upon completing your shave and running your hand across your face, you would swear that you just shaved with a razor. The problem? The neck area is almost impossible to perfectly clean. This is a common problem with any electric razor. You will find that there are just small patches on the neck that will never be clean shaven, and thus, touchups may be required from a straight razor.<br /><br />Additionally, for those sick of paying the costs of straight razors, I am uncertain that buying a $300+ Electric Razor is really saving you money considering that the blades and foil need replacing every so often and they don't come cheap.<br /><br />That being said, there is a real joy to shaving with an electric over a straight razor. First, you rarely cut yourself. As much as I love a brand-new straight razor, I hate the inevitable \\"nick\\" that comes with it. The only time you will cut your face with an electric razor is if you apply too much force, and really, it's almost impossible to do. Secondly, you have the freedom to move the electric razor head across your face in any direction you want, as quickly as you need, without fear of hurting yourself.<br /><br />The best part of using this Panasonic electric razor? Using it wet. It actually gives you a much better shave if you wet your face with warm water and apply shaving cream. If you want the best stuff to use with this razor, I highly recommend Remington KING OF SHAVES gel. You only need a small dollop of the stuff, but it really does an outstanding job of shaving your face without gunking the razor. It leaves your face so amazingly smooth you'll be touching it with disbelief all day. And with these gels, you won't even need after shave. Try the Menthol. Really gives a nice kick to your shave.<br /><br />If you use the razor dry, I would recommend applying pre-electric shave beforehand. It really makes a difference.<br /><br />Just don't expect shaving miracles the first few weeks you switch from a straight razor to an electric. You'll find a note in the box from Panasonic telling you that great things take time. They aren't kidding. Your face needs to adapt to the electric razor. It will take your face at least two weeks (if not more) to adjust the new shaving method and only then will you see optimal results. I went from a 6-minute shave to one just under 4 minutes. That is how much my face has adapted to the Panasonic razor over the years. So, the more you use it, the quicker your shave will be over time.<br /><br />After two years of going with an electric, I don't miss blades at all. In fact, I don't want to go back to them.<br /><br />Battery goes down about 10% for every shave (mine is averageof 4.5 minutes tops). Therefor, expect about 10-12 shaves from a full to charge to having to recharge.<br /><br />Is the 5-blade Panasonic better than the 4-blade? The answer is, slightly. The 5-blade seems slightly more refined. It's quieter, for one. It does seem to shave my face faster than the 4-blade, but only by mere seconds.<br /><br />The charging/cleaning system is nice. It has a magnet that holds the razor in place while it charges. The downside is, you need to buy cleaning cartridges once the included one runs out. If you buy the same razor without the cleaning system it's quite easy to clean under a faucet and the application of soft soap.<br /><br />Is this 5-blade razor worth over $300? Well, if you have the money to spend, then yes. This truly is the Cadillac of electric razors. Once you start using it, you won't want to shave with anything cheaper. Just realize that as close a shave as these babies give (and it can be as close as a razor), it will have problems reaching areas of the neck. This means that you won't be able to really give up that straight razor after all.of 4.5 minutes tops). Therefor, expect about 10-12 shaves from a full to charge to having to recharge.<br /><br />Is the 5-blade Panasonic better than the 4-blade? The answer is, slightly. The 5-blade seems slightly more refined. It's quieter, for one. It does seem to shave my face faster than the 4-blade, but only by mere seconds.<br /><br />The charging/cleaning system is nice. It has a magnet that holds the razor in place while it charges. The downside is, you need to buy cleaning cartridges once the included one runs out. If you buy the same razor without the cleaning system it's quite easy to clean under a faucet and the application of soft soap.<br /><br />Is this 5-blade razor worth over $300? Well, if you have the money to spend, then yes. This truly is the Cadillac of electric razors. Once you start using it, you won't want to shave with anything cheaper. Just realize that as close a shave as these babies give (and it can be as close as a razor), it will have problems reaching areas of the neck. This means that you won't be able to really give up that straight razor after all.
  646. I've been using this shaver for about 1.5 years now. It is, without compare, the best shave I've ever gotten. Before this I had tried multiple electrics (foil and rotary) and several wet razors, each combined with any type of lather, pre-shave, and post-shave lotions, creams, etc I could find.<br /><br />I don't know if it's because my beard comes in at so many different angles, or if my skin is just that sensitive, but I always ended up with lots of bumps, bloody spots, and serious burning and itch. It was impossible to shave every day because the rash from the previous day was always so bad, and I was lucky if I could shave two days after.<br /><br />When I switched to this shaver it was a little rough for the first few weeks. I still got some burn as my skin/beard adjusted to it, but no where as bad. Maybe by week three I was doing just fine though, and it didn't take long to be able to shave every day without any burn. I still use an alcohol based pre-shave, but that's more to get the hairs to stand up a bit better. I still get a little burn every once in a while, but that's usually if I haven't shaved in a few days. Still no where near the burn as anything previous.<br /><br />I usually shave twice a week (just due to laziness), and it takes me ~3.5-4.5 minutes. When I did shave daily it was a pretty quick 2 minute shave. This morning I hadn't shaved in about 5 days and it took a bit over 7 minutes. I'd say I've got a pretty average thickness to my beard, so if you've got a heavy beard I imagine it would take a bit longer. I haven't kept track of how long the battery lasts, but at that rate it's over a month. I don't feel like I have to charge it that often.<br /><br />I pretty much just use the dock to charge the shaver. For daily use I just take the foil off, rinse it, and let it air dry. To clean I just add some soap to the blades, put the foil back on, and let it do its 20 second self clean deal. When I did use the dock for cleaning it cleaned the device well, I just haven't ordered more of the soap that goes with it. I'd probably suggest getting the ES-LA63-S if you're not going to use the dock.<br /><br />TL;DR - Great shaver for sensitive skin, you won't go back to anything else.
  647. Works perfect as rated, though you have to have a little patience for your face get used to it....
  648. I love this shaver its my second one and I'm buying another because I travel and like to have one in my bag and one at home. Excellent shaving quality and of course it cleans up easily when its washed. Highly recommended but watch the price because I paid less than $150 USD and its often selling for $200. Very good product in my opinion.
  649. First electric shaver that has actually worked for me. 3 weeks on, still at 30% charge, every day, and my old tough beard. I have been cleaning without the built in by using a previous brush, but so far so good. No burn like others, glides over the face and my bad chin as smooth as the single edge I was using previously. The battery life though seems to be astounding. At 3 weeks I still have some left. My average shave time is about 1 minute to scrape over jaws and chin good. First one that has ever even gotten me to write a review. Haven't tried built in cleaning yet, has been no need to.

  654. My review may be skewed slightly as my previous electric shaver was a 10 year old Braun model. This electric shaver is fantastic! It doesn't pull any hairs which is nice. While it's not quite as close as a regular razor, it is pretty darn close, and it doesn't irritate my skin like regular razor does. I have owned this for several months now, and still every time I use it I'm amazed on how nice of a shave it gives.<br /><br />The cleaning base is a little noisy, but from what I hear pretty much every brand is close to the same noise level. Being able to clean it under the faucet is a nice touch when I travel with it, so I don't need to pack the bulky base. All in all this is an amazing electric shaver.

  658. My ES883's (the best electric razor) battery died and is not replaceable. I was hoping that Panasonic had made some advances in men's electric shaving, but the Panasonic ES-LA93-K is not it. It is a good razor, but I prefer the ES-883. I don't understand the need for the cleaner, it is a wet or dry razor, just rinse it in water after use. What a gimmick. I don't understand the pivoting head either. Another gimmick. My wrist can take care of that as well. Basically, whatever I do with my wrist to maneuver the razor, it is countered by the pivoting head of the razor. The razor head is humungous compared to the ES-883 and does not shave any better. So far each time I have used the ES-LA93-K after 3 days of not shaving, I have gotten bumps afterwords. Possibly hair bumps or an ingrown hair from the razor pulling the hair too far before it cuts it. The side-burn cutter is useless. My side-burn hair is coarse. The razor seems to glide over the hair instead of cutting it. It does not shave as close as a blade, but you can get a smooth shave if you keep at it long enough. For me to get a smooth shave, it takes about 7 to 8 minutes constantly shaving, turning the razor, and pulling the skin over the same places to get the hard to get stubs. It is a good razor, worth buying, but get rid of the gimmicks.

  662. I like this shaver a lot, but when the cleaning unit failed I was directed to send it back to a repair place in McAllen, TX. The end result was that I discovered there is NO repair facility, just an exchange service whereby you must return the entire product: shaver, cord and cleaning unit for exchange. On present experience this will take about three weeks with no logical explanation of how you are meant to shave in the interim! - just go and buy another shaver, I guess...I am now waiting for the return of my cleaning unit after sitting around their premises for eleven days and I must then return all components for exchange - no refunds permitted even under warranty. I'll have to acquire another shaver since I don't plan on growing a beard and maybe I'll just stay with that one going forward. Nice way to keep your customers happy, Panasonic!
  663. I've had many electric shavers over the years (norelco, braun, etc.) and was always skeptical about the shave quality. I did a lot of research and found this Shaver. When used wet with a lite coating of shave gel, this shaver actually gets closer than my Gillette 4 Blade razor! The trick is the gel and using it wet. For dry shaves, razors are still closer. My only complaints center around the layout of the cleaning unit. The unit is not as nice as the Braun models. It has a status light which really doesn't tell you what it's statusing. There is a decision tree in the manual which makes absolutely NO sense. However, the cleaning unit does work very well; if you don't mind the drying fan being on for 2 hours. The other thing is that when it's fully charged the entire display on the unit flashes continuously in bright blue, so in order to get to sleep, you need to take it out of the cleaning unit, unless you don't mind the strobe light effect or your bathroom is far removed from your bedroom. A small flashing or non-flashing light indicating that the unit is fully charged makes mores sense to me. Overall, I highly recommend this shaver. It's a little pricey, but so are those $4 gillette razor cartridges!<br /><br />UPDATE AT 5 MONTHS - The base unit no longer functions. It doesn't circulate water and cleaning solution. There is no apparent blockage, it must be the pump. Called customer service and they informed me that the base doesn't carry the replacement warranty like the shaver! I have to return the base AND the shaver, at my own expense, and wait for repairs! THINK I'LL JUST FORGET THE BASE AND USE THE SHAVER WITHOUT IT. Good customer service would have sent me a new base in the mail sight unseen! So much for Panasonic! Still love the shaver itself though. Hope it lasts as long as my Braun!

It's much more comfortable than my previous razor, especially in areas that tend to annoy me, like the upper lip or around the adam's apple.<br /><br />The second thing I noticed is that clean cycle leaves it looking new. The Braun system, even with a brand new cleaning cartridge, always left at least some residue. The Panasonic system appears to work much better. You cannot tell it was used to shave once it's finished.<br /><br />The third thing I noticed is the insufferable blue blinking when it's done charging. Other reviewers have commented on this and it's really a design oversight. Do I need my razor to blink at me every two seconds for infinity just to indicate it's gone from 90% to 100% charged? No. No, I do not. I will overlook this flaw since I'm so happy with it otherwise.<br /><br />I had some Kiehl's shaving lotion laying around that I'd never used, so I gave it a shot this morning. I've never experienced a wet shave with an electric razor before. Panasonic says to give any shaving method three weeks to get your face used to it. I'm already blown away by how nice it feels, and it's only going to get better? Yeah, this was a good purchase.

  687. I purchased this razor two years ago, after purchasing Panasonic's women's razor and finding it woefully lacking.<br />The ES-LA93-K was the top of the line Panasonic shaver for men and is leagues ahead.<br />It's held up well and has a long enough battery life to shave legs and armpits (10+ minutes) - which couldn't be said for the women's model.<br /><br />I have pale sensitive skin and dark hair that grows fast. Regular shaving doesn't work well for me, because the next day I need to shave again, but can't without seriously injuring/irritating my skin. However, with this electric shaver the problem is solved. It is very gentle on my skin and I've experienced very few irritations. Something that used to be a constant source of stress and distress for me has become something I rarely think about - this device makes it easy and painless to shave.<br /><br />I am also very nearsighted, so I used to have trouble shaving since I couldn't see what I was doing in the shower. I picked this Panasonic shaver since it was wet/dry, and I use it about half the time wet and half dry. It's much safer than a regular razor, so even in the shower I don't have to worry about injuring myself.<br /><br />If I were purchasing again, I might skip the cleaning module. I rarely use it. It works well but is noisy and takes forever and can't come on trips with you.<br /><br />The latest model sounds even better, though I have no excuse to upgrade since my current (and costly) shaver is still going strong! The main issue I have with it is it can't handle longer hairs well, but luckily it has a tiny trimmer on the back which can cut the long hairs down to a length the shaver can handle. The latest model has \\"lift\\" technology which might help with this. Another option might be to have 2 devices - one trimmer and this shaver.<br /><br />Hopefully this helps any women who are wondering if this device would work well for them. I strongly recommend purchasing a men's model over the pink cheap women's model. The men's model(s) are better in every way for any use a woman could have for it. It is too bad Panasonic only markets this to men and sells a piece of junk for women, but I'm glad that the women's model attracted my attention to electric shaving as I have become a huge fan.<br /><br />A great shaving cream that works well with this is Dr. Bronner's Shikakai Shaving gel [[ASIN:B006NYTWLU Organic Shaving Gel Naked Unscented Dr. Bronner's 7 oz Gel]] - it comes in unscented and several natural scents.
